original: ci'i phyir sems bcu drug skyes la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sems bcu drug skyes la /
translated: Why are the sixteen moments of mind generated?

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa lnga spangs kyang rgyun du zhugs pa nyid ces bya la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa lnga spangs kyang rgyun du zhugs pa nyid ces bya la /
translated: Why is one called an enterer to the result of stream entry when five types of affliction are abandoned?

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes mi bya zhe na /🔽gang gi phyir /🔽'bras gnas 'bras bu khyad par gyi //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes mi bya zhe na / gang gi phyir / 'bras gnas 'bras bu khyad par gyi //
translated: Why is one not called an enterer to the result of once return?🔽Because abiders in the result do not obtain

original: lam thob med pas de yi phyir /🔽'bras gnas khyad par can gyi phyir //
analyzed: lam thob med pas de yi phyir / 'bras gnas khyad par can gyi phyir //
translated: the path that is the result of a distinct stage.

original: mi brtson pa ni zhugs ma yin //🔽'bras bu thob pa 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam mi thob pa de ltar nges pas de'i phyir 'bras bu la gnas pa ji srid du 'bras bu khyad par can du bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu gzhan thob pa la rab tu mi sbyor ba de srid du
analyzed: mi brtson pa ni zhugs ma yin // 'bras bu thob pa 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam mi thob pa de ltar nges pas de'i phyir 'bras bu la gnas pa ji srid du 'bras bu khyad par can du bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu gzhan thob pa la rab tu mi sbyor ba de srid du
translated: Because they abide in the result, they are not enterers.🔽Because abiders in the result do not obtain the path that is the result of a distinct stage, they are not enterers to the result of once return.🔽Because they abide in the result, they are not enterers.

original: zhugs ba zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: zhugs ba zhes mi bya ste /
translated: As long as they do not apply themselves to obtaining another result in order to make that result distinct, they are not called enterers.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu gzhan dag la yang rig @223b par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu gzhan dag la yang rig @223b par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in the same way for other results.

original: gang zhig bsam gtan gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral bas 'og ma la brten te nges par 'jug na ni /
analyzed: gang zhig bsam gtan gsum pa las 'dod chags dang bral bas 'og ma la brten te nges par 'jug na ni /
translated: If one definitely enters the third absorption by being free from attachment to the third absorption and relying on a lower level,

original: de gdon mi za bar 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam mngon du byed do //
analyzed: de gdon mi za bar 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam mngon du byed do //
translated: then without doubt one manifests the special path of the result.

original: de lta ma yin na de'i gong du skyes na bde ba'i dbang po dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de'i gong du skyes na bde ba'i dbang po dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if one were born in a higher level, one would not possess the faculty of pleasure.

original: re zhig phal cher las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi nges par 'jug ba'i gang zag gi rnam par gzhag ba ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: re zhig phal cher las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi nges par 'jug ba'i gang zag gi rnam par gzhag ba ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is the presentation of persons who definitely enter the third absorption who are free from attachment to most of the third absorption and free from attachment to the desire realm.

original: da ni rim gyis 'jug pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni rim gyis 'jug pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now we will discuss the order of entry.

original: de'i phyir re zhig 'di rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig 'di rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore this should be presented first.🔽Just as the nine levels of affliction of the desire realm are explained,

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu po de dag bstan pa de bzhin du /🔽sa dang sa la nyes rnam dgu //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu po de dag bstan pa de bzhin du / sa dang sa la nyes rnam dgu //
translated: so too the levels

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the summit of existence have nine levels of affliction.🔽As are the faults,

original: nyes pa rnams ni ji lta bar //
analyzed: nyes pa rnams ni ji lta bar //
translated: so too are the qualities.

original: de bzhin du ni yon tan rnams //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni yon tan rnams //
translated: So too, the qualities🔽are ninefold on each stage.

original: sa dang sa la de'i gnyen po bar chad med pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba yon tan gyi rnam pa dag kyang dgu dgu kho na'o //
analyzed: sa dang sa la de'i gnyen po bar chad med pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba yon tan gyi rnam pa dag kyang dgu dgu kho na'o //
translated: So too, the qualities of the stages are ninefold on each stage.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: chung dang 'bring dang che rnams kyi //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang che rnams kyi //
translated: The small, medium, and great

original: chung ngu la sogs tha dad phyir //🔽chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po ste /
analyzed: chung ngu la sogs tha dad phyir // chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po ste /
translated: are divided into small and so on.🔽The three fundamental aspects are small, medium, and great.

original: rtsa ba'i rnam pa gsum po de dag las re re zhing yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po rnam pa gsum tha dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rnam pa gsum po de dag las re re zhing yang chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po rnam pa gsum tha dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Each of those three fundamental aspects is divided into three aspects small, medium, and great.

original: dgur rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: dgur rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: They are posited as nine.

original: 'di lta ste chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pa dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / chen po'i 'bring dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pa dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / chen po'i 'bring dang /
translated: They are the aspect of small of small, the aspect of medium of small, the aspect of great of small, the aspect of small of medium, the aspect of medium of medium, the aspect of great of medium, the aspect of small of great, the aspect of medium of great, and the aspect of great of great.

original: chen po'i chen po'i rnam pa'o //🔽de la lam chung ngu'i chung dus ni nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po spong la /
analyzed: chen po'i chen po'i rnam pa'o // de la lam chung ngu'i chung dus ni nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po spong la /
translated: The weak-weak path is the antidote to the strong-strong affliction.

original: de bzhin du lam chen po'i chen pos ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu spong pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du lam chen po'i chen pos ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu spong pa'i bar du ste /
translated: The strong-strong path is the antidote to the weak-weak affliction.🔽The strong-strong path cannot arise first, because it is impossible for a strong affliction to arise first.

original: dang po kho nar lam chen po skye mi srid pa'i phyir ba dang / skyes nas ni nyon mongs pa chen po mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po kho nar lam chen po skye mi srid pa'i phyir ba dang / skyes nas ni nyon mongs pa chen po mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And once it has arisen, it is impossible for a strong affliction to arise.

original: dper na gos la dri ma che long ni sngar 'khrul /
analyzed: dper na gos la dri ma che long ni sngar 'khrul /
translated: For example, the coarse stains on a piece of cloth are washed away first,🔽and the subtle stains are washed away later.

original: phra mo ni phyis 'khru ba dang / mun pa che long ni sgron ma chung ngus sel la /
analyzed: phra mo ni phyis 'khru ba dang / mun pa che long ni sgron ma chung ngus sel la /
translated: The coarse darkness is removed by a small lamp,

original: mun pa phra mo ni sgron ma chen pos sel ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mun pa phra mo ni sgron ma chen pos sel ba lta bu'o //
translated: and the subtle darkness is removed by a large lamp.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu po de dag las thams cad du /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu po de dag las thams cad du /
translated: From among those nine aspects of affliction,🔽those who abide in the result of nonreturner

original: bsgom pas spang bya ma spangs pa'i //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bya ma spangs pa'i //
translated: who have not abandoned objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation

original: 'bras gnas re ltar thogs srid bdun //
analyzed: 'bras gnas re ltar thogs srid bdun //
translated: can be hindered from attaining nirvana for up to seven existences.

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa gang zhig bsgom las spang bar bya ba'i @224a * //
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa gang zhig bsgom las spang bar bya ba'i @224a * //
translated: One who is a once-returner is a result-abiding abider who has not abandoned even one type of affliction to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig kyang ma spangs pa de ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin la tshe bdun gyi bar du 'khor ba nas srid pa lan bdun pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig kyang ma spangs pa de ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin la tshe bdun gyi bar du 'khor ba nas srid pa lan bdun pa'o //
translated: One who is a stream enterer is one who has not abandoned even one type of affliction to be abandoned by the path of meditation and who will take rebirth in cyclic existence for seven existences at most.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa thams cad ni srid pa lan bdun pa ma yin bas re ltar thogs na zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi tha shal ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa thams cad ni srid pa lan bdun pa ma yin bas re ltar thogs na zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi tha shal ba'o //
translated: Since not all stream enterers take rebirth for seven existences at most, the Abhidharmakosa states, At most, they take rebirth in the desire realm for seven existences.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyun ni lam mo //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyun ni lam mo //
translated: The stream of nirvana is the path.

original: de nas der 'gro ba'i phyir de der zhugs pa'am 'ongs pa'am phyin pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas der 'gro ba'i phyir de der zhugs pa'am 'ongs pa'am phyin pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa'o //
translated: One who enters that stream, who goes there, who has come or arrived there is a stream enterer.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag na re de ni de las gzhan pa'i skye ba'i srid pa bdun dang // srid pa bar ma bdun du mi rnams kyi nang du nying mtshams sbyor bar byed la /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag na re de ni de las gzhan pa'i skye ba'i srid pa bdun dang // srid pa bar ma bdun du mi rnams kyi nang du nying mtshams sbyor bar byed la /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: They take rebirth in the desire realm for seven existences other than that and in seven intermediate existences.

original: de bzhin du lha dag gi nang du yang nying mtshams sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du lha dag gi nang du yang nying mtshams sbyor bar byed de /
translated: They take rebirth among humans and similarly they take rebirth among gods.

original: de ltar na srid pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi bar du nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na srid pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad kyi bar du nying mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, he is reborn up to twenty-eight times.

original: srid pa bdun pa'i spyi yin pa'i phyir re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: srid pa bdun pa'i spyi yin pa'i phyir re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa zhes bshad de /
translated: Since he is a general rule for seven existences, he is called at most a seven-times-at-most.

original: gnas bdun la mkhas pa zhes bya ba dang / shing 'dab ma bdun pa zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnas bdun la mkhas pa zhes bya ba dang / shing 'dab ma bdun pa zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is like the expression skilled in the seven subjects and the expression seven-leaved tree.

original: re zhig de ltar na 'bras bu la gnas pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma spangs pa ni re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar na 'bras bu la gnas pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma spangs pa ni re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the one abiding in the fruit who has not abandoned the objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation is at most a seven-times-at-most.

original: rnam gsum gnyis las rnam grol ba //
analyzed: rnam gsum gnyis las rnam grol ba //
translated: The once-returner who is liberated from two or three stages

original: tshe gnyis gsum du rigs nas rigs //
analyzed: tshe gnyis gsum du rigs nas rigs //
translated: is born into two or three families and is then liberated.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa de nyid rgyu gsum gyis na rigs nas rigs su skye ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa de nyid rgyu gsum gyis na rigs nas rigs su skye ba yin te /
translated: That very stream enterer who is liberated from two or three stages is born into two or three families and is then liberated.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa las ni rnam pa gsum mam bzhi spangs ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa las ni rnam pa gsum mam bzhi spangs ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He is liberated from two or three stages because he abandons three or four types of affliction.

original: dbang po las ni de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang po thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po las ni de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang po thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is due to the faculties because one obtains the uncontaminated faculties that are their antidote.

original: skye ba las ni tshe gcig gam gnyis shig lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba las ni tshe gcig gam gnyis shig lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is due to rebirth because one has one or two rebirths remaining.

original: tshigs su bcad pa bshad pa ni nang du gnyis shig smos pa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa phyis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa dang de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang po thob pa ni ma smos kyang grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa bshad pa ni nang du gnyis shig smos pa ni rgyun tu zhugs pa phyis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa dang de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang po thob pa ni ma smos kyang grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The two that are mentioned in the verse are the once-returner who abandons afflictions later and the one who obtains the uncontaminated faculties that are their antidote, but they are not mentioned because they are already established.

original: rigs nas rigs su skyes pa ni lha'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba dang / mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba'o //
analyzed: rigs nas rigs su skyes pa ni lha'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba dang / mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba'o //
translated: One who is born in the same class means one who is born in the same class of gods or the same class of humans.

original: de la lha'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba ni lha rnams kyi nang du rigs gnyis sam gsum du 'khor nas lha'i ris de nyid dam /🔽gzhan dag tu yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la lha'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba ni lha rnams kyi nang du rigs gnyis sam gsum du 'khor nas lha'i ris de nyid dam /🔽gzhan dag tu yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, one who is born in the same class of gods is one who transmigrates to two or three classes of gods and then attains nirvana in that class of gods or another.🔽One who is born in the same class of humans is one who transmigrates to two or three classes of humans and then attains nirvana in that class of humans or another.

original: mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba ni mi rnams kyi nang du nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i gling de nyid dam gzhan dag tu rigs gnyis sam gsum du @224b 'khor nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba ni mi rnams kyi nang du nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i gling de nyid dam gzhan dag tu rigs gnyis sam gsum du @224b 'khor nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: One who is born in the human plane of existence and who obtains nirvana in the same plane of existence or in another plane of existence, after having transmigrated two or three times among humans, is called a once-returner.🔽The same person who is a candidate for the second fruit

original: yang / 'bras bu la gnas pa de nyid //
analyzed: yang / 'bras bu la gnas pa de nyid //
translated: is also a candidate for the second fruit

original: rnam pa lnga yi bar bcom pa //🔽gnyis pa lan zhugs pa'ang yin //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga yi bar bcom pa // gnyis pa lan zhugs pa'ang yin //
translated: when he has destroyed from one to five categories.

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig nas lnga'i bar du spangs pa gang yin pa de nyid ni gnyis pa la zhugs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig nas lnga'i bar du spangs pa gang yin pa de nyid ni gnyis pa la zhugs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The same person who is a candidate for the second fruit, i.e., for the fruit of the once-returner, is also a candidate for the second fruit when he has destroyed from one to five categories of defilements of the realm of desire.

original: rnam pa drug pa zad gyur pa //
analyzed: rnam pa drug pa zad gyur pa //
translated: The one who has destroyed the sixth category

original: de ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba //
analyzed: de ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba //
translated: is a once-returner.

original: de ni 'bras bu gnyis pa thob pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu gnyis pa thob pa yin te /
translated: He has obtained the second fruit.

original: lan cig lha'i nang du song nas mi'i 'jig rten du 'ong la //
analyzed: lan cig lha'i nang du song nas mi'i 'jig rten du 'ong la //
translated: He will return only once to the human world and then will obtain nirvana.

original: de phan chad ni skye ba med pa'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de phan chad ni skye ba med pa'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong ba ma yin no //
translated: He is not a once-returner beyond that, because he is not reborn.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams bsrabs pa'i phyir yang lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams bsrabs pa'i phyir yang lan cig phyir 'ong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: He is called a “once-returner” because his attachment, hatred, and ignorance have been reduced,

original: chung ngu'i rnam ba lus ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chung ngu'i rnam ba lus ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because their intensity has been weakened.

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa de nyid //
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa de nyid //
translated: The same person who is a “dweller in the fruit”

original: nyes cha bdun dang brgyad zad pa //🔽tshe gcig bar chad gcig pa dang // gsum pa la ni zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes cha bdun dang brgyad zad pa // tshe gcig bar chad gcig pa dang // gsum pa la ni zhugs pa'o //
translated: is a “one-intervaller” when he has destroyed seven or eight categories.🔽He is a candidate for the third fruit when he is in the path of cultivation.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba de nyid rgyu gsum gyis na bar chad gcig pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba de nyid rgyu gsum gyis na bar chad gcig pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The same person who is a “dweller in the fruit” of the once-returner is a “one-intervaller” for three reasons:

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa bdun dang brgyad spangs pa dang / de'i gnyen po dbang thob pa dang / tshe gcig lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa bdun dang brgyad spangs pa dang / de'i gnyen po dbang thob pa dang / tshe gcig lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he has abandoned seven or eight categories of defilements; he has obtained the faculties which are opposed to these defilements; he has only one birth remaining.

original: bar chad ces bya ba ni bar du gcod par byed pa ste /🔽de yang mya ngan las 'das pa la tshe gcig gis chod pa'i phyir ba'am /
analyzed: bar chad ces bya ba ni bar du gcod par byed pa ste / de yang mya ngan las 'das pa la tshe gcig gis chod pa'i phyir ba'am /
translated: “Intervaller” means “who interrupts”🔽because he is separated from Nirvāṇa by one birth,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig gis chod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig gis chod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because he is separated from the fruit of non-returner by only one category of defilement.

original: 'di'i bar chad gcig yin pas na bar chad gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i bar chad gcig yin pas na bar chad gcig pa'o //
translated: It is called “having one separation” because it has one separation.

original: rnam pa bdun dang brgyad spangs pa de ni gsum pa la zhugs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun dang brgyad spangs pa de ni gsum pa la zhugs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the one who has abandoned seven or eight categories is the one who has entered the third.

original: sngar nyon mongs pa spangs shing 'bras bu thob pa ni ji srid du 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam mngon du ma byas pa de srid du rigs nas rigs su skye ba'am /
analyzed: sngar nyon mongs pa spangs shing 'bras bu thob pa ni ji srid du 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam mngon du ma byas pa de srid du rigs nas rigs su skye ba'am /
translated: The one who has previously abandoned the defilements and acquired the fruit is not of the family to family or of the once-returner as long as he has not actualized the path of the second fruit.

original: bar chad gcig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bar chad gcig pa ma yin no //
translated: He is not one who has one separation.

original: de dgu zad pas phyir mi 'ong //🔽'bras bu la gnas pa de nyid nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu spangs pa las phyir mi 'ong ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dgu zad pas phyir mi 'ong // 'bras bu la gnas pa de nyid nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dgu spangs pa las phyir mi 'ong ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The non-returner is the one who has abandoned nine categories.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su phyir mi 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su phyir mi 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should know that the one who has abandoned nine categories of defilements is a non-returner, because he does not return to the realm of desire.

original: de ni bar skyes 'du byed dang // 'du byed med par mya ngan 'da' //🔽gang du 'pho ba'o //
analyzed: de ni bar skyes 'du byed dang // 'du byed med par mya ngan 'da' // gang du 'pho ba'o //
translated: He is of three types: the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the interval, the one who obtains nirvāṇa by being born, and the one who obtains nirvāṇa without effort.

original: 'dir bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas na bar mdor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas na bar mdor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
translated: The one who obtains nirvāṇa in the interval is the one who obtains nirvāṇa after being reborn in the intermediate existence.🔽The one who obtains nirvāṇa by being born is the one who obtains nirvāṇa after being reborn in the realm of form.🔽The one who obtains nirvāṇa without effort is the one who obtains nirvāṇa through the mere presence of the faculties that he has obtained.

original: de bzhin du skyes pa dang / 'du byed pa dang / 'du byed pa med par @225a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du skyes pa dang / 'du byed pa dang / 'du byed pa med par @225a * //
translated: Likewise, it is not the case that it is produced, compounded, or uncompounded.🔽

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la yang sbyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la yang sbyang bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, there is parinirvana without exertion and with exertion.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba de nyid rnam pa lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba de nyid rnam pa lngar 'gyur te /
translated: The nonreturners are of five types:🔽those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, those who attain nirvana as soon as they are born, those who attain nirvana with effort, those who attain nirvana without effort and those who go to the highest.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni srid pa bar mar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni srid pa bar mar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state are those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state of existence.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes pa tsam las mi 'chi bar phung po dang bcas ba'i mya ngan las 'da' bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes pa tsam las mi 'chi bar phung po dang bcas ba'i mya ngan las 'da' bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Those who attain nirvana as soon as they are born are those who attain nirvana by means of nirvana that possesses the basis of the aggregates without dying immediately after birth.

original: mngon par brtson pa dang / lam nyams 'og tu chud pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa dang / lam nyams 'og tu chud pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called those who attain nirvana with effort and those who attain nirvana without effort because they attain nirvana through effort and without effort.🔽Those who go to the highest are those who go to the highest realm of Akaniṣṭha.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes nas sbyor ba ma btang zhing mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes nas sbyor ba ma btang zhing mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin ba ste /
translated: One who attains nirvana through exertion is one who attains nirvana through exertion after birth, without abandoning the practice.

original: mngon par brtson pa'i lam nyams 'og tu ma chud pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa'i lam nyams 'og tu ma chud pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has not mastered the path of exertion.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa med bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa med bar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: One who attains nirvana without exertion is one who attains nirvana without exertion.

original: mngon par brtson pa dang lam nyams 'og tu chud pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa dang lam nyams 'og tu chud pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has not mastered the path of exertion.

original: gong du 'pho ba ni gang du skyes pa de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gong du 'gro ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba ni gang du skyes pa de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gong du 'gro ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: One who goes upstream is one who does not attain nirvana in the very place where he is born, but goes upstream.

original: 'pho ba dang 'gro ba ni don gcig go //
analyzed: 'pho ba dang 'gro ba ni don gcig go //
translated: Going and going have the same meaning.

original: de dag ni /
analyzed: de dag ni /
translated: They are:🔽One who goes to the Highest

original: bsam gtan spel nas 'og min 'gro //
analyzed: bsam gtan spel nas 'og min 'gro //
translated: Through increasing the absorptions.

original: gang du 'pho ba de ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gang du 'pho ba de ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who transfer to higher levels are of two types: those who go to the peak of existence and those who go to the highest limit of the form realm.

original: rgyu'i sgo nas ni bsam gtan spel ma dang spel ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i sgo nas ni bsam gtan spel ma dang spel ma ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first are of two types: those who alternate and those who do not alternate the absorptions.

original: 'bras bu'i sgo nas ni 'og min dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sgo nas ni 'og min dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The second are of two types: those who go to Akaniṣṭha and those who go to the summit of existence.

original: de la gang gis bsam gtan spel mar bsgoms pa de ni 'og min du song nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: de la gang gis bsam gtan spel mar bsgoms pa de ni 'og min du song nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: Those who alternate the absorptions go to Akaniṣṭha and attain nirvana there.🔽Those who do not alternate the absorptions go to the summit of existence.🔽Those who go to the summit of existence are of three types:

original: de 'phar phyed 'phar thams cad du //🔽'chi 'pho / de ltar 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba'i gong du 'pho ba de ni 'phar ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum ste /🔽de la 'phar ba zhes bya ba ni 'dir bsam gtan rnams spel mar bsgoms te bsam gtan gsum las yongs su nyams na bsam gtan dang po'i ro myangs te /
analyzed: de 'phar phyed 'phar thams cad du // 'chi 'pho / de ltar 'og min gyi mthar thug par 'gro ba'i gong du 'pho ba de ni 'phar ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum ste / de la 'phar ba zhes bya ba ni 'dir bsam gtan rnams spel mar bsgoms te bsam gtan gsum las yongs su nyams na bsam gtan dang po'i ro myangs te /
translated: those who leap over, those who leap over half and those who leap over all.

original: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skyes la /
analyzed: tshangs ris kyi lha rnams kyi nang du skyes la /
translated: Those who leap over are those who alternate the absorptions and then, having fully degenerated from three absorptions, taste the first absorption and are born among the Brahmakāyika gods.

original: sngon goms pa'i dbang gis bsam gtan spel mar bsgoms te /🔽de nas shi 'phos nas 'og min du skye ba gang yin pa ste /🔽de ni bar dag tu mi 'byin bas na 'phar ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon goms pa'i dbang gis bsam gtan spel mar bsgoms te / de nas shi 'phos nas 'og min du skye ba gang yin pa ste / de ni bar dag tu mi 'byin bas na 'phar ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “those who go to the highest” because they are born in Akaniṣṭha after previously being born in the desire realm and then being born in the first absorption and so on and cultivating the meditative attainment of the absorptions and formless realm in alternating order.

original: phyed @225b du 'phar ba zhes bya ba ni /🔽de nas gnas gtsang ma rnams su skyes la /
analyzed: phyed @225b du 'phar ba zhes bya ba ni / de nas gnas gtsang ma rnams su skyes la /
translated: They are called “those who rise up” because they are born in Akaniṣṭha after being born in the desire realm and then being born in the first absorption and so on and cultivating the meditative attainment of the absorptions and formless realm in alternating order.

original: bar nas gnas 'ga' tsam yang rgal te 'og min du 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bar nas gnas 'ga' tsam yang rgal te 'og min du 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: They are called “those who rise up halfway” because they are born in Akaniṣṭha after being born in the desire realm and then being born in the first absorption and so on and cultivating the meditative attainment of the absorptions and formless realm in alternating order and then being born in the pure abodes.🔽They are called “those who die in all abodes” because they are born in Akaniṣṭha after being born in the desire realm and then being born in the first absorption and so on and cultivating the meditative attainment of the absorptions and formless realm in alternating order and then being born in the pure abodes and then dying in all abodes.

original: 'phags pa ni tshangs pa chen po'i nang du mi skye ste /🔽lta ba'i gnas yin pa dang / gtso bo gcig tu zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni tshangs pa chen po'i nang du mi skye ste / lta ba'i gnas yin pa dang / gtso bo gcig tu zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Aryas are not born in Mahābrahma because it is a place of wrong view and because there is only one chief.

original: gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho bar zhes bya ba ni gnas kyi bye brag thams cad las shi 'phos nas 'og min du 'jug pa gang yin pa ste /🔽phyir mi 'ong ba ni nam yang skye ba'i skye mched de nyid du /
analyzed: gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho bar zhes bya ba ni gnas kyi bye brag thams cad las shi 'phos nas 'og min du 'jug pa gang yin pa ste / phyir mi 'ong ba ni nam yang skye ba'i skye mched de nyid du /
translated: They are called “those who die in all abodes” because they are born in Akaniṣṭha after being born in the desire realm and then being born in the first absorption and so on and cultivating the meditative attainment of the absorptions and formless realm in alternating order and then being born in the pure abodes and then dying in all abodes.

original: tshe gnyis pa mngon par grub par mi byed de /
analyzed: tshe gnyis pa mngon par grub par mi byed de /
translated: Nonreturners never establish a second life in the very place of birth.

original: khyad par du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they progress to a distinctive state.

original: 'di ltar gang du skyes pa de'i 'og dang de nyid du phyir mi 'ong ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang du skyes pa de'i 'og dang de nyid du phyir mi 'ong ba'i phyir na /
translated: Because they do not return to the level where they were born,

original: de'i phyir mi 'ong ba yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi 'ong ba yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: they are perfect nonreturners.

original: re zhig bsam gtan spel mar bsgoms pas 'og min du 'gro ba ni de lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig bsam gtan spel mar bsgoms pas 'og min du 'gro ba ni de lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is how those who cultivate meditative concentration in a mixed way go to Akaniṣṭha.

original: de las / gzhan srid rtse mor 'gro /
analyzed: de las / gzhan srid rtse mor 'gro /
translated: Others go to the peak of existence.

original: gang du 'pho ba bsam gtan spel mar ma bsgoms pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar phyin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang du 'pho ba bsam gtan spel mar ma bsgoms pa ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar phyin par 'gyur te /
translated: Those who do not cultivate meditative concentration in a mixed way go to the peak of existence.

original: de ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bye brag rnams ro myong bar byed cing gnas kyi khyad par thams cad du skye la /
analyzed: de ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bye brag rnams ro myong bar byed cing gnas kyi khyad par thams cad du skye la /
translated: They experience the different meditative attainments and are born in all the special places.

original: gnas gtsang ma rnams su mi 'jug pa nyid du gzugs med par skye ba'i rim gyis sring pa'i rtse mor song ste /
analyzed: gnas gtsang ma rnams su mi 'jug pa nyid du gzugs med par skye ba'i rim gyis sring pa'i rtse mor song ste /
translated: They are not born in the pure abodes, but are born in the formless realm and go to the peak of existence.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: Then they attain nirvana.

original: 'di ni zhi gnas spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhi gnas spyod pa'o //
translated: This is the practice of serenity.

original: snga ma ni lhag mthong spyod pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma ni lhag mthong spyod pa'o //
translated: The first is the one who practices insight.

original: re zhig de dag ni gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba lnga yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de dag ni gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba lnga yin no //
translated: These are the five nonreturners who go to the realm of form.

original: gzugs med 'gro ba rnam bzhi gzhan //
analyzed: gzugs med 'gro ba rnam bzhi gzhan //
translated: The other four go to the formless realm.🔽The other nonreturners who go to the formless realm are those who, free from attachment to the realm of form, are reborn in the formless realm after having died here.

original: gzhan gzugs med par 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba 'di nas shi 'phos nas gzugs med pa'i nang dag tu skye ba gang yin pa ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa
analyzed: gzhan gzugs med par 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba 'di nas shi 'phos nas gzugs med pa'i nang dag tu skye ba gang yin pa ni skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa
translated: They are of four types, according to the distinction of the one who obtains nirvāṇa rapidly, etc.

original: bzhi ste / bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma gtogs so //
analyzed: bzhi ste / bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma gtogs so //
translated: , with the exception of the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the intermediate state.

original: de ltar na phyir mi 'ong ba ni drug tu 'gyur ro //🔽'dir ni mya ngan 'da' 'gyur gzhan //
analyzed: de ltar na phyir mi 'ong ba ni drug tu 'gyur ro // 'dir ni mya ngan 'da' 'gyur gzhan //
translated: Thus there are six nonreturners.🔽There is another who obtains nirvāṇa here.

original: gzhan ni tshe 'di nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni tshe 'di nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ste /
translated: There is another who obtains nirvāṇa in this very life.

original: mthong ba'i chos la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni bdun pa yin no //
translated: The one who obtains nirvāṇa in this life is the seventh.

original: gsum pa rnam pag sum phye nas //
analyzed: gsum pa rnam pag sum phye nas //
translated: When classified in three ways,

original: gzugs su nyer 'gro dgur bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs su nyer 'gro dgur bshad do //
translated: nonreturners who go to the form realm are explained as nine.

original: yang phyir mi 'ong ba gsum las //
analyzed: yang phyir mi 'ong ba gsum las //
translated: From among the three nonreturners,

original: rnam pa gsum @226a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum @226a * //
translated: when classified in three ways,

original: gsum du phye na gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba ni dgur 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsum du phye na gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba ni dgur 'gyur te /
translated: nonreturners who go to the form realm are nine.

original: gsum po de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum po de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?🔽They are nonreturners who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, nonreturners who attain nirvana after taking birth and nonreturners who attain nirvana by going to a higher level.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / gong du 'pho ba dang / rnam pa gsum dbye ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / gong du 'pho ba dang / rnam pa gsum dbye ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they classified in three ways?

original: de zhig bar mdor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni myur ba dang / myur ba ma yin pa dang / yul re zhig na yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: de zhig bar mdor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni myur ba dang / myur ba ma yin pa dang / yul re zhig na yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
translated: Nonreturners who attain nirvana in the intermediate state antaraparinirvrtti attain nirvana quickly, not quickly and after some time in the intermediate state.

original: dpe gsum gyi bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dpe gsum gyi bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is taught by way of three examples.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni /
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni /
translated: Nonreturners who attain nirvana after taking birth upapadyaparinirvrtti attain nirvana after taking birth.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' pha dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' pha dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /
translated: those who attain nirvana after being born, those who attain nirvana with effort, and those who attain nirvana without effort.

original: de dag thams cad kyang skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams so //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnams so //
translated: All of them are called those who attain nirvana after being born because they attain nirvana after being born.

original: gong du 'pho ba ni 'phar ba la sogs pas dbye bas gsum yin no //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba ni 'phar ba la sogs pas dbye bas gsum yin no //
translated: Those who go upstream are of three types: those who leap over, those who half-leap, and those who do not leap.

original: de dag gi ni khyad par rnams //
analyzed: de dag gi ni khyad par rnams //
translated: Their distinctions

original: las dang nyon mongs bye brag las //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs bye brag las //
translated: are due to the distinction of karma, affliction, and faculties.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba gsum dang dgu po de dag gi khyad par ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang / dbang po'i bye brag las rig par bya ste /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba gsum dang dgu po de dag gi khyad par ni las dang nyon mongs pa dang / dbang po'i bye brag las rig par bya ste /
translated: The distinctions of the three or nine nonreturners should be understood as due to the distinction of karma, affliction, and faculties.

original: re zhig gsum ni /
analyzed: re zhig gsum ni /
translated: The three are distinguished by karma.

original: mngon par 'grub pa dang / skyes pa dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i lam bsags pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun du spyod pa ni chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po yin pa dang / dbang po rnon po dang /🔽'bring dang / rtul po yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa dang / skyes pa dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i lam bsags pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun du spyod pa ni chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po yin pa dang / dbang po rnon po dang / 'bring dang / rtul po yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The path of accumulation is small, middling, or great due to the small, middling, or great degree of the afflictions that are engaged in, and due to the small, middling, or great degree of the path of accumulation that is accumulated.🔽The path of preparation is small, middling, or great due to the small, middling, or great degree of the afflictions that are engaged in, and due to the small, middling, or great degree of the path of preparation that is generated.🔽The path of seeing is small, middling, or great due to the small, middling, or great degree of the afflictions that are engaged in, and due to the small, middling, or great degree of the path of seeing that is generated.🔽The path of cultivation is small, middling, or great due to the small, middling, or great degree of the afflictions that are engaged in, and due to the small, middling, or great degree of the path of cultivation that is generated.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: The path of no further learning is small, middling, or great due to the small, middling, or great degree of the afflictions that are engaged in, and due to the small, middling, or great degree of the path of no further learning that is generated.

original: de bas na de dag ni dgu bo re re la yang ci rigs par khyad par du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni dgu bo re re la yang ci rigs par khyad par du blta bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, each of the nine should be seen as distinct, as appropriate.

original: dang po gsum po gnyis ni snga ma bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang / dbang po'i bye brag gis khyad par du blta'o //🔽gsum pa tha ma ni /
analyzed: dang po gsum po gnyis ni snga ma bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang / dbang po'i bye brag gis khyad par du blta'o // gsum pa tha ma ni /
translated: The first three are seen as distinct due to the distinctions of affliction and faculty, as before.

original: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi bye brag las kyang khyad par du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi bye brag las kyang khyad par du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The last of the three is seen as distinct due to the distinction of karma to be experienced in other lives.

original: de ltar na de dag ni nyon mongs pa dang dbang po'i rnam pa dgu yin pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnam pa dgur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni nyon mongs pa dang dbang po'i rnam pa dgu yin pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnam pa dgur 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because there are nine types of afflictions and faculties, there are nine types of nonreturners.

original: de ltar na mdo las skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba ni bdun no zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na mdo las skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba ni bdun no zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: They assert seven abodes of pure beings,

original: gong du 'pho ba ma phye bar //🔽dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun du 'dod //🔽gong du 'gro ba'i chos ni gong du 'pho ba dag ste /
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba ma phye bar // dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun du 'dod // gong du 'gro ba'i chos ni gong du 'pho ba dag ste /
translated: not distinguishing the highest.

original: mdo las ni ma phye bar bstan pa'i phyir @226b skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun zhes gsungs so //🔽ci'i phyir de dag 'ba' zhig la skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo las ni ma phye bar bstan pa'i phyir @226b skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun zhes gsungs so // ci'i phyir de dag 'ba' zhig la skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The highest dharmas are those that proceed to the highest, but since they are not distinguished in the sutra, it declares, There are seven abodes of pure beings.

original: slob pa'i 'gro ba gzhan dag ni ma yin zhe na /🔽'gro ba de lta bu gang yin pa de dag ni dam pa'i las dge ba nyid la 'jug pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa mi dge ba la mi 'jug pa dang / de dag gi 'gros kyis dang po rnams ni yang phyir mi 'ong ba med pa yin la /
analyzed: slob pa'i 'gro ba gzhan dag ni ma yin zhe na / 'gro ba de lta bu gang yin pa de dag ni dam pa'i las dge ba nyid la 'jug pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa mi dge ba la mi 'jug pa dang / de dag gi 'gros kyis dang po rnams ni yang phyir mi 'ong ba med pa yin la /
translated: Why are only those called abodes of pure beings and not other abodes of learners?🔽Because those abodes are the engagement of pure beings in virtue, they are the nonengagement of pure beings in nonvirtue and they are the engagement of pure beings in the path.

original: ji skad du bshad pa de dag ni gzhan la med pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa de dag ni gzhan la med pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since those abodes are the engagement of pure beings in virtue, they are the nonengagement of pure beings in nonvirtue and they are the engagement of pure beings in the path.

original: dam pa dam min 'jug mi 'jug / song nas phyir mi 'ong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dam pa dam min 'jug mi 'jug / song nas phyir mi 'ong ba'i phyir te /
translated: because the noble ones do not return to the stage that they have left behind,

original: skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: because they have gone to the destination of the noble ones.

original: gzhan na ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan na ma yin no //
translated: They do not go elsewhere.

original: ci tshe yongs su gyur pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnams la yang de ltar dbye ba yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci tshe yongs su gyur pa'i phyir mi 'ong ba rnams la yang de ltar dbye ba yod dam zhe na /
translated: Do those who are nonreturners by the transformation of their lifestory have this threefold classification?

original: med de gang gi phyir /
analyzed: med de gang gi phyir /
translated: No, they do not, because:

original: 'dod par tshe yongs gyur pa'i 'phags //
analyzed: 'dod par tshe yongs gyur pa'i 'phags //
translated: The noble ones who have transformed their lifestory in the realm of desire

original: khams gzhan du ni 'gro ba med //🔽'dod pa'i khams gzhan dag tu tshe yongs su gyur pa'i 'phags pa ni /
analyzed: khams gzhan du ni 'gro ba med // 'dod pa'i khams gzhan dag tu tshe yongs su gyur pa'i 'phags pa ni /
translated: do not go to another realm.

original: khams gzhan dag tu mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: khams gzhan dag tu mi 'gro ste /
translated: The noble ones who have transformed their lifestory in the realm of desire do not go to another realm.

original: tshe de nyid la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe de nyid la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they obtain the fruit of nonreturner in that very lifestory and then they attain nirvana.

original: gzugs kyi khams dag tu tshe yongs su gyur pa ni res 'ga' zhig ni gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu yang 'jug ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dag tu tshe yongs su gyur pa ni res 'ga' zhig ni gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu yang 'jug ste /
translated: Those who have transformed their lifestory in the realm of form sometimes enter the formless realm.

original: gong du 'pho ba sri dpa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug par 'gro bar bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba sri dpa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug par 'gro bar bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the one who is explained as going to the summit of existence by the process of shifting to a higher level.

original: de dang gong mar skyes pa ni //
analyzed: de dang gong mar skyes pa ni //
translated: Those who are born in a higher realm

original: dbang bo'i mi 'pho yongs nyams bcom //
analyzed: dbang bo'i mi 'pho yongs nyams bcom //
translated: do not shift faculties, nor do they retrogress.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dag tu tshe yongs su gyur pa'i 'phags pa de dang / khams gong mar skyes pa'i 'phags pa ni dang po rnams kyang mi 'pho la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dag tu tshe yongs su gyur pa'i 'phags pa de dang / khams gong mar skyes pa'i 'phags pa ni dang po rnams kyang mi 'pho la /
translated: Aryans who have changed their lives in the desire realm and aryas born in higher realms do not shift faculties in the first place.

original: ji ltar yang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te ;
analyzed: ji ltar yang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te ;
translated: Nor do they retrogress,

original: tshe rabs gzhan na yongs su bsgoms pa dbang po rnams shin tu yongs su smin pa dang / lus khyad par can thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan na yongs su bsgoms pa dbang po rnams shin tu yongs su smin pa dang / lus khyad par can thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in other lives they have fully cultivated their faculties and obtained a special body.

original: ji skad du de /
analyzed: ji skad du de /
translated: As it is said,

original: bsam gtan spel mas 'og min 'gro //
analyzed: bsam gtan spel mas 'og min 'gro //
translated: Those who increase their meditation go to Akaniṣṭha.

original: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa dang po nyid du bsam gtan gang zhig spel mar byed ce na /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa dang po nyid du bsam gtan gang zhig spel mar byed ce na /
translated: In what stage do they increase their meditation?

original: dang por bsam gtan bzhi pa spel /
analyzed: dang por bsam gtan bzhi pa spel /
translated: First they increase the fourth absorption.

original: de ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad las su rung ba dang / bde ba sgrub pa'i mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad las su rung ba dang / bde ba sgrub pa'i mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the supreme method for achieving concentration and bliss.

original: spel ma ni 'di ltar spel mar byed do //
analyzed: spel ma ni 'di ltar spel mar byed do //
translated: Alternating means alternating in this way.

original: dgra bcom pa'am phyir mi 'ong ba zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa la rgyu dang ldan par snyoms par 'jug cing /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'am phyir mi 'ong ba zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa la rgyu dang ldan par snyoms par 'jug cing /
translated: Arhats or nonreturners enter meditative attainment possessing the cause of the fourth uncontaminated absorption.

original: de las @227a * //
analyzed: de las @227a * //
translated: They rise from that and

original: langs te / de nyid zag pa dang bcas pa la rgyun dang ldan par snyoms par 'jug la /
analyzed: langs te / de nyid zag pa dang bcas pa la rgyun dang ldan par snyoms par 'jug la /
translated: enter meditative attainment possessing the continuum of that contaminated absorption.

original: de las langs te /
analyzed: de las langs te /
translated: They rise from that and

original: yang zag pa med pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: yang zag pa med pa la 'jug ste /
translated: again enter the uncontaminated.

original: de bzhin du rgyun 'gribs pas gang gi ste skad cig ma gnyis su zag pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug cing skad cig ma gnyis su zag pa dang bcas pa la snyoms par 'jug la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyun 'gribs pas gang gi ste skad cig ma gnyis su zag pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug cing skad cig ma gnyis su zag pa dang bcas pa la snyoms par 'jug la /
translated: In that way, they enter the uncontaminated for two moments and enter the contaminated for two moments,

original: yang zag pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa de ni /
analyzed: yang zag pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa de ni /
translated: and again they enter the uncontaminated.

original: spel ma'i sbyor ba yin no zhes grag go //
analyzed: spel ma'i sbyor ba yin no zhes grag go //
translated: That is said to be the preparation of alternating.

original: skad cig ma ni bsres par grub //
analyzed: skad cig ma ni bsres par grub //
translated: It is established that it is momentary.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag na re /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag na re /
translated: Vaibhasikas say:

original: gang gi tshe zag pa med pa'i skad cig ma'i mjug thogs su zag pa dang bcas pa mngon du byed cing zag pa dang bcas pa'i mjug thogs su yang zag pa med pa mngon du byed la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zag pa med pa'i skad cig ma'i mjug thogs su zag pa dang bcas pa mngon du byed cing zag pa dang bcas pa'i mjug thogs su yang zag pa med pa mngon du byed la /
translated: When one manifests a contaminated state immediately after an uncontaminated moment and manifests an uncontaminated state immediately after a contaminated state,

original: de bzhin du zag pa dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma dang / zag pa med pa'i skad cig ma gnyis bsres pas spel ma grub pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du zag pa dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma dang / zag pa med pa'i skad cig ma gnyis bsres pas spel ma grub pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: then the alternating cultivation is established by mixing two moments of contaminated and uncontaminated states.

original: skad cig ma gnyis ni bar chad med pa'i lam lta bu yin la /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis ni bar chad med pa'i lam lta bu yin la /
translated: Two moments are like the uninterrupted path and

original: gsum pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam lta bu yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam lta bu yin no //
translated: the third is like the liberated path.

original: de ltar bsam gtan bzhi pa spel na de'i stobs kyis gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang spel mar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar bsam gtan bzhi pa spel na de'i stobs kyis gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang spel mar byed do //
translated: If one cultivates the fourth absorption in this way, through its power one cultivates other absorptions in alternation.

original: dang po nyid du ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi gling gsum dag tu spel mar byed la /
analyzed: dang po nyid du ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi gling gsum dag tu spel mar byed la /
translated: First, one cultivates in alternation in the three continents of the desire realm.

original: phyis yongs su nyams nas ni gzugs kyi khams dag tu yang spel mar byed do //
analyzed: phyis yongs su nyams nas ni gzugs kyi khams dag tu yang spel mar byed do //
translated: Later, after one degenerates, one cultivates in alternation in the form realm.

original: ci'i phyir bsam gtan spel mar byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan spel mar byed ce na /
translated: Why do they cultivate the meditative development of the perfections in this way?🔽In order to be reborn and to abide,

original: skye dang gnas par bya phyir dang // nyon mongs pas ni 'jigs phyir yang //
analyzed: skye dang gnas par bya phyir dang // nyon mongs pas ni 'jigs phyir yang //
translated: and also because they are afraid of the defilements.

original: rgyu gsum gyis na bsam gtan rnams spel mar byed de /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis na bsam gtan rnams spel mar byed de /
translated: They cultivate the meditative development of the meditative absorptions in this way for three reasons:

original: phyir mi 'ong ba dbang po rnon po rnams ni gnas gtsang mar skyes par bya ba dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir chos spel mar byed la /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba dbang po rnon po rnams ni gnas gtsang mar skyes par bya ba dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir chos spel mar byed la /
translated: those who are non-returners of keen faculties cultivate the meditative development of the Dharma in order to be reborn in the Pure Abodes and in order to abide in comfort in this present life;

original: dbang po rtul po rnams ni nyon mongs pas 'jigs pa'i phyir yang yin te /
analyzed: dbang po rtul po rnams ni nyon mongs pas 'jigs pa'i phyir yang yin te /
translated: those of dull faculties also do so because they are afraid of the defilements;

original: ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin thag bsrings pa'i sgo nas yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir spel mar byed do //
analyzed: ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin thag bsrings pa'i sgo nas yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir spel mar byed do //
translated: they cultivate the meditative development of the meditative absorptions in this way in order to avoid the complete degeneration of the meditative concentration that is associated with the enjoyment of the pleasure of meditative concentration.

original: dgra bcom pa dbang po rnon po rnams ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dbang po rnon po rnams ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who are arhats of keen faculties do so in order to abide in comfort in this present life.

original: dbang po rtul po rnams ni nyon mongs pas 'jigs pas yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir yang yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po rnams ni nyon mongs pas 'jigs pas yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir yang yin no //
translated: Those of weak faculties do not retrogress in order to avoid being frightened by the defilements.

original: yang ci'i phyir gnas gtsang mar skye ba rnams ni lnga kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gnas gtsang mar skye ba rnams ni lnga kho na yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the births of the Suddhāvāsas five in number?

original: de ltar bsam gtan bzhi pa spel @227b mar bsgoms par bshad pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: de ltar bsam gtan bzhi pa spel @227b mar bsgoms par bshad pa gang yin pa /
translated: The fourth meditation, which has been explained as being cultivated in a progressive and reverse order,

original: de ni rnam pa lnga yi phyir //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa lnga yi phyir //
translated: is cultivated in a progressive and reverse order, in five ways.

original: gtsang ma'i gnas su skye ba lnga //
analyzed: gtsang ma'i gnas su skye ba lnga //
translated: The births of the Suddhāvāsas are five in number.

original: spel mar bsgoms pa de ni chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / shin tu che ba dang / shin tu ches che bar dbye bas rnam pa lnga yin te /
analyzed: spel mar bsgoms pa de ni chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po dang / shin tu che ba dang / shin tu ches che bar dbye bas rnam pa lnga yin te /
translated: This meditation is cultivated in a progressive and reverse order, in five ways: weak-weak, weak-medium, weak-strong, medium-weak, medium-medium, medium-strong, strong-weak, strong-medium, strong-strong.

original: dang po la ni zag pa med pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / sems gsum mngon du byed do //
analyzed: dang po la ni zag pa med pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / sems gsum mngon du byed do //
translated: In the first, one realizes three thoughts: one pure thought, one pure-impure thought, one pure thought.

original: gnyis pa la ni drug go //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni drug go //
translated: In the second, six thoughts.

original: gsum pa la ni dgu'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni dgu'o //
translated: In the third, nine thoughts.

original: bzhi pa la bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: bzhi pa la bcu gnyis so //
translated: In the fourth, twelve thoughts.

original: lnga pa la ni sems bco lnga mngon du byed de /
analyzed: lnga pa la ni sems bco lnga mngon du byed de /
translated: In the fifth, fifteen thoughts.

original: de dag gi 'bras bu ni rim bzhin du gnas gtsang ma lnga yin la /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu ni rim bzhin du gnas gtsang ma lnga yin la /
translated: The five pure abodes are their respective results.

original: de dag las zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de'i dbang gis de dag tu skye'o //🔽gzhan dag na re dang pa la sogs pa lhag pas na lnga yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag las zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de'i dbang gis de dag tu skye'o // gzhan dag na re dang pa la sogs pa lhag pas na lnga yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: By the power of the pure abodes, they are born in the five pure abodes.

original: 'gog pa thob pa'i phyir mi 'ong //🔽lus kyis mngon du byed par 'dod //
analyzed: 'gog pa thob pa'i phyir mi 'ong // lus kyis mngon du byed par 'dod //
translated: According to another opinion, they are called pure abodes because of the predominance of faith and the other roots of good.🔽The nonreturners who obtain the cessation of ideation and sensation are called those who go higher by the body.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba gang la la zhig gis 'gog pa thob pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i chos lus kyis mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba gang la la zhig gis 'gog pa thob pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i chos lus kyis mngon sum du byas pa'i phyir lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa zhes bya'o /
translated: They are called those who go higher by the body because they actualize the cessation which is similar to nirvāṇa by the body.

original: ji ltar na lus kyis mngon sum du byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na lus kyis mngon sum du byed ce na /
translated: How can one actualize cessation by the body?

original: sems med pa'i phyir ba dang lus la brten nas skye ba'i phyir ro //🔽srid rtse'i bar chad brgyad zad pa //
analyzed: sems med pa'i phyir ba dang lus la brten nas skye ba'i phyir ro // srid rtse'i bar chad brgyad zad pa //
translated: Because the body is the support of the mind.

original: dgra bcom nyid la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom nyid la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The nonreturners who have abandoned the eighth part of the summit of cyclic existence enter into the state of the perfected being.

original: yang phyir mi 'ong ba de bsam gtan dang po'i rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: yang phyir mi 'ong ba de bsam gtan dang po'i rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Furthermore, a nonreturner who is free from attachment to the first level of absorption up to

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa brgyad kyi bar du spangs pa'i lam dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa yin no //🔽dgu ba'i bar chad med lam yang //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa brgyad kyi bar du spangs pa'i lam dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa yin no // dgu ba'i bar chad med lam yang //
translated: who has abandoned the eight stages of the summit of existence is one who has entered the state of an arhat.

original: de ni srid pa'i rtse mo ba'i rnam pa dgu ba spong ba'i bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas pa na yang dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa kho na yin no //🔽de ni rdo rje lta bu yin par bar chad med pa'i lam de ni phra rgyas thams cad 'joms pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni srid pa'i rtse mo ba'i rnam pa dgu ba spong ba'i bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas pa na yang dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa kho na yin no // de ni rdo rje lta bu yin par bar chad med pa'i lam de ni phra rgyas thams cad 'joms pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One who has entered the state of an arhat also abides in the uninterrupted path that abandons the ninth stage of the summit of existence.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: That uninterrupted path is called the vajra like concentration because it destroys all the negative tendencies.

original: bcom zin pa'i phyir de dag thams cad 'joms par byed pa ni ma yin mod kyi thams cad 'joms pa'i mthu yod cing bar chad med pas lam thams cad pas ches che ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom zin pa'i phyir de dag thams cad 'joms par byed pa ni ma yin mod kyi thams cad 'joms pa'i mthu yod cing bar chad med pas lam thams cad pas ches che ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although it does not destroy all of them, since it has already destroyed some, it is the greatest of all paths, because it has the power to destroy all, because it is uninterrupted, and because it is the greatest.

original: gang de srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa dgu par bshad pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis spang bar bya ba gang yin pa /🔽de @228a * //🔽zad thob dang zad ye shes //
analyzed: gang de srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa dgu par bshad pa'i rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis spang bar bya ba gang yin pa / de @228a * // zad thob dang zad ye shes //
translated: The vajra-like concentration explained as the ninth stage of the summit of existence destroys the object to be abandoned by the path of meditation.🔽The knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonproduction

original: rnam pa dgu pa de zad pa'i thob pa dang / lhan cig tu zad pa'i ye shes skye ste /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu pa de zad pa'i thob pa dang / lhan cig tu zad pa'i ye shes skye ste /
translated: arise simultaneously with the attainment of elimination.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mjug thogs su phi ma rnam par grol ba'i lam skye bas de bas na de ni dang po kho nar zag pa thams cad zad pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye ba'i phyir zad pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mjug thogs su phi ma rnam par grol ba'i lam skye bas de bas na de ni dang po kho nar zag pa thams cad zad pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye ba'i phyir zad pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: The vajra-like concentration is followed by the subsequent path of liberation, and therefore it is called the knowledge of elimination because it arises simultaneously with the attainment of the elimination of all contaminants.

original: de tshe de mi slob dgra bcom //
analyzed: de tshe de mi slob dgra bcom //
translated: At that time, he is a nonlearner, an arhat.

original: yang dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa de zad pa'i ye shes skyes nas 'bras bu gzhan gyi phyir slob pa med pas na mi slob pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa de zad pa'i ye shes skyes nas 'bras bu gzhan gyi phyir slob pa med pas na mi slob pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, one who has entered the state of an arhat is a nonlearner because, after the transcendent wisdom of elimination has arisen, there is no more training for the sake of another result.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa ste /
translated: He is an arhat because he is worthy of worship by all who have desire.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa yin no //🔽de nyid kyi phyir sngar gang zag bdun du bshad pa gzhan rnams ni zag pa thams cad zad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob pa yin no // de nyid kyi phyir sngar gang zag bdun du bshad pa gzhan rnams ni zag pa thams cad zad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: He has attained the result of an arhat.

original: bslab pa gsum po lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la slob pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir slob pa zhes bya bar grub ste /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum po lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la slob pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir slob pa zhes bya bar grub ste /
translated: For that reason, the other seven persons previously explained are learners because they are intent on training in the three trainings higher morality, higher mind, and higher wisdom in order to eliminate all the contaminants.

original: de dag ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: They are learners because they have the nature of morality, samādhi, and wisdom.

original: bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa la /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa la /
translated: The path of cultivation is explained as being of two types: mundane and transcendent.

original: lam gang gis na slob pa de khams gang dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba 'thob ce na /
analyzed: lam gang gis na slob pa de khams gang dag las 'dod chags dang bral ba 'thob ce na /
translated: By what path and from what realms are they free from attachment?

original: 'jig rten 'das kyi srid rtse las //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das kyi srid rtse las //
translated: They are free from attachment to the summit of existence by the transcendent path.

original: chags bral / 'jig rten pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chags bral / 'jig rten pas ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not free from attachment by the mundane path.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de'i gong na 'jig rten pa med pa'i phyir ba dang / rang gi sa pa'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gong na 'jig rten pa med pa'i phyir ba dang / rang gi sa pa'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no higher mundane path and because it is not the antidote of its level.

original: ci'i phyir gnyen po ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnyen po ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not an antidote?

original: sa de pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir te ;🔽nyon mongs pa gang gis dngos po ga la rgyas par 'gyur ba de ni dngos po des spong bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: sa de pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir te ; nyon mongs pa gang gis dngos po ga la rgyas par 'gyur ba de ni dngos po des spong bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Because it increases the affliction of that level.🔽That which increases the objects to be abandoned by a certain antidote does not abandon those objects.

original: gang gi gnyen po gang yin pa de'i ni nyon mongs pa de rgyas par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi gnyen po gang yin pa de'i ni nyon mongs pa de rgyas par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is the antidote to a certain affliction does not increase that affliction.

original: gzhan las rnam pa gnyis /
analyzed: gzhan las rnam pa gnyis /
translated: Two types from other levels.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo las gzhan pa'i sa dag las ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo las gzhan pa'i sa dag las ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur la /
translated: One is free from attachment to all levels other than the summit of existence by the mundane path.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: One also becomes free from attachment by means of the supramundane path.

original: de la yang /🔽'jig rten pa yis chags bral ba'i //🔽'phags pa bral ba'i thob rnam gnyis //
analyzed: de la yang / 'jig rten pa yis chags bral ba'i // 'phags pa bral ba'i thob rnam gnyis //
translated: In this regard,🔽the noble ones who are free from attachment🔽by the mundane path possess two types of obtainment of freedom.

original: 'phags pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bas 'gro ba @228b dag ni bral ba'i thob pa 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis skye'o //🔽kha cig 'jig rten 'das kyis kyang //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bas 'gro ba @228b dag ni bral ba'i thob pa 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis skye'o // kha cig 'jig rten 'das kyis kyang //
translated: The noble ones who are free from attachment by the mundane path possess two types of obtainment of freedom: mundane and transcendent.🔽Some say: So too by the transcendent path.

original: gzhan dag na re 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis kyang de bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis kyang de bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: So too by the transcendent path.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: btang la nyon mongs mi ldan phyir //
analyzed: btang la nyon mongs mi ldan phyir //
translated: Because one does not possess the affliction of the lower level.

original: gal te bar chad med pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba thob nas 'jig rten pa'i bral ba'i thob pa mi skye na /
analyzed: gal te bar chad med pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba thob nas 'jig rten pa'i bral ba'i thob pa mi skye na /
translated: If one obtains freedom from attachment by the uninterrupted path and the obtainment of freedom of the mundane path does not arise,

original: de ltar 'phags pa'i lam gyis ci yang med pa'i skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral ba bsam gtan la rten te /
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa'i lam gyis ci yang med pa'i skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral ba bsam gtan la rten te /
translated: Thus, those who are free from attachment to the base of nothingness by means of the ārya path and who upgrade their intellectual faculty in dependence on the absorptions

original: dbang po 'pho bar byed pa gang yin pa lam snga ma thams cad ni btang la 'bras bu'i lam 'ba' zhig thob pa'i phyir sa gong ma'i nyon mongs pa'i bral ba dang mi ldan par 'gyur zhing btang ba de la yang nyon mongs pa de dag dang ldan🔽par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po 'pho bar byed pa gang yin pa lam snga ma thams cad ni btang la 'bras bu'i lam 'ba' zhig thob pa'i phyir sa gong ma'i nyon mongs pa'i bral ba dang mi ldan par 'gyur zhing btang ba de la yang nyon mongs pa de dag dang ldan par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: abandon all former paths and obtain only the path of the result. Therefore they do not possess freedom from attachment to higher realms and they also possess those afflictions that were abandoned.🔽Those liberated from half of the summit of existence

original: srid rtse'i phyed las rnam grol dang // gong mar skyes pa bzhin mi ldan //
analyzed: srid rtse'i phyed las rnam grol dang // gong mar skyes pa bzhin mi ldan //
translated: do not possess the higher, like those born in higher realms.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i bral ba thob pa med du zin kyang de dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i bral ba thob pa med du zin kyang de dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even though they do not obtain freedom from attachment through mundane paths, they do not possess those afflictions.

original: dper na srid pa'i rtse mo rnam pa phyed las rnam par grol ba la /
analyzed: dper na srid pa'i rtse mo rnam pa phyed las rnam par grol ba la /
translated: For example, those liberated from half of the summit of existence

original: de'i bral ba thob pa 'jig rten pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i bral ba thob pa 'jig rten pa med mod kyi /
translated: do not possess freedom from attachment to the summit of existence.

original: dbang po 'pho bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bral ba'i thob pa btang yang /🔽yang nyon mongs pa de dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba dang / dper na so so'i skye bo bsam gtan dang po'i gang yan chad du skyes pa /
analyzed: dbang po 'pho bas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bral ba'i thob pa btang yang / yang nyon mongs pa de dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba dang / dper na so so'i skye bo bsam gtan dang po'i gang yan chad du skyes pa /
translated: Though one relinquishes the obtainment of separation from attachment to lower levels through the degeneration of the transcendent path,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i thob pa btang yang /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i thob pa btang yang /
translated: one does not again possess those afflictions. For example, though ordinary beings who are born in the first absorption and above relinquish the obtainment of freedom from the afflictions of the desire realm,🔽they do not again possess those afflictions.

original: yang nyon mongs pa de dang ldan par ma 'gyur ba bzhin pas de ni gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa de dang ldan par ma 'gyur ba bzhin pas de ni gtan tshigs su mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore that is not a suitable reason.

original: sa gang zhig gis sa gang dag las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sa gang zhig gis sa gang dag las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What level is free from attachment to what level?

original: zag med mi lcogs med pa yin //
analyzed: zag med mi lcogs med pa yin //
translated: The uncontaminated and unrestricted access concentration

original: thams cad las ni chags bral 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad las ni chags bral 'gyur //
translated: are free from attachment to all.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar las so //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar las so //
translated: They are free from attachment to the summit of existence.

original: yang gang zhig nyer bsdogs la brten te sa 'og ma las 'dod chags dang bral ba thob na /
analyzed: yang gang zhig nyer bsdogs la brten te sa 'og ma las 'dod chags dang bral ba thob na /
