translated: If one obtains freedom from attachment to lower levels in dependence on access concentration,

original: ci de'i bar chad med pa'i lam bzhin du rnam par grol ba'i lam thams cad kyang nyer bsdogs las skyes bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci de'i bar chad med pa'i lam bzhin du rnam par grol ba'i lam thams cad kyang nyer bsdogs las skyes bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Do all liberated paths arise from access concentration, as does the uninterrupted path?

original: smras pa ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa ma yin te /
translated: They do not.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽sa gsum rgyal las bsam gtan nam //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / sa gsum rgyal las bsam gtan nam //
translated: How so?🔽The final liberated path🔽arises from absorption or access concentration

original: nyer bsdogs las mtha'i rnam grol lam //🔽skye ba'i sa thams cad ni dgu ste /
analyzed: nyer bsdogs las mtha'i rnam grol lam // skye ba'i sa thams cad ni dgu ste /
translated: of the three conquerors.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang / snyoms par 'jug pa brgyad do //🔽de las bsam gtan gnyis pa'i bar las 'dod @229a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang / snyoms par 'jug pa brgyad do // de las bsam gtan gnyis pa'i bar las 'dod @229a * //
translated: All nine levels are the level from which one arises: the desire realm and the eight absorptions and formless states.

original: chags dang bral bas gsum las rgyal ba de la ni tha ma rnam par grol ba'i lam nyer bsdogs las kyang skye la /
analyzed: chags dang bral bas gsum las rgyal ba de la ni tha ma rnam par grol ba'i lam nyer bsdogs las kyang skye la /
translated: From among those, one who is free from attachment to the desire realm and up to the second absorption, who has conquered three levels, generates the final liberated path from access concentration and

original: bsam gtan dngos gzhi las kyang skye'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dngos gzhi las kyang skye'o //
translated: also generates it from the actual basis of absorption.

original: gong ma nyer bsdogs pa las min //
analyzed: gong ma nyer bsdogs pa las min //
translated: It does not arise from access concentration of higher levels.🔽One who has conquered three levels generates the final liberated path from access concentration.

original: sa gsum las rgyal ba yan chad ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po thun mong yin pa'i phyir dngos gzhi nyid las skye'i //
analyzed: sa gsum las rgyal ba yan chad ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po thun mong yin pa'i phyir dngos gzhi nyid las skye'i //
translated: One who has conquered four levels generates it from the actual basis of absorption.🔽One who has conquered higher levels does not generate it from access concentration because the faculty of equanimity is common to all three levels.

original: nyer bsdogs las ni mi skye'o //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs las ni mi skye'o //
translated: It does not arise from access concentration.

original: bsam gtan gsum dag las ni nyer bsdogs dang dngos gzhi gnyis kyi dbang po tha dad pa'i phyir kha cig bsam gtan dngos gzhi la 'jug mi nus te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum dag las ni nyer bsdogs dang dngos gzhi gnyis kyi dbang po tha dad pa'i phyir kha cig bsam gtan dngos gzhi la 'jug mi nus te /
translated: In the three absorptions, some are unable to enter the actual basis because the faculties of both access concentration and the actual basis are different.

original: dbang po 'pho ba ni dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po 'pho ba ni dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is difficult to upgrade the faculties.

original: de bas na gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba las ni nyer bsdogs las kyang tha ma rnam par grol ba'i lam skye'o //
analyzed: de bas na gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba las ni nyer bsdogs las kyang tha ma rnam par grol ba'i lam skye'o //
translated: Therefore, the final liberated path arises from access concentration when one is free from attachment to the three absorptions.

original: zag pa med pa'i mi lcogs pa med pas sa thams cad las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad kyi /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i mi lcogs pa med pas sa thams cad las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad kyi /
translated: It is explained that one becomes free from attachment to all levels by means of uncontaminated unrestricted access concentration.

original: gzhan dag gis ni 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur bar ma bshad pas /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur bar ma bshad pas /
translated: But it is not explained that one becomes free from attachment by means of other access concentrations.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: 'phags / brgyad kyis rang gong sa las rgyal //
analyzed: 'phags / brgyad kyis rang gong sa las rgyal //
translated: The noble ones conquer their own and higher levels by eight.

original: zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / gzugs med pa dang brgyad kyis rang gis de gong ma las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur gyi 'dod chags dang bral zin pa'i phyir 'og ma las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / gzugs med pa dang brgyad kyis rang gis de gong ma las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur gyi 'dod chags dang bral zin pa'i phyir 'og ma las ni ma yin no //
translated: One becomes free from attachment to higher realms by means of the eight uncontaminated meditative attainments, the special meditative attainment and the four formless states. One does not become free from attachment to lower realms because one is already free from attachment to lower realms.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni bden pa la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir bden pa'i rnam pa la zhugs pa zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni bden pa la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir bden pa'i rnam pa la zhugs pa zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: The supramundane uninterrupted and liberated paths are called engaged in the aspects of the four truths because they focus on the four truths.

original: 'jig rten pa yi rnam grol dang // bar chad med lam rim bzhin du //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi rnam grol dang // bar chad med lam rim bzhin du //
translated: Mundane liberated and uninterrupted

original: zhi dang rags sogs rnam pa rnams //
analyzed: zhi dang rags sogs rnam pa rnams //
translated: paths respectively have aspects of peace, coarseness and so on.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni //
translated: The liberated paths

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam par lta ba yin la /
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam par lta ba yin la /
translated: view peace and so on.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam par lta ba yin te /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam par lta ba yin te /
translated: The uninterrupted paths view coarseness and so on.

original: de dag kyang rim bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag kyang rim bzhin du /
translated: They are respectively

original: gong dang 'og ma spyod yul lo //
analyzed: gong dang 'og ma spyod yul lo //
translated: The higher and lower are the spheres of activity.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni sa gong ma la ci rigs par zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par blta'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni sa gong ma la ci rigs par zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par blta'o //
translated: The paths of liberation should be viewed as the aspects of peace, excellence, and definite emergence, in the higher stages, as is fitting.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni sa 'og ma ngag la rags pa dang / sdug bsngal len pa dang / rtsig pa stug po lta bur rnam par lta ste /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni sa 'og ma ngag la rags pa dang / sdug bsngal len pa dang / rtsig pa stug po lta bur rnam par lta ste /
translated: The uninterrupted paths should be viewed as the aspects of coarseness, suffering, and the nature of a thick wall, in the lower stages.

original: ma zhi ba dang / rtsol ba chen pos 'bad dgos pa'i phyir rags pa'o //
analyzed: ma zhi ba dang / rtsol ba chen pos 'bad dgos pa'i phyir rags pa'o //
translated: They are coarse because they are not peaceful and one must strive with great effort.

original: gya nom pa ma yin pa dang / @229b gnas ngan len pa rab tu mang bas mi mthun par 'gyur ba'i phyir sdug bsngal len pa'o //
analyzed: gya nom pa ma yin pa dang / @229b gnas ngan len pa rab tu mang bas mi mthun par 'gyur ba'i phyir sdug bsngal len pa'o //
translated: They are suffering because they are not excellent and they are incompatible due to the abundance of negative tendencies.

original: rtsig pa nges par mi 'byung ba bzhin du de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rtsig pa nges par mi 'byung ba bzhin du de nyid kyis so //
translated: They are like a wall because they do not definitely emerge from that.

original: de las nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir rtsig pa stug po lta bu'o //
analyzed: de las nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir rtsig pa stug po lta bu'o //
translated: They are like a thick wall because one does not definitely emerge from them.

original: de dag las bzlog pa ni zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa ni zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa dag yin no //
translated: The aspects of peace, excellence, and definite emergence are the opposites of those.

original: zhar las 'ongs pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: zhar las 'ongs pa rdzogs so /
translated: The digression is concluded.

original: // / dkyus ma brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / dkyus ma brjod par bya ste /
translated: The main point will now be discussed.

original: zad pa'i ye shes kyi mjug thogs su ci zhig skye zhe na /
analyzed: zad pa'i ye shes kyi mjug thogs su ci zhig skye zhe na /
translated: What arises immediately after the knowledge of elimination?

original: gal te mi g-yo zad shes las //
analyzed: gal te mi g-yo zad shes las //
translated: If one is unshakable, from the knowledge of elimination

original: mi skye blo gros /🔽gal te dgra bcom pa mi g-yo ba'i chos can zhig yin na ni //
analyzed: mi skye blo gros / gal te dgra bcom pa mi g-yo ba'i chos can zhig yin na ni //
translated: the knowledge of nonarising.

original: de la zad pa'i ye shes kyi mjug thogs su mi skye ba'i ye shes skye'o //
analyzed: de la zad pa'i ye shes kyi mjug thogs su mi skye ba'i ye shes skye'o //
translated: If one is an unshakable arhat, then the knowledge of nonarising arises immediately after the knowledge of elimination.

original: 'o na min na /
analyzed: 'o na min na /
translated: If not,

original: zad shes pa ni mi slob lta //
analyzed: zad shes pa ni mi slob lta //
translated: the knowledge of elimination is like the path of no learning.

original: 'on te mi g-yo ba'i chos can zhig ma yin na ni zad pa'i ye shes kyi mjug thogs su zad pa'i ye shes nyid dam mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba skye'o //
analyzed: 'on te mi g-yo ba'i chos can zhig ma yin na ni zad pa'i ye shes kyi mjug thogs su zad pa'i ye shes nyid dam mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba skye'o //
translated: If one is not an unshakable arhat, then either the knowledge of elimination or the correct view of no learning arises immediately after the knowledge of elimination.

original: yongs su nyams pa yod pa'i phyir mi skye ba'i ye shes ni mi skye'o//
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa yod pa'i phyir mi skye ba'i ye shes ni mi skye'o//
translated: The knowledge of nonarising does not arise because there is regression.

original: ci mi g-yo ba'i chos can rnams la /
analyzed: ci mi g-yo ba'i chos can rnams la /
translated: Do all unshakable arhats

original: de mi skye ba kho na yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de mi skye ba kho na yin nam zhe na /
translated: not generate that knowledge?

original: de ni dgra bcom thams cad la //
analyzed: de ni dgra bcom thams cad la //
translated: That knowledge does not arise for all arhats.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can la yang res 'ga' ni mi skye ba'i ye shes nyid skye la /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can la yang res 'ga' ni mi skye ba'i ye shes nyid skye la /
translated: Sometimes, the unshakable arhat produces the cognition of nonarising.

original: res 'ga' ni mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba skye'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba skye'o //
translated: Sometimes, he produces the right view of the adept.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu bzhir bshad pa gang yin pa de dag gi 'bras bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu bzhir bshad pa gang yin pa de dag gi 'bras bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the result of the four fruits?

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: They are the fruits of the life of a brahmacārin.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is the life of a brahmacārin?

original: dge sbyong dri ma med pa'i lam //
analyzed: dge sbyong dri ma med pa'i lam //
translated: The life of a brahmacārin is the stainless path.

original: zag pa med pa'i lam ni skye zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i lam ni skye zhes bya'o //
translated: The undefiled path is called the life of a brahmacārin.

original: des nyon mongs pa yang dag par zhi bar byas pa'i sgo nas dge sbyong du 'gyur te /
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa yang dag par zhi bar byas pa'i sgo nas dge sbyong du 'gyur te /
translated: One becomes a brahmacārin by means of the pacification of the defilements.

original: mdo las kyang /
analyzed: mdo las kyang /
translated: A Sūtra says:

original: 'dis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rgyas par rga shir 'gyur ba'i bar rnam pa du ma zhi bar byas pas dge sbyong zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rgyas par rga shir 'gyur ba'i bar rnam pa du ma zhi bar byas pas dge sbyong zhes bya'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has pacified the many kinds of bad and nonvirtuous dharmas that lead to the production of birth, aging, death, and so on, he is called a brahmacārin.

original: yang dge sbyong de'i /
analyzed: yang dge sbyong de'i /
translated: The fruits of the life of a brahmacārin are

original: 'bras bu 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'dus byas 'dus ma byas //
translated: conditioned and unconditioned.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams yin te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams yin te /
translated: The fruits of the sramana are conditioned and unconditioned.🔽Although the sutras mention four fruits,

original: de dag kyang mdo las bzhir gsungs mod kyi 'on kyang de de dag brgyad cu rtsa dgu'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang mdo las bzhir gsungs mod kyi 'on kyang de de dag brgyad cu rtsa dgu'o //
translated: they are in fact eighty-nine.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: grol lam zad pa rnams dang bcas //
analyzed: grol lam zad pa rnams dang bcas //
translated: The paths of liberation and the analytical knowledges.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spang bar bya ba la /
translated: In order to abandon the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing,

original: bar chad med pa'i lam brgyad dang // rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad do //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam brgyad dang // rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad do //
translated: there are eight uninterrupted paths and eight liberated paths.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon @230a * //🔽mongs pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir sa dgu dag la re re zhing yang nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu dgu spang bar bya ba la /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon @230a * // mongs pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir sa dgu dag la re re zhing yang nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu dgu spang bar bya ba la /
translated: In order to abandon the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation,

original: de snyed kyi bar chad med pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams yin no //
analyzed: de snyed kyi bar chad med pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams yin no //
translated: there are uninterrupted paths and liberated paths for abandoning each of the nine degrees of affliction on the nine levels.

original: de la bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni dge sbyong yin la /
analyzed: de la bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni dge sbyong yin la /
translated: The uninterrupted paths are sramana.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni ;
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni ;
translated: The liberated paths are the fruits of sramana.

original: de'i rgyu mthun pa dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'dus byas yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun pa dang skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'dus byas yin no //
translated: The result of the spiritual practitioner is conditioned, because it is the natural outflow and the result of conscious effort of the abandonment of the defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag spangs pa ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'dus byas yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag spangs pa ni dge sbyong gi 'bras bu 'dus byas yin no //
translated: The abandonment of the defilements is the result of the spiritual practitioner.

original: de ltar na de dag ni brgyad cu rtsa dgur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni brgyad cu rtsa dgur 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, there are eighty-nine results.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa kha bskang bar bya dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa kha bskang bar bya dgos so zhe na /
translated: If this is so, then the Buddha’s statement that there are four results must be supplemented.

original: mi dgos te gal te yang 'bras bu ni phal che mod kyi /
analyzed: mi dgos te gal te yang 'bras bu ni phal che mod kyi /
translated: It is not necessary to supplement it, because even though there are many results,

original: 'bras bu bzhir rnam gzhag pa ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhir rnam gzhag pa ni //
translated: the four results are established

original: rgyu lnga dag ni yod phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu lnga dag ni yod phyir ro //
translated: because five causes exist.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis spong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs gang dag la rgyu lnga yod pa de la 'bras bur rnam par gzhag go zhes grag ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis spong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs gang dag la rgyu lnga yod pa de la 'bras bur rnam par gzhag go zhes grag ste /
translated: It is well known that the Blessed One established the four results in the state of the path of abandonment where five causes exist.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'bras la snga ma btang ba dang // lam gzhan thob dang zad bsdoms dang // ye shes brgyad po thob pa dang // rnam pa bcu drug bsgoms pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras la snga ma btang ba dang // lam gzhan thob dang zad bsdoms dang // ye shes brgyad po thob pa dang // rnam pa bcu drug bsgoms pa'o //
translated: The result is the relinquishment of the former path, the obtainment of another path, the combination of the abandonments, the obtainment of the eight knowledges, and the meditation on the sixteen aspects.

original: lam snga ma btang ba dang / sngon ma thob pa'i lam thob pa ni zhugs pa'i lam btang ba dang / 'bras bu'i lam thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam snga ma btang ba dang / sngon ma thob pa'i lam thob pa ni zhugs pa'i lam btang ba dang / 'bras bu'i lam thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The relinquishment of the former path and the obtainment of a path not previously obtained are due to the relinquishment of the path of entry and the obtainment of the path of the result.

original: spangs pa bsdoms pa ni thams cad kyi thob pa gcig rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spangs pa bsdoms pa ni thams cad kyi thob pa gcig rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The combination of the abandonments is due to the acquisition of a single obtainment of all.

original: ye shes brgyad po cig car du thob pa ni chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dag gi yin no //
analyzed: ye shes brgyad po cig car du thob pa ni chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dag gi yin no //
translated: The obtainment of the eight knowledges simultaneously is due to the Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge.

original: rnam pa bcu drug tu bsgoms pa ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug tu bsgoms pa ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The meditation on the sixteen aspects is due to impermanence, etc.

original: rgyu lnga po de dag ni 'bras bu bzhir rnam par gzhag pa'i 'bras bu'o cog la yod do //
analyzed: rgyu lnga po de dag ni 'bras bu bzhir rnam par gzhag pa'i 'bras bu'o cog la yod do //
translated: These five causes exist for every result that is established as the four results.

original: gal te zag pa med pa'i lam 'ba' zhig dge sbyong yin na /
analyzed: gal te zag pa med pa'i lam 'ba' zhig dge sbyong yin na /
translated: If the pure path alone is a worker,🔽how are the two results obtained by the mundane path

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i 'bras bu gnyis ji ltar na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis thob pa'i 'bras bu gnyis ji ltar na /
translated: a worker?

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bur rung zhe na /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bur rung zhe na /
translated: If it is suitable to be a fruit of a sramana,

original: 'jig rten pa yi thob 'dres dang // zag med thob pa 'dzin phyir 'bras //🔽lan cig phyir 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi thob 'dres dang // zag med thob pa 'dzin phyir 'bras // lan cig phyir 'ong ba'am /
translated: it is a fruit because it possesses the obtainment of the mundane and uncontaminated.

original: phyir ma 'ong ba'i 'bras bu de ni /
analyzed: phyir ma 'ong ba'i 'bras bu de ni /
translated: The fruit of once return and nonreturn

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'bras bu spong ba 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'bras bu spong ba 'ba' zhig kyang ma yin te /
translated: are not only the abandonment of the fruit by the mundane path.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis 'bras bu spangs pa yang der bsre bar bya ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis 'bras bu spangs pa yang der bsre bar bya ste /
translated: The abandonment of the fruit by the path of seeing is also mixed with it,

original: thams cad kyi thob pa ni de'i 'bras bur bsdus pa gcig rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thob pa ni de'i 'bras bur bsdus pa gcig rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the obtainment of all is subsumed in its fruit and one obtains it.

original: de gnyis kyi phyir @230b mod las 'di skad du /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi phyir @230b mod las 'di skad du /
translated: For that reason, the Abhidharmakosa observes:

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fruit of once return?

original: kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams bsrabs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug rnams bsrabs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of three fetters and the reduction of attachment, aversion and delusion.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fruit of nonreturn?

original: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pa gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pa gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the abandonment of the five factors associated with inferior states.

original: zag pa med pa'i bral ba'i thob pas ni spangs pa de 'dzin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bral ba'i thob pas ni spangs pa de 'dzin te /
translated: The obtainment of separation from contaminants severs that abandonment.

original: de'i mthus yongs su nyams kyang mi 'chi bas de'i phyir dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bur rigs so //
analyzed: de'i mthus yongs su nyams kyang mi 'chi bas de'i phyir dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bur rigs so //
translated: Because one does not die through the power of that, it is logical that it is the result of the system of training in virtue.

original: de ltar dge sbyong gi tshul du bshad pa gang yin la /
analyzed: de ltar dge sbyong gi tshul du bshad pa gang yin la /
translated: The system of training in virtue is explained as follows:

original: de nyid bram ze tshangs pa yi /
analyzed: de nyid bram ze tshangs pa yi /
translated: That is a brahmin, a brahman.

original: 'khor lo // nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir na bram ze'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo // nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir na bram ze'o //
translated: Because it abandons afflictions, it is a brahmin.

original: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo ni /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo ni /
translated: The wheel of Brahmā

original: tshangs pas bskor phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pas bskor phyir ro //
translated: is the wheel of Brahmā because it is turned by Brahmā.

original: bla na med pa tshangs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni tshangs pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa tshangs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das ni tshangs pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavān is Brahmā because he possesses unsurpassed purity.

original: 'di ni de'i 'khor lo yin pas na tshangs pa'i yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni de'i 'khor lo yin pas na tshangs pa'i yin te /
translated: This is his wheel, therefore it is Brahmā’s.🔽A sūtra states:

original: mdo las / bcom ldan 'das de ni changs pa zhes kyang bya /🔽zhi ba zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: mdo las / bcom ldan 'das de ni changs pa zhes kyang bya / zhi ba zhes kyang bya /
translated: The Bhagavān is also called Brahmā,🔽also called Śiva,

original: bsil bar gyur pa zhes kyang bya'o zhes kyang 'byung la /
analyzed: bsil bar gyur pa zhes kyang bya'o zhes kyang 'byung la /
translated: also called cool.

original: des bskor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bskor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is surrounded by the latter.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo mthong ba'i lam //
translated: The wheel of the Dharma is the path of insight.

original: rgyu bas na 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: rgyu bas na 'khor lo'o //
translated: It is a wheel because it moves.

original: de dang chos mthun pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam ni chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dang chos mthun pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam ni chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya'o //
translated: The path of insight is called the wheel of the Dharma because it has the same name as the wheel.

original: ji ltar na de'i chos mthun pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de'i chos mthun pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it similar to a wheel?

original: myur bar 'gro dang rtsibs sogs las //
analyzed: myur bar 'gro dang rtsibs sogs las //
translated: Because it moves quickly, because it has spokes, etc.

original: myur bar 'gro ba'i phyir ni 'dor ba dang 'gro ba dang / ma rgyal ba rgyal bar bya ba dang / rgyal ba rnams rnal du 'god pa dang / 'phar ba dang 'bab pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: myur bar 'gro ba'i phyir ni 'dor ba dang 'gro ba dang / ma rgyal ba rgyal bar bya ba dang / rgyal ba rnams rnal du 'god pa dang / 'phar ba dang 'bab pa'i phyir te /
translated: It moves quickly, because it abandons, it goes, it conquers what has not been conquered, it stabilizes what has been conquered, it jumps, it descends.

original: de ltar na myur bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na myur bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it moves quickly.

original: btsun pa dbyangs can na re /
analyzed: btsun pa dbyangs can na re /
translated: The Venerable Ghoṣaka says:

original: 'phags pa'i lam brgyad ni rtsibs la sogs pa dang / chos mthun pa'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo zhes zer to //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam brgyad ni rtsibs la sogs pa dang / chos mthun pa'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo zhes zer to //
translated: The noble eightfold path is called the wheel of the Dharma because it has the same name as the wheel.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / rtsol ba dang / dran pa rnams ni rtsibs lta bu yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / rtsol ba dang / dran pa rnams ni rtsibs lta bu yin no //
translated: Right view, thought, effort, and mindfulness are like spokes.

original: yang dag ba'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba rnams ni lte ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: yang dag ba'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba rnams ni lte ba lta bu yin no //
translated: Right speech, right action and right livelihood are like the hub.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mu khyud lta bu yin pas na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mu khyud lta bu yin pas na /
translated: Right concentration is like the rim.

original: mthong ba'i lam ni chos gyi  'khor lo yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni chos gyi  'khor lo yin no //
translated: Thus the path of insight is the wheel of the Dharma.

original: de ga las she na /
analyzed: de ga las she na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'phags pa kun shes koondi n+ya'i de skye ba na /
analyzed: 'phags pa kun shes koondi n+ya'i de skye ba na /
translated: Because it is said that when the noble Kauṇḍinya generated the path of insight,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: he turned the wheel of the Dharma.

original: ji ltar na de lan gsum du bzlas pa dang / rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de lan gsum du bzlas pa dang / rnam pa bcu gnyis su bskor ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it repeated three times and how is it turned twelve times?

original: @231a * // 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: @231a * // 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: This is the noble truth of suffering.

original: de yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be fully known.🔽It is fully known.

original: de yongs su shes so zhes bya ba de ni lan gsum bzlas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yongs su shes so zhes bya ba de ni lan gsum bzlas pa yin no //
translated: This is the third repetition.

original: bzlas pa re re zhing yang 'di ltar bden pa re re la mig skyes so zhes pa dang / rig pa dang blo skyes so zhes bya ba de dag ni rnam pa bcu gnyis yin no //
analyzed: bzlas pa re re zhing yang 'di ltar bden pa re re la mig skyes so zhes pa dang / rig pa dang blo skyes so zhes bya ba de dag ni rnam pa bcu gnyis yin no //
translated: In each repetition, the eye of the Dharma arose with regard to each truth, and knowledge and understanding arose. These are the twelve aspects.

original: gsum pa dang bcu gnyis bar chos mthun pa'i phyir lan gsum du bzlas pa dang / rnam pa bcu gnyis zhes bshad de /
analyzed: gsum pa dang bcu gnyis bar chos mthun pa'i phyir lan gsum du bzlas pa dang / rnam pa bcu gnyis zhes bshad de /
translated: It is called “three times” and “twelve aspects” because the third and twelfth are similar.

original: dper na gnyis dang gnas bdun la mkhas pa zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na gnyis dang gnas bdun la mkhas pa zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: For example, it is explained that one is skilled in two and seven bases.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag na re bskor ba de dag gis ni rim bzhin du mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam rnams bstan to zhes zer te /🔽gal te de ltar na mthong ba'i lam 'ba' zhig la lan gsum du bzlas pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag na re bskor ba de dag gis ni rim bzhin du mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam rnams bstan to zhes zer te / gal te de ltar na mthong ba'i lam 'ba' zhig la lan gsum du bzlas pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Those revolutions respectively teach the paths of seeing, meditation and no more learning.

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, then the path of seeing is neither repeated three times nor has twelve aspects.

original: ji ltar na chos kyi 'khor lor rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos kyi 'khor lor rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: How is it posited as the wheel of Dharma?

original: de bas na chos kyi rnam grangs de nyid chos kyi 'khor lo yin zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na chos kyi rnam grangs de nyid chos kyi 'khor lo yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, is that enumeration of Dharma itself the wheel of Dharma?

original: lam gsum du bzlas pa dang rnam pa bcu gnyis yin par yang rigs so //
analyzed: lam gsum du bzlas pa dang rnam pa bcu gnyis yin par yang rigs so //
translated: It is also correct that it is three times and twelve aspects.

original: ji ltar na lan gsum du bzlas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na lan gsum du bzlas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it repeated three times?

original: bden pa rnams lan gsum du bzlas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams lan gsum du bzlas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the truths are repeated three times.

original: ji ltar na rnam pa bcu gnyis yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam pa bcu gnyis yin zhe na /
translated: How are there twelve aspects?

original: bden pa bzhi la rnam pa gsum du byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi la rnam pa gsum du byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the four truths are taken as three aspects each:🔽the aspects of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path,🔽and the aspects of thoroughly knowing, abandoning, manifesting, and cultivating,

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam zhes bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / mngon du bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba zhes bya ba dang / yongs su shes pa dang /🔽spangs pa dang / mngon du byas pa dang / bsgoms pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang lam zhes bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba dang / mngon du bya ba dang / bsgom par bya ba zhes bya ba dang / yongs su shes pa dang / spangs pa dang / mngon du byas pa dang / bsgoms pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and the aspects of thoroughly knowing, abandoning, manifesting, and cultivating.

original: de'i bskor ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud la don go bar byed pa'i phyir 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i bskor ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud la don go bar byed pa'i phyir 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Its turning is its going, because it causes the meaning to be understood in the mindstream of another.

original: yang na 'phags pa'i lam thams cad kyang 'dul ba'i rgyud la 'jug pa'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'phags pa'i lam thams cad kyang 'dul ba'i rgyud la 'jug pa'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo yin te /
translated: Or, all the noble paths are the wheel of Dharma because they engage the mindstream of the one to be tamed.

original: de ni gzhan gyi rgyud la mthong ba'i lam bskyed pa'i phyir bskor bar rtsom pas de'i phyir bskor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi rgyud la mthong ba'i lam bskyed pa'i phyir bskor bar rtsom pas de'i phyir bskor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “wheel” because it is set in motion in order to generate the path of seeing in the mindstreams of others.

original: yang na khams gang dag tu dge sbyong gi 'bras bu du dag cig 'thob ce na /🔽'dod par gsum 'thob /
analyzed: yang na khams gang dag tu dge sbyong gi 'bras bu du dag cig 'thob ce na / 'dod par gsum 'thob /
translated: In which realms do beings obtain the results of the sramana?🔽Three are obtained in the desire realm.

original: gsum ni 'dod pa'i khams 'ba' zhig tu 'thob kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum ni 'dod pa'i khams 'ba' zhig tu 'thob kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Only three are obtained in the desire realm and not elsewhere.

original: tha ma ni /
analyzed: tha ma ni /
translated: The last is obtained🔽in three realms.

original: gsum du / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu tha ma dang / @231b dgra bcom pa nyid kyi khams gsum char du yang 'thob bo //🔽re zhig 'bras bu gnyis ni /
analyzed: gsum du / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu tha ma dang / @231b dgra bcom pa nyid kyi khams gsum char du yang 'thob bo // re zhig 'bras bu gnyis ni /
translated: The last result, arhatship, is obtained in the three realms.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral bas thob par bya ba min pa'i phyir gong mar mi 'thob pa yang rigs na /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral bas thob par bya ba min pa'i phyir gong mar mi 'thob pa yang rigs na /
translated: It is logical that the first two results are not obtained in higher realms because they are not obtained by those who are not free from attachment.

original: gsum pa go ci'i phyir mi 'thob ce na /🔽gong na mthong lam med /
analyzed: gsum pa go ci'i phyir mi 'thob ce na / gong na mthong lam med /
translated: But why is the third not obtained in higher realms?🔽The path of seeing does not exist in higher realms.

original: 'dod pa'i khams las gong na ni mthong ba'i lam med la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las gong na ni mthong ba'i lam med la /
translated: The path of seeing does not exist in higher realms above the desire realm.

original: de med par ni 'dod chags dang bral bas phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'thob pa med de /
analyzed: de med par ni 'dod chags dang bral bas phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'thob pa med de /
translated: Without it, one cannot obtain the fruit of non-returner through detachment.

original: de ni gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: de ni gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: This is the reason.

original: ci'i phyir de dag na mthong ba'i lam med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag na mthong ba'i lam med ce na /
translated: Why is the path of insight absent in these two realms?

original: re zhig gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni nyan pa med pa dang / khams 'og ma la ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re zhig gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni nyan pa med pa dang / khams 'og ma la ni mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the formless realms, there is no listening, and in the lower realms, the formless realms are not the domain of the path of insight.

original: gzugs kyi khams dag na ni /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dag na ni /
translated: In the realm of form,

original: skye med phyir dang 'dir brtsams te //
analyzed: skye med phyir dang 'dir brtsams te //
translated: because of the absence of birth,🔽and because of the beginning of the path of insight,

original: de mthar phyin zhes lung las byung //
analyzed: de mthar phyin zhes lung las byung //
translated: the path of insight is absent there.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba la chags pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba med pa'i phyir skyo bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba la chags pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba med pa'i phyir skyo bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: The ordinary worldlings of the realm of form are not disgusted with suffering, because they are attached to the pleasure of meditative attainment and because they do not experience the sensation of suffering.

original: skyo ba med pa ni 'phags pa'i lam thob par mi nus te /
analyzed: skyo ba med pa ni 'phags pa'i lam thob par mi nus te /
translated: And without disgust, one cannot obtain the noble path.

original: re zhig de ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig de ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: This is the reasoning.

original: lung las kyang bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nas gong du 'pho ba'i bar gyi gang zag lnga po de dag ni /
analyzed: lung las kyang bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba nas gong du 'pho ba'i bar gyi gang zag lnga po de dag ni /
translated: The five types of person, from the one attaining nirvana in the intermediate state to the one who transfers to a higher level,

original: 'dir rtsom par byed pa der mthar phyin par 'gyur zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'dir rtsom par byed pa der mthar phyin par 'gyur zhes 'byung ste /
translated: begin here and perfect it there.

original: rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'da' ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir lam rtsom pa yin no //
analyzed: rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'da' ba'i thabs yin pa'i phyir lam rtsom pa yin no //
translated: Here, “begin” means to begin the path because it is the method for attaining nirvana.

original: 'di skad du gal te mi g-yo ba'i chos can zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te mi g-yo ba'i chos can zhig yin na ni /
translated: If one is a nonreturner who is a nonlearner,🔽the knowledge of nonarising arises from the knowledge of elimination.

original: zad pa'i ye shes las mi skye ba'i ye shes skye'o zhes bshad na de ni dgra bcom pa la yang dbye ba yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: zad pa'i ye shes las mi skye ba'i ye shes skye'o zhes bshad na de ni dgra bcom pa la yang dbye ba yod dam zhe na /
translated: But if one is an arhat, is there a classification of arhats?

original: yod ces bya ste /🔽dgra bcom drug 'dod /
analyzed: yod ces bya ste / dgra bcom drug 'dod /
translated: There is, because🔽six types of arhat are asserted.🔽A sutra declares:

original: mdo las dgra bcom pa ni drug tu gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las dgra bcom pa ni drug tu gsungs te /
translated: There are six types of arhat.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa dang / rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can dang / gnas pa la mi bskyod pa dang / rtogs pa'i skal ba can dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa dang / rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can dang / gnas pa la mi bskyod pa dang / rtogs pa'i skal ba can dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
translated: 1. the one who regresses, 2. the one who is intent on death, 3. the one who guards the path, 4. the one who is unshakable in his stage, 5. the one who is capable of penetrating, 6. the one who is unshakable.

original: de dag las /
analyzed: de dag las /
translated: Among these,

original: lnga ni dad pas mos las skye'o //
analyzed: lnga ni dad pas mos las skye'o //
translated: five are born from the one who is convinced through faith.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can ma gtogs pa gzhan lnga ni dad pas mos pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //🔽de dag rnam grol dus dang sbyor //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can ma gtogs pa gzhan lnga ni dad pas mos pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin no // de dag rnam grol dus dang sbyor //
translated: The other five, with the exception of the one who is unshakable, are born from the one who is convinced through faith.🔽The five are liberated through circumstances.

original: lnga po de dag dus dang sbyor ba dang / rtag tu rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir dga' ba'i sems rnam par grol bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lnga po de dag dus dang sbyor ba dang / rtag tu rjes su bsrung ba'i phyir dga' ba'i sems rnam par grol bar rig par bya ste /
translated: These five are liberated through circumstances and through joy, because they always guard their liberation.

original: de nyid kyi @232a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi @232a * //
translated: For this very reason,

original: phyir de dag ni dus kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyir de dag ni dus kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: they are called “circumstantially liberated.”

original: de dag ni dus la ltos pa yang yin rnam par grol ba yang yin pas na dus kyis rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: de dag ni dus la ltos pa yang yin rnam par grol ba yang yin pas na dus kyis rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: They are liberated through circumstances, because they are liberated through circumstances.

original: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The middle word is elided, as in “He is a brāhmaṇa and a king.”

original: mar gyi bum pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mar gyi bum pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: like a pot of butter, like a pot of milk.

original: de dag ni yo byad dang nad med pa dang dus kyi bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir dus la ltos shing ting nge 'dzin mngon du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni yo byad dang nad med pa dang dus kyi bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir dus la ltos shing ting nge 'dzin mngon du byed pa yin no //
translated: These two are dependent on time, because they manifest concentration in dependence on the distinction of time and the distinction of the articles of daily use and health.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can mi g-yo ba /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can mi g-yo ba /
translated: The immovable is the immovable one.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i sgo nas bskyed par mi nus pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i sgo nas bskyed par mi nus pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba yin no //
translated: The immovable one is unshakable liberation, because it is incapable of being shaken by the defilements.

original: de'i phyir de dus mi sbyor grol //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dus mi sbyor grol //
translated: Therefore, he is liberated independent of time.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba zhes bya ste /
translated: For this very reason, he is called the one liberated independent of time.

original: de ni 'dod dgur ting nge 'dzin mngon du byed pa'i phyir dus la mi ltos pa dang rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dod dgur ting nge 'dzin mngon du byed pa'i phyir dus la mi ltos pa dang rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: He is independent of time, because he manifests concentration at will, and he is unshakable.🔽The one liberated independent of time is so called because he is liberated for a certain time and because he is liberated permanently.

original: dus gzhan gyi bar du rnam par grol ba dang / gtan du rnam par grol ba'i phyir dus kyis rnam par grol ba dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'am /
analyzed: dus gzhan gyi bar du rnam par grol ba dang / gtan du rnam par grol ba'i phyir dus kyis rnam par grol ba dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'am /
translated: The one liberated independent of time is so called because he is liberated independent of time.

original: yongs su nyams pa srid pa dang / mi srid pa'i phyir dus kyis rnam par grol ba dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa srid pa dang / mi srid pa'i phyir dus kyis rnam par grol ba dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: The steadfast one is of the family of the one who obtains nirvāṇa with preparation.

original: de ni mthong thob rgyu las byung /
analyzed: de ni mthong thob rgyu las byung /
translated: The steadfast one is of the family of the one who goes higher.🔽The steadfast one is of the family of the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the realm of finemateriality.🔽The steadfast one is of the family of the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the formless realm.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can de ni mthong bas thob pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin par rig par bya'o //🔽ci dgra bcom pa drug po de dag dang po kho na nas de'i rigs can yin nam /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can de ni mthong bas thob pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin par rig par bya'o // ci dgra bcom pa drug po de dag dang po kho na nas de'i rigs can yin nam /
translated: The steadfast one is of the family of the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the realm of desire.

original: 'on te phyis de'i rigs can du gyur pa zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te phyis de'i rigs can du gyur pa zhig yin zhe na /
translated: The steadfast one is of the family of the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the realm of desire.

original: kha cig dang po nas de'i rigs //🔽kha cig sbyangs pa las 'gyur te //
analyzed: kha cig dang po nas de'i rigs // kha cig sbyangs pa las 'gyur te //
translated: The steadfast one is of the family of the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the realm of desire.

original: kha cig ni dang po kho na nas 'chi bar sems pa'i rigs can yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni dang po kho na nas 'chi bar sems pa'i rigs can yin no //
translated: The steadfast one is of the family of the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the realm of desire.🔽The steadfast one is of the family of the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the realm of desire.🔽The steadfast one is of the family of the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the realm of desire.🔽The steadfast one is of the family of the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the realm of desire.🔽The steadfast one is of the family of the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the realm of desire.🔽The steadfast one is of the family of the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the realm of desire.🔽The steadfast one is of the family of the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the realm of desire.🔽The steadfast one is of the family of the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the realm of desire.🔽The steadfast one is of the family of the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the realm of desire.

original: kha cig ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can du gyur nas dbang po rnams sbyangs pas 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: kha cig ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can du gyur nas dbang po rnams sbyangs pas 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can du gyur pa yin no //
translated: The steadfast one is of the family of the one who obtains nirvāṇa in the realm of desire.🔽The

original: de bzhin du mi g-yo ba'i chos can du gyur gyi bar du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi g-yo ba'i chos can du gyur gyi bar du rig par bya'o //
translated: The same applies up to the one who is unshakable.

original: de las yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can gang yin pa'o //
translated: The one who regresses is the one who has the fortune to regress.

original: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can ni 'chi bar sems par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can ni 'chi bar sems par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can gang yin pa'o //
translated: The one who is resolved on death is the one who has the fortune to be resolved on death.

original: rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can ni rjes su srung bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba can gang yin ba'o //🔽gnas pa las mi bskyod pa ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rkyen stobs dang ldan pa med na /
analyzed: rjes su bsrung ba'i chos can ni rjes su srung bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba can gang yin ba'o // gnas pa las mi bskyod pa ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rkyen stobs dang ldan pa med na /
translated: The one who is resolved on guarding is the one who has the fortune to guard.🔽The one who is unshakable in abiding is the one who has the fortune to abide without regressing,🔽even without the conditions for regression, and without increasing, even without striving,

original: rjes su ma @232b bsrungs kyang gnas pa dang nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / mngon par brtson pa med na 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba'i skal ba can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su ma @232b bsrungs kyang gnas pa dang nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / mngon par brtson pa med na 'phel bar mi 'gyur ba'i skal ba can gang yin pa'o //
translated: if he is not guarded.

original: rtogs pa'i skal ba can ni mi g-yo ba'i sems rnam par grol ba rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgal ba can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i skal ba can ni mi g-yo ba'i sems rnam par grol ba rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgal ba can gang yin pa'o //
translated: The one who is resolved on penetrating is the one who has the fortune to penetrate the unshakable liberation of mind.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i skal ba can gang yin ba'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i skal ba can gang yin ba'o //
translated: The immovable one is the one who has the nature of not retrogressing.

original: dang po gnyis ni sngon slob pa'i gnas skabs nyid na rgyun du sbyor ba dang gus par sbyor ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: dang po gnyis ni sngon slob pa'i gnas skabs nyid na rgyun du sbyor ba dang gus par sbyor ba med pa yin no //
translated: The first two have not practiced constantly and with respect in the period of learning.

original: gsum pa ni rgyud du sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni rgyud du sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The third has practiced with a weak mind.

original: bzhi pa ni gus par sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gus par sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The fourth has practiced with respect.

original: lnga pa ni gnyi gar sbyor ba dang dbang po rtul po yin no //
analyzed: lnga pa ni gnyi gar sbyor ba dang dbang po rtul po yin no //
translated: The fifth has practiced in both ways, but with weak faculties.

original: drug pa ni gnyi gar sbyor ba dang dbang po rnon po yin no //
analyzed: drug pa ni gnyi gar sbyor ba dang dbang po rnon po yin no //
translated: The sixth has practiced in both ways and has sharp faculties.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yang gdon mi za bar yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin la /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yang gdon mi za bar yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin la /
translated: The one who is subject to retrogressing does not necessarily retrogress;

original: rtogs pa'i skal ba can gyi bar du yang rtogs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin mod kyi srid pa'i phyir de skad ces brjod do//
analyzed: rtogs pa'i skal ba can gyi bar du yang rtogs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin mod kyi srid pa'i phyir de skad ces brjod do//
translated: and the one who is capable of penetrating to the realization of the fruit does not necessarily realize the fruit.

original: de ltar byas na khams gsum char na yang dgra bcom pa drug tu rigs so //
analyzed: de ltar byas na khams gsum char na yang dgra bcom pa drug tu rigs so //
translated: Thus, in the three realms, there are six types of perfected beings.

original: gang dag gi gdon mi za bar yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba nas mngon par rtogs pa'i bar du 'gyur ba de dag gi ltar na /
analyzed: gang dag gi gdon mi za bar yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba nas mngon par rtogs pa'i bar du 'gyur ba de dag gi ltar na /
translated: Those who necessarily retrogress from the fruit of arhatship, up to those who necessarily retrogress from the stage of the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to suffering, are of two types:

original: 'dod pa'i khams na ni dgra bcom pa drug go //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na ni dgra bcom pa drug go //
translated: In the realm of desire, there are six types of arhats.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag ni gnas pa las mi bskyod pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can gnyis te /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag ni gnas pa las mi bskyod pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can gnyis te /
translated: In the realms of form and of the formless, there are two types: those who are unshakable and those who are liable to retrogress.

original: de nyid las yongs su nyams pa dang / 'chi bar sems pa dang / dbang po 'pho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid las yongs su nyams pa dang / 'chi bar sems pa dang / dbang po 'pho ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no retrogressing from the fruit, no retrogressing from the stage of receptivity, no retrogressing from the stage of cognition, no retrogressing from the stage of subsequent cognition, no retrogressing from the stage of the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to the path, and no retrogressing from the stage of the cognition of the factors with regard to the path.

original: yang de dag gang zhig 'bras bu'am rigs gang las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang de dag gang zhig 'bras bu'am rigs gang las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: From what fruit and from what family do they retrogress?

original: bzhi ni rigs las lnga 'bras las //
analyzed: bzhi ni rigs las lnga 'bras las //
translated: Four retrogress from the family, five from the fruit.

original: nyams te / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa bzhi ni /
analyzed: nyams te / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa bzhi ni /
translated: The four, the one who is susceptible to retrogressing, etc.,

original: rigs las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: retrogress from the family gotra.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni rang gi rigs las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni rang gi rigs las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The one who is susceptible to retrogressing from the fruit does not retrogress from his family.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa lnga ni /🔽'bras bu las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa lnga ni / 'bras bu las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: The five, such as the one susceptible to complete degeneration,🔽degenetate from their result.

original: de dag las /🔽snga ma las ma yin /
analyzed: de dag las / snga ma las ma yin /
translated: From which of these do they degenerate?🔽They do not degenerate from the first.

original: gang gi rigs dang bo gang yin pa de las ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi rigs dang bo gang yin pa de las ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
translated: They do not degenerate from the first type of faculty they obtained,

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa lam gyis brtan por byas pa'i phyir ro //🔽slob pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis brtan por @233a * //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa lam gyis brtan por byas pa'i phyir ro // slob pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis brtan por @233a * //
translated: because they have been stabilized by the path of training and the path of no longer training.

original: byas pa'i phyir yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not degenerate from the first result they obtained,🔽because they have been stabilized by the mundane and transcendent paths.

original: phyis dbang po sbyangs pa thob pa gang yin pa de las ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis dbang po sbyangs pa thob pa gang yin pa de las ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: They do degenerate from the faculty obtained later,🔽because it is not stabilized by the mundane path.

original: gang gi 'bras bu dang po gang yin pa de las kyang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi 'bras bu dang po gang yin pa de las kyang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They do not degenerate from the first result they obtained,🔽because it is stabilized by the transcendent path.

original: lhag pa las ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag pa las ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: They do degenerate from the higher results,🔽because they are not stabilized by the mundane path.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa med do //
translated: For that reason, there is no degeneration from the result of stream entry.

original: ci dgra bcom pa drug po de dag 'ba' zhig la rigs drug yin nam 'on te gzhan dag la yang rigs yong ce na /
analyzed: ci dgra bcom pa drug po de dag 'ba' zhig la rigs drug yin nam 'on te gzhan dag la yang rigs yong ce na /
translated: Are the six types of Noble Ones the only ones who possess the families?

original: slob dang 'phags min rnams la yang //🔽rigs drug / slob pa dang so so'i skye bo rnams la yang rigs drug yod do //
analyzed: slob dang 'phags min rnams la yang // rigs drug / slob pa dang so so'i skye bo rnams la yang rigs drug yod do //
translated: The families exist also in those in training and in those who are not Āryans.🔽The families exist also in those in training and in ordinary worldlings.

original: dgra bcom pa'i rigs rnams kyang de dag gi rgyu las byung ba nyid yin no //🔽'on kyang / mthong la 'pho ba med /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i rigs rnams kyang de dag gi rgyu las byung ba nyid yin no // 'on kyang / mthong la 'pho ba med /
translated: The families of the perfected beings are also the cause of the families of those in training and of ordinary worldlings.🔽But there is no change of family on the path of insight.

original: mthong ba'i lam las gzhan dag la dbang po 'pho ba yod kyi sbyor ba med pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam las gzhan dag la dbang po 'pho ba yod kyi sbyor ba med pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la ni ma yin no //
translated: There is no change of family on the path of insight, because this path is swift.

original: la la ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas nyid dag tu dbang po rnams 'pho bar byed do //
analyzed: la la ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas nyid dag tu dbang po rnams 'pho bar byed do //
translated: Some, in the state of ordinary worldling, change their faculties.

original: la la ni dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa'i gnas skabs dag tu dbang po 'pho bar byed do //
analyzed: la la ni dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa'i gnas skabs dag tu dbang po 'pho bar byed do //
translated: Some, in the state of those who are freed through predominance of faith and of those who have attained through views, change their faculties.

original: mdo las ji skad du gang zhig gis lhag pa'i sems bzhi la mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa thob pa de ni /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du gang zhig gis lhag pa'i sems bzhi la mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa thob pa de ni /
translated: I declare that one who obtains abiding in comfort in this life through the four superior states

original: de gang yang rung ba zhig las yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar nga smra'i /
analyzed: de gang yang rung ba zhig las yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar nga smra'i /
translated: may fully degenerate from any of them.

analyzed: ming gi sgo nas ni gang zag de bdun yin no //

analyzed: ji tsam gyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i slob pa yin zhe na /
translated: By how much is training perfected?🔽It is said that training is perfected

original: snyoms 'jug dbang po 'bras rnams kyis //🔽rdzogs pa'i slob ba zhes bya'o //🔽rnam pa gsum gyis na /
analyzed: snyoms 'jug dbang po 'bras rnams kyis // rdzogs pa'i slob ba zhes bya'o // rnam pa gsum gyis na /
translated: by meditative attainment, faculties, and results.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i slob pa yin te /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i slob pa yin te /
translated: Training is perfected by three aspects:

original: snyoms par 'jug pa las ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa las ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'o //
translated: From the point of view of absorption, it is the attainment of the absorption of cessation.

original: dbang po las ni mthong bas thob //
analyzed: dbang po las ni mthong bas thob //
translated: From the point of view of the faculties, it is the approacher of the fruit of arhatship.

original: 'bras bu las ni phyir mi 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu las ni phyir mi 'ong ba ste /
translated: From the point of view of the fruits, it is the non-returner.

original: de ltar na yongs su rdzogs pa'i slob pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yongs su rdzogs pa'i slob pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the perfected being is complete in all the aspects.

original: de la 'bras bu 'ba' zhig las ni phyir mi 'ong ba dang @235a * //🔽dad pas mos pa lus kyis mngon du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu 'ba' zhig las ni phyir mi 'ong ba dang @235a * // dad pas mos pa lus kyis mngon du mi byed pa'o //
translated: From the point of view of the fruits alone, it is the non-returner.

original: dbang po 'ba' zhig las ni mthong bas thob pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po 'ba' zhig las ni mthong bas thob pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: From the point of view of the faculties alone, it is the one who obtains through views who is detached.

original: 'bras bu dang dbang po las ni phyir mi 'ong ba mthong bas thob pa lus kyis mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang dbang po las ni phyir mi 'ong ba mthong bas thob pa lus kyis mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: From the point of view of the fruits and the faculties, it is the non-returner who obtains through views and who realizes with the body.

original: de 'bras bu dang snyoms par 'jug pa las ni dad bas mos pa lus kyis mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de 'bras bu dang snyoms par 'jug pa las ni dad bas mos pa lus kyis mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: From the point of view of the fruits and the absorptions, it is the one who is convinced through faith and who does not realize with the body.

original: 'bras bu dang dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug ba las ni mthong bas thob pa lus kyis mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug ba las ni mthong bas thob pa lus kyis mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: From the point of view of the fruits, the faculties and the absorptions, it is the one who obtains through views and who realizes with the body.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa 'ba' zhig dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang dbang po las ni yongs su rdzogs pa nyid med do //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa 'ba' zhig dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang dbang po las ni yongs su rdzogs pa nyid med do //
translated: There is no perfection through meditative attainment alone, or through meditative attainment and faculties.

original: gnyis kyis mi slob yongs su rdzogs //
analyzed: gnyis kyis mi slob yongs su rdzogs //
translated: The perfected being is perfected through two.

original: dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug pa las so //
analyzed: dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug pa las so //
translated: He is perfected through faculties and through meditative attainment.

original: 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i mi slob pa nyid ni med pas 'di'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pas yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du rnam par ma bzhag go //
analyzed: 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pa'i mi slob pa nyid ni med pas 'di'i 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pas yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du rnam par ma bzhag go //
translated: The perfected being who is not a learner is not perfected through his result, for the latter is not susceptible to perfection.

original: dbang po 'ba' zhig las ni shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po 'ba' zhig las ni shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The perfected being who is liberated through wisdom is perfected through his faculties alone.

original: snyoms par 'jug ba 'ba' zhig las gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dus kyis rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug ba 'ba' zhig las gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dus kyis rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The perfected being who is liberated through both parts is perfected through meditative attainment alone.

original: dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug pa gnyi ga las ni gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug pa gnyi ga las ni gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The perfected being who is not a learner, that is, the perfected being who is liberated through both parts, is perfected through both his faculties and his meditative attainment.

original: de ltar 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam rnams dang / sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang khyad par can gyi lam zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam rnams dang / sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba dang khyad par can gyi lam zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, the mundane path, the supramundane path, the path of seeing, the path of cultivation, the path of no learning, the path of preparation, the uninterrupted path, the path of liberation, and the special path.

original: lam gyi bye brag mang po bshad pa de dag mdor bsdu na lam rnam pa du zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: lam gyi bye brag mang po bshad pa de dag mdor bsdu na lam rnam pa du zhig yin zhe na /
translated: The many different types of paths that have been explained are, in brief, how many types of paths?

original: mdor na lam ni rnam bzhi ste //
analyzed: mdor na lam ni rnam bzhi ste //
translated: In brief, the path is fourfold:🔽The special path, the path of liberation,

original: khyad par can dang rnam grol dang // bar chad med dang sbyor zhes bya //
analyzed: khyad par can dang rnam grol dang // bar chad med dang sbyor zhes bya //
translated: the uninterrupted path, and the path of preparation.

original: sbyor ba'i lam ni gang las bar chad med pa'i lam skye'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam ni gang las bar chad med pa'i lam skye'o //
translated: The path of preparation is that from which the uninterrupted path arises.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam ni gang gis sgrib pa spong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam ni gang gis sgrib pa spong bar byed pa'o //
translated: The uninterrupted path is that by which obstructions are abandoned.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam ni des sgrib pa spangs pa las dang po nyid du nges par grol ba skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam ni des sgrib pa spangs pa las dang po nyid du nges par grol ba skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The path of liberation is that from which liberation arises for the first time from the obstructions that have been abandoned by that uninterrupted path.

original: khyad par can gyi lam ni de las gzhan pa'i lam gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi lam ni de las gzhan pa'i lam gang yin pa'o //
translated: The special path is any path other than those.

original: ci'i phyir lam zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lam zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the path?

original: des der 'gro ba'i phyir ram des mya ngan las 'das pa tshol ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: des der 'gro ba'i phyir ram des mya ngan las 'das pa tshol ba'i phyir na /
translated: Because it goes there, or because it seeks nirvana,

original: de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yin no //
translated: it is the path to nirvana.

original: rnam par grol ba dang khyad par du 'gro ba'i lam gnyis ji ltar na lam yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba dang khyad par du 'gro ba'i lam gnyis ji ltar na lam yin zhe na /
translated: How are the path of liberation and the path of distinction paths?

original: de'i @235b rigs can yin pa'am /
analyzed: de'i @235b rigs can yin pa'am /
translated: Because they are of the same type,

original: ches che ba yin pa'am /
analyzed: ches che ba yin pa'am /
translated: because they are superior,

original: gong nas gong du phyin par byed pa'am /
analyzed: gong nas gong du phyin par byed pa'am /
translated: because they cause one to go higher,

original: phung po lhag ma ma lus par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma ma lus par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because they cause one to enter the realm of nirvana without remainder.

original: lam ni mya ngan las 'das pa bsgrub pa'i phyir sgrub pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: lam ni mya ngan las 'das pa bsgrub pa'i phyir sgrub pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: The path is also called “practice” because it establishes nirvana.

original: sgrub pa ni rnam pa bzhi'o //🔽mngon par shes pa bul ba sgrub pa dka' ba yang yod /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni rnam pa bzhi'o // mngon par shes pa bul ba sgrub pa dka' ba yang yod /
translated: There are four kinds of practice:🔽There is a practice whose higher knowledge is slow and difficult.

original: mngon par shes pa myur ba sgrub pa dka' ba yang yod /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa myur ba sgrub pa dka' ba yang yod /
translated: There is a practice whose higher knowledge is quick and difficult.

original: de bzhin du sla ba yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sla ba yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: There are two kinds of easy practices.

original: de la / bsam gtan dag la lam sgrub sla //
analyzed: de la / bsam gtan dag la lam sgrub sla //
translated: In the absorptions, the path is easy to practice.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dag na ni yan lag yongs su 'dus pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa dang / 'bad mi dgos pas 'jug pa'i phyir lam sgrub par sla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dag na ni yan lag yongs su 'dus pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa dang / 'bad mi dgos pas 'jug pa'i phyir lam sgrub par sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the four meditations, the path is easy to practice, because the members are complete, calm abiding and insight are balanced, and one proceeds effortlessly.

original: sa gzhan dag na dka' ba yin //
analyzed: sa gzhan dag na dka' ba yin //
translated: It is difficult on other stages.

original: gzhan mi lcogs pa med pa dang // bsam gtan khyad par can dang gzugs med pa dag na ni yan lag yongs su ma 'dus pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong chung du dang / 'bad pas 'jug pa'i phyir ram sgrub dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan mi lcogs pa med pa dang // bsam gtan khyad par can dang gzugs med pa dag na ni yan lag yongs su ma 'dus pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong chung du dang / 'bad pas 'jug pa'i phyir ram sgrub dka' ba yin te /
translated: In other stages, namely, the preparatory meditation, the special meditation, and the formless realm, the path is difficult to practice, because the members are incomplete, calm abiding and insight are weak, and one proceeds with effort.

original: mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dag na ni zhi gnas chung ngo //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dag na ni zhi gnas chung ngo //
translated: In the preparatory meditation and the special meditation, calm abiding is weak.

original: gzugs med pa na ni lhag mthong chung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na ni lhag mthong chung ngo //
translated: In the formless realm, insight is weak.

original: sgrub pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sgrub pa de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This practice is of two kinds:

original: blo chung mngon shes bul ba ste //
analyzed: blo chung mngon shes bul ba ste //
translated: Slow direct knowledge for those of weak mind,

original: gzhan ni mngon par shes pa myur //
analyzed: gzhan ni mngon par shes pa myur //
translated: and quick direct knowledge for others.

original: dbang po rtul po ni sgrub sla'am dka' yang rung ste /
analyzed: dbang po rtul po ni sgrub sla'am dka' yang rung ste /
translated: One of weak faculties, whether slow or quick in practice,🔽is called a person of weak faculties.

original: mngon par shes pa bul ba yin no //🔽dbang po rnon po ni sgrub pa sla ba'am dka' yang rung ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa bul ba yin no // dbang po rnon po ni sgrub pa sla ba'am dka' yang rung ste /
translated: He is slow in his superknowledges.

original: mngon par shes pa myur ba yin no //🔽sgrub pa 'di'i mngon par shes pa bul bas de mngon par shes pa bul ba ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa myur ba yin no // sgrub pa 'di'i mngon par shes pa bul bas de mngon par shes pa bul ba ste /
translated: The person of sharp faculties is quick in his superknowledges, whether his practice is easy or difficult.🔽The person of dull faculties is slow in his superknowledges, whether his practice is easy or difficult.🔽The person of sharp faculties is quick in his superknowledges, whether his practice is easy or difficult.

original: mngon par shes pa myur ba'ang de bzhin du'am /🔽de gang zag rtul ba yin pas na mngon par shes pa bul ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa myur ba'ang de bzhin du'am / de gang zag rtul ba yin pas na mngon par shes pa bul ba'o //

original: yid rno ba yin pas na mngon par shes pa myur ba'o //
analyzed: yid rno ba yin pas na mngon par shes pa myur ba'o //
translated: The person of sharp faculties is quick in his superknowledges, whether his practice is easy or difficult.

original: yang lam de ni byang chub kyi phyogs zhes bya ba'i ming thob ste /
analyzed: yang lam de ni byang chub kyi phyogs zhes bya ba'i ming thob ste /
translated: This path is called the “application of the aids to enlightenment.”

original: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun ni /

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //

translated: four foundations of mindfulness, four right efforts, four bases of magical power, five faculties, five powers, seven members of enlightenment, and the eightfold noble path.

original: de la / zad dang mi skye ye shes ni //
analyzed: de la / zad dang mi skye ye shes ni //
translated: The knowledge of exhaustion and of nonarising,

translated: The knowledge of exhaustion and of nonarising is the knowledge of the exhaustion of all the defilements and of the nonarising of the factors of existence.

analyzed: dang ; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub dang / byang chub rnam ba gsum zhes bya ste /
translated: This knowledge is called the enlightenment of the disciples, the enlightenment of the individual Buddhas, and the supreme complete enlightenment.

analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: The knowledge of the exhaustion of the defilements and of the nonarising of the factors of existence is called the supreme complete enlightenment.🔽The

original: dad dang brtson 'grus dran pa dang // shes rab ting 'dzin dga' btang snyoms //
analyzed: dad dang brtson 'grus dran pa dang // shes rab ting 'dzin dga' btang snyoms //
translated: Faith, effort, mindfulness,🔽concentration, wisdom, joy, equanimity,

original: shin tu sbyangs tshul yang dag rdzogs /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs tshul yang dag rdzogs /
translated: pliancy, and rightness.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: dran pa nyer gzhag shes rab ste //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag shes rab ste //
translated: The foundations of mindfulness are wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus yang dag 'jog ces bya //
analyzed: brtson 'grus yang dag 'jog ces bya //
translated: Effort is called right exertion.

original: rdzu 'phrul rkang ba ting 'dzin to //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rkang ba ting 'dzin to //
translated: The bases of supernatural powers are concentration.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par sbong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par sbong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni /

analyzed: shes rab dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: the nature of wisdom, effort, and concentration.

analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig dbang po dang stobs rnams ni ming smos pas /

translated: the five substances of faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang ; chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba ni shes rab nyid yin no // yang dag par spong ba rnams dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni brtsan 'grus nyid yin no //
