original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang 'gog pa'i bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung dang 'gog pa'i bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs na /
translated: When one realizes the truths of unsatisfactoriness, of the origin of unsatisfactoriness, and of the cessation of unsatisfactoriness,

original: chos la zhen nas dad pa dang // 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims 'thob bo //
analyzed: chos la zhen nas dad pa dang // 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims 'thob bo //
translated: one acquires faith through adherence to the teaching and the morality pleasing to the noble ones.

original: lam gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs na sangs rgyas dang de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun las shes nas dad pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa mngon par rtogs na sangs rgyas dang de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun las shes nas dad pa 'thob ste /
translated: When one realizes the truth of the path, one acquires faith through knowledge with regard to the Buddha and his Saṅgha of listeners.

original: de dag gi dad pa gang yin pa de ni mi slob pa'i sangs rgyas su byed pa'i @237b chos dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'i dge 'dun du byed pa'i chos dag las dad pa rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi dad pa gang yin pa de ni mi slob pa'i sangs rgyas su byed pa'i @237b chos dang / slob pa dang mi slob pa'i dge 'dun du byed pa'i chos dag las dad pa rnyed pa yin no //
translated: The faith that one has in them is acquired through the factors that make one a Buddha and the factors that make one a member of the Saṅgha of learners and adepts.

original: yang gi sgras ni tshul khrims dang chos la shes nas dad pa gnyis kyang 'thob bo //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni tshul khrims dang chos la shes nas dad pa gnyis kyang 'thob bo //
translated: The word “also” in the verse indicates that one also acquires faith through knowledge with regard to morality and the teaching.

original: 'dir chos zhes bya ba de dag gang las dgongs she na /
analyzed: 'dir chos zhes bya ba de dag gang las dgongs she na /
translated: With regard to the teaching, what is the object of the word “teaching”?

original: chos bden gsum dang rang sangs rgyas //
analyzed: chos bden gsum dang rang sangs rgyas //
translated: The teaching is the three truths, the Pratyekabuddha’s enlightenment,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam yin no //
translated: and the path of the bodhisattva.

original: de'i phyir bden pa bzhi char mngon par rtogs pa la yang chos la shes nas dad pa rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa bzhi char mngon par rtogs pa la yang chos la shes nas dad pa rnyed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, when one realizes the four noble truths, one acquires faith through conviction in the Dharma.

original: de ltar na de dag ni dad pa'i gzhi'i bye brag las ming gi sgo nas shes nas dad pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni dad pa'i gzhi'i bye brag las ming gi sgo nas shes nas dad pa bzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, these four types of faith through conviction are distinguished according to the different bases of faith and are named accordingly.

original: rdzas kyi sgo nas gnyis yin te /🔽dad dang tshul khrims dang / chos dang dge 'dun la shes nas dad pa rnams ni dad pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: rdzas kyi sgo nas gnyis yin te / dad dang tshul khrims dang / chos dang dge 'dun la shes nas dad pa rnams ni dad pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: They are two in substance.🔽Faith through conviction in the Buddha, the Dharma and the Saṅgha is by nature faith.

original: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims rnams ni tshul khrims yin pas na rdzas gnyis so //🔽ci de dag zag pa dang bcas pa zhig yin nam /
analyzed: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims rnams ni tshul khrims yin pas na rdzas gnyis so // ci de dag zag pa dang bcas pa zhig yin nam /
translated: Faith through conviction in the morality loved by the noble ones is by nature morality.

original: zag pa med pa zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa zhig yin zhe na /
translated: Are they associated with pure or impure?

original: re zhig shes nas dad pa rnams ni gcig tu /
analyzed: re zhig shes nas dad pa rnams ni gcig tu /
translated: Faith through conviction is one.

original: dri ma med /
analyzed: dri ma med /
translated: It is immaculate.

original: shes nas dad pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: shes nas dad pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of faith through conviction?

original: bden pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs nas yid ches pa ni shes nas dad pa yin te /
analyzed: bden pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rtogs nas yid ches pa ni shes nas dad pa yin te /
translated: Faith through conviction is the confidence that arises from the correct understanding of the truths.

original: de dag gi rim pa ni langs nas ji ltar mngon sum du byed pa de bzhin du bkod do //
analyzed: de dag gi rim pa ni langs nas ji ltar mngon sum du byed pa de bzhin du bkod do //
translated: The order of the members is established in accordance with the order in which they are realized.

original: langs nas ji ltar mngon sum du byed ce na /
analyzed: langs nas ji ltar mngon sum du byed ce na /
translated: In what order are they realized?

original: kye ma'o bcom ldan 'das ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin no //
analyzed: kye ma'o bcom ldan 'das ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yin no //
translated: “Ah! The Blessed One is a perfectly enlightened Buddha.

original: de'i chos 'dul ba ni legs par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i chos 'dul ba ni legs par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: His Dharma and Vinaya are well-proclaimed.

original: de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa yin no snyam ste /
analyzed: de'i nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa yin no snyam ste /
translated: His Saṅgha of disciples is practicing well.”

original: sman pa dang sman dang / nad g-yog lta bur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sman pa dang sman dang / nad g-yog lta bur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Buddha is like a doctor, the Dharma is like medicine, and the Saṅgha is like a nurse.

original: sems dang bar gyur na tshul khrims rab tu dad ba yin pa'am /
analyzed: sems dang bar gyur na tshul khrims rab tu dad ba yin pa'am /
translated: When one has confidence, one has faith in morality.

original: de ni de ltar dad par gyur pa'i sgrub pa yin pa'am /
analyzed: de ni de ltar dad par gyur pa'i sgrub pa yin pa'am /
translated: Or, this is the practice of one who has such confidence.

original: nad med pa lta bur gyur pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nad med pa lta bur gyur pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or, it is like being free from illness.

original: de bas na tha mar bzhi par bshad pa'am /
analyzed: de bas na tha mar bzhi par bshad pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the four are explained at the end.

original: ston par bya ba dang / lam dang / lam grogs dang / bzhon pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston par bya ba dang / lam dang / lam grogs dang / bzhon pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are like a teacher, a path, a companion on the path, and a vehicle.

original: mdo las slob pa yan lag brgyad dang ldan no //
analyzed: mdo las slob pa yan lag brgyad dang ldan no //
translated: A sūtra declares:🔽The learner possesses eight members.

original: mi slob pa ni yan lag bcu dang ldan no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: mi slob pa ni yan lag bcu dang ldan no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: The adept possesses ten members.

original: ci'i phyir slob pa la yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / yang dag ba'i ye shes ma bshad ce na /🔽bcings phyir slob pa'i yan lag tu //
analyzed: ci'i phyir slob pa la yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba dang / yang dag ba'i ye shes ma bshad ce na / bcings phyir slob pa'i yan lag tu //
translated: Why is right liberation and right cognition not declared to be members of the learner?

original: rnam par grol ma bshad /🔽slob pa ni nyon mongs pa'i @238a * //
analyzed: rnam par grol ma bshad / slob pa ni nyon mongs pa'i @238a * //
translated: Liberation is not declared to be a member of the learner because he is bound.

original: bcing ba las da dung ma grol ba'i phyir bcings pa yin no //
analyzed: bcing ba las da dung ma grol ba'i phyir bcings pa yin no //
translated: The learner is bound because he is not yet liberated from the bondage of the defilements.

original: de ltar na bcings bzhin du rnam par grol bar rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: de ltar na bcings bzhin du rnam par grol bar rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: In that case, how can he be posited as liberated while still bound?

original: bcings pa'i phyogs gcig las grol ba la rnam par grol ba zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: bcings pa'i phyogs gcig las grol ba la rnam par grol ba zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Liberation is not declared to be a member of the learner because he is bound in part.

original: rnam bar ma grol bas ji ltar na rnam par grol ba'i ye shes su rnam par gzhag / mi slob ba ni nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba thams cad las shin tu nges par grol ba dang / de'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes dag gis rab tu phye ba yin pas /
analyzed: rnam bar ma grol bas ji ltar na rnam par grol ba'i ye shes su rnam par gzhag / mi slob ba ni nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba thams cad las shin tu nges par grol ba dang / de'i bdag nyid kyi ye shes dag gis rab tu phye ba yin pas /
translated: The nonlearner is distinguished by the complete liberation from all the bonds of affliction and by the knowledge that is its nature.

original: tshig de ni rigs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig de ni rigs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: This statement is reasonable.

original: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is called liberation?

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so //
translated: It is both conditioned and unconditioned.

original: de la / nyon mongs bcom pa 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: de la / nyon mongs bcom pa 'dus ma byas //
translated: The destruction of affliction is unconditioned liberation.

original: mos pa 'dus byas /
analyzed: mos pa 'dus byas /
translated: Interest is conditioned liberation.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni rnam par grol ba 'dus ma byas yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni rnam par grol ba 'dus ma byas yin no //
translated: The abandonment of affliction is unconditioned liberation.

original: mi slob pa'i mos pa ni rnam par grol ba'i 'dus byas yin no //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i mos pa ni rnam par grol ba'i 'dus byas yin no //
translated: Interest of the nonlearner is conditioned liberation.

original: yan lag ni de yin /
analyzed: yan lag ni de yin /
translated: It is a branch.

original: rnam par grol ba 'dus byas de ni mi slob pa'i yan lag yin par bshad de /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba 'dus byas de ni mi slob pa'i yan lag yin par bshad de /
translated: That conditioned liberation is explained as a branch of the nonlearner.

original: yan lag rnams ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag rnams ni 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the branches are conditioned.

original: de nyid rnam grol gnyis /
analyzed: de nyid rnam grol gnyis /
translated: It is twofold liberation.

original: rnam par grol ba 'dus byas de nyid /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba 'dus byas de nyid /
translated: This same conditioned liberation

original: mdo las sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes gsungs pa'i rnam par grol ba gnyis yin la /
analyzed: mdo las sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba zhes gsungs pa'i rnam par grol ba gnyis yin la /
translated: is the two liberations mentioned in the sutra: liberation of mind and liberation by the wisdom of discernment.

original: de nyid rnam par grol ba'i phung po yin par yang lta'o ;
analyzed: de nyid rnam par grol ba'i phung po yin par yang lta'o ;
translated: It is also considered to be the aggregate of liberation.

original: / yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: / yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba bshad zin to //
translated: This concludes the explanation of right liberation.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba la ma gtogs pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba la ma gtogs pa'i yang dag pa'i ye shes gang zhe na /
translated: What is right knowledge that is not included in right view?

original: ji skad byang chub bshad ye shes //🔽sngar byang chub tu bshad pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji skad byang chub bshad ye shes // sngar byang chub tu bshad pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Knowledge is as explained for enlightenment.

original: zad pa'i ye shes dang mi skye ba'i ye shes gang yin pa de nyid 'dir ye shes su rig par bya'o ;
analyzed: zad pa'i ye shes dang mi skye ba'i ye shes gang yin pa de nyid 'dir ye shes su rig par bya'o ;
translated: The knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising that were previously explained as enlightenment should be understood as knowledge here.

original: /'das pa 'am ma 'ongs pa 'am da ltar 'byung ba'i sems gang zhig rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: /'das pa 'am ma 'ongs pa 'am da ltar 'byung ba'i sems gang zhig rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What mind is liberated—past, future, or present?

original: mi slob sems ni skye 'gyur ba //
analyzed: mi slob sems ni skye 'gyur ba //
translated: The mind of one beyond training arises

original: sgrib pa las ni grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sgrib pa las ni grol bar 'gyur //
translated: and is liberated from obscurations.

original: bstan bcos las mi slob pa'i sems ma 'ongs par skye bar 'gyur ba'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos las mi slob pa'i sems ma 'ongs par skye bar 'gyur ba'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The nonlearner mind that will arise in the future is liberated from obscurations.

original: de'i sgrib pa yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i sgrib pa yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are its obscurations?

original: de skye ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i thob pa yin te /
analyzed: de skye ba la bgegs byed pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i thob pa yin te /
translated: They are the obtainment of afflictions that obstruct its arising.

original: de ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis spong bar 'gyur la /🔽de ni mi slob pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur ba de yang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyis spong bar 'gyur la / de ni mi slob pa'i sems skye bar 'gyur ba de yang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They are abandoned by the vajra like samadhi.🔽The nonlearner mind that will arise is also liberated.

original: de spangs nas ni mi slob pa'i sems de yang @238b skyes pa dang rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: de spangs nas ni mi slob pa'i sems de yang @238b skyes pa dang rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: When they are abandoned, that nonlearner mind arises and is liberated.

original: skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i sems gang yin pa de yang rnam par grol bar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i sems gang yin pa de yang rnam par grol bar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: The nonlearner mind that will not arise and any mundane mind are also liberated.

original: nges par skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de nyid bshad do //
analyzed: nges par skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de nyid bshad do //
translated: But only the mind that will definitely arise is explained.

original: gang las 'jig rten pa'i sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang las 'jig rten pa'i sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: From what are mundane minds liberated?

original: skye ba'i sgrib pa de nyid las /
analyzed: skye ba'i sgrib pa de nyid las /
translated: The same holds for the other two.

original: so ; / rnam par grol ba la yang 'jig rten pa skye ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: so ; / rnam par grol ba la yang 'jig rten pa skye ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is not the mundane path also the counteragent to the obstacle to arising?

original: de ni de dang mi 'dra'o //
analyzed: de ni de dang mi 'dra'o //
translated: It is not similar to the supramundane path.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig yin zhe na /
translated: In what way is it not similar?

original: de ni nyon mongs pa'i rnyed pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa'i rnyed pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The mundane path is accompanied by the possession of defilements.

original: gnas skabs gang dag tu de skye ba'i sgrib pa spong zhe na /🔽'gag par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis ni //
analyzed: gnas skabs gang dag tu de skye ba'i sgrib pa spong zhe na / 'gag par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis ni //
translated: In what states does one abandon the obstacle to arising?🔽The path of cessation🔽completely abandons the obstacle to arising.

original: de yi sgrib pa rab tu spong //🔽de ltar gyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yi sgrib pa rab tu spong // de ltar gyi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The path of cessation completely abandons the obstacle to arising.

original: rnam par grol ba 'dus ma byas su bshad pa gang yin pa dang / khams gsum po spong ba'i khams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba 'dus ma byas su bshad pa gang yin pa dang / khams gsum po spong ba'i khams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams dang / 'gog pa'i khams zhes bya ba gang yin pa de dag la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the unconditioned liberation explained above, and the three elements, i.e., the element of the abandonment of the three realms, the element of detachment, and the element of cessation?

original: 'dus ma byas nyid khams zhes bya //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas nyid khams zhes bya //
translated: The unconditioned itself is called an element.

original: rnam par grol ba 'dus ma byas de nyid khams gsum yin no //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba 'dus ma byas de nyid khams gsum yin no //
translated: The unconditioned liberation itself is the three elements.

original: de la yang /
analyzed: de la yang /
translated: In regard to it,

original: 'dod chags kun zad 'dod chags bral //
analyzed: 'dod chags kun zad 'dod chags bral //
translated: The element of detachment is the complete abandonment of all attachment.

original: 'dod chags kyi spong ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi spong ba ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams yin no //
translated: The element of detachment is the realm free from attachment.

original: spong ba'i khams ni gzhan dag gi / yang dag par zad pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: spong ba'i khams ni gzhan dag gi / yang dag par zad pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The element of abandonment is the complete abandonment of the others.

original: 'dod chags las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi spong ba ni spong ba'i khams yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi spong ba ni spong ba'i khams yin no //
translated: The element of abandonment is the abandonment of the defilements other than attachment.

original: 'gog khams zhes bya ba bzhi rnams kyi /🔽yang dag par zang pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'gog khams zhes bya ba bzhi rnams kyi / yang dag par zang pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The element of cessation is the complete abandonment of the four.

original: nyon mongs pa la ma gtogs pa bzhi rnams kyi spong ba ni 'gog pa'i khams yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la ma gtogs pa bzhi rnams kyi spong ba ni 'gog pa'i khams yin no //
translated: The element of cessation is the abandonment of the four other than the defilements.

original: dngos po gang gis yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po des 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po gang gis yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po des 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: By what thing is there detachment? By what thing is there freedom from attachment?

original: mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four alternatives.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sdug bsngal rgyu bzod shes rnams kyis //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu bzod shes rnams kyis //
translated: By the receptivities and cognitions of unsatisfactoriness and of its cause, there is detachment and freedom from attachment.

original: yid 'byung / sdug bsngal dang rgyu la bzod pa dang / shes pa nyid kyis yid 'byung bar 'gyur gyi gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid 'byung / sdug bsngal dang rgyu la bzod pa dang / shes pa nyid kyis yid 'byung bar 'gyur gyi gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no //
translated: One becomes disgusted with the truth of unsatisfactoriness and its origin by means of the receptivities and the cognitions of unsatisfactoriness and of origin, and one becomes disgusted with the truth of cessation and the truth of the path by means of the receptivities and the cognitions of cessation and of the path.

original: gang gis spong 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gis spong 'gyur ba /
translated: By means of which does one abandon?

original: kun gyi 'dod chags bral bar 'gyur /🔽sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam la /
analyzed: kun gyi 'dod chags bral bar 'gyur / sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam la /
translated: By means of all, one becomes detached.

original: bzod pa dang shes pa gang dag gis nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ba thams cad kyis kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzod pa dang shes pa gang dag gis nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur ba thams cad kyis kyang 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of the receptivities and the cognitions of unsatisfactoriness, of the origin, of cessation and of the path, one abandons the defilements and one becomes detached.

original: de ltar mu bzhi par 'grub ste /🔽yid @239a * //
analyzed: de ltar mu bzhi par 'grub ste / yid @239a * //
translated: Thus there are four alternatives.

original: 'byung ba nyid ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la bzod pa dang / shes pa rnams kyis nyon mongs mi spong ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba nyid ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la bzod pa dang / shes pa rnams kyis nyon mongs mi spong ba ste /
translated: One becomes disgusted with the truth of unsatisfactoriness and the truth of the origin by means of the receptivities and the cognitions of unsatisfactoriness and of the origin, but one does not abandon the defilements.

original: yid 'byung ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid 'byung ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one has for their object the factors that cause disgust.

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba nyid ni 'gog pa dang lam la bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa spong ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba nyid ni 'gog pa dang lam la bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa spong ba ste /
translated: One abandons the defilements by means of the receptivities and the cognitions of cessation and of the path, but one does not become detached.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽gnyi ga ni snga ma dag gis nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro // gnyi ga ni snga ma dag gis nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
translated: because they focus on the object of supreme joy.🔽Both are the abandonment of afflictions by former moments.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni phyi ma dag gis nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni phyi ma dag gis nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
translated: Neither are the abandonment of afflictions by later moments.

original: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig bden pa rnams la lta ba na /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig bden pa rnams la lta ba na /
translated: When one who is free from attachment views the four truths,

original: chos shes pa dang bzod pa dag gis nyon mongs pa mi spang ngo //
analyzed: chos shes pa dang bzod pa dag gis nyon mongs pa mi spang ngo //
translated: the Dharma forbearance and Dharma knowledge do not abandon afflictions.

original: ye shes rnams kyis ni sbyor ba dang rnam par grol ba dang khyad par can gyi lam gyis bsdus pa dag gis mi spong ngo //
analyzed: ye shes rnams kyis ni sbyor ba dang rnam par grol ba dang khyad par can gyi lam gyis bsdus pa dag gis mi spong ngo //
translated: The knowledges do not abandon afflictions subsumed by the path of preparation, liberated paths, and special paths.

original: chos mngon pa mdzod kyi 'grel ba mdo dang mthun pa las lam dang gang zag bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas drug pa'o /
analyzed: chos mngon pa mdzod kyi 'grel ba mdo dang mthun pa las lam dang gang zag bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas drug pa'o /
translated: This completes the sixth chapter, on the path and the person, in the commentary on the compendium of Abhidharma called The Treasury of Knowledge in accordance with the sutras.

original: // / bzod pa rnams zhes kyang 'byung shes pa rnams zhes kyang 'byung /
analyzed: // / bzod pa rnams zhes kyang 'byung shes pa rnams zhes kyang 'byung /
translated: It says “forbearances” and “knowledges,”

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes kyang 'byung /🔽yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes kyang 'byung na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes kyang 'byung /🔽yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes kyang 'byung na /
translated: “right view” and “right wisdom.”🔽If it is asked, “What is the difference between these?”

original: ci bzod pa dag yin la shes pa ma yin nam yang dag pa'i ye shes yin la yang dag pa'i lta ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci bzod pa dag yin la shes pa ma yin nam yang dag pa'i ye shes yin la yang dag pa'i lta ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are there any acceptances that are not cognitions? Are there any right cognitions that are not right views?

original: dri med bzod rnams shes pa min //
analyzed: dri med bzod rnams shes pa min //
translated: The uncontaminated acceptances are not cognitions.

original: des spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas the tshom ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas the tshom ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because doubt, which is to be abandoned by them, is not abandoned.

original: de dag yang dag par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir lta ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag yang dag par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir lta ba ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not views because they have the nature of correct ascertainment.

original: ji ltar bzod pa rnams lta ba yin gyi shes pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar bzod pa rnams lta ba yin gyi shes pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the acceptances are views but not cognitions,

original: zad dang mi skye'i blo lta min //
analyzed: zad dang mi skye'i blo lta min //
translated: The cognitions of elimination and nonarising are not views.

original: zad pa'i ye shes dang mi skye ba'i ye shes kyang yang dag par rtog pa ma yin pa dang / yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa can ma yin pa'i phyir lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: zad pa'i ye shes dang mi skye ba'i ye shes kyang yang dag par rtog pa ma yin pa dang / yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa can ma yin pa'i phyir lta ba ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of elimination and the cognition of nonarising are not views because they are not correct ascertainment and they do not have the intention to investigate.

original: de las gzhan 'phags blo gnyi ga / bzod pa zad pa'i ye shes dang mi skye ba'i ye shes dag las gzhan pa zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni lta ba yang yin ye shes kyang yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan 'phags blo gnyi ga / bzod pa zad pa'i ye shes dang mi skye ba'i ye shes dag las gzhan pa zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni lta ba yang yin ye shes kyang yin no //
translated: The others are both views and cognition.

original: gzhan ni shes pa /
analyzed: gzhan ni shes pa /
translated: The others are cognition.

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes rab thams cad ni shes pa kho na yin no //🔽lta ba drug / lta ba lnga dang 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes rab thams cad ni shes pa kho na yin no // lta ba drug / lta ba lnga dang 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: All mundane cognition is cognition.🔽Six are views.🔽Six mundane cognitions are views: the five false views and mundane right view.

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes rab rnam pa drug ni lta ba yin gyi gzhan ni lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes rab rnam pa drug ni lta ba yin gyi gzhan ni lta ba ma yin no //
translated: The others are not views.

original: shes pa ni de dang gzhan dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: shes pa ni de dang gzhan dag kyang yin no //
translated: All the rest are both views and cognition.

original: ji snyed cig gis shes pa thams cad bsdus she na /
analyzed: ji snyed cig gis shes pa thams cad bsdus she na /
translated: How many cognitions are there in all?

original: @239b shes pa bcus bsdus so //
analyzed: @239b shes pa bcus bsdus so //
translated: Ten cognitions.

original: mdor bsdu na ni /🔽shes pa zag bcas zag med ni //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na ni / shes pa zag bcas zag med ni //
translated: In brief,🔽there are two cognitions:

original: de gnyis kyang /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang /
translated: defiled and undefiled.

original: dang po kun rdzob ces bya'o //🔽zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dang po kun rdzob ces bya'o //🔽zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The first is called conventional.🔽The second is called pure.🔽The first is called conventional.🔽The second is called pure.

original: phal cher bum pa dang snam bu dang skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa kun rdzob la 'dzin pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa yin no //🔽zag med rnams ni gnyis chos dang / rjes su shes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: phal cher bum pa dang snam bu dang skyes pa dang bud med la sogs pa kun rdzob la 'dzin pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa yin no // zag med rnams ni gnyis chos dang / rjes su shes pa nyid yin no //
translated: For the most part, conventional cognition is the cognition of the conventional, because it grasps the conventional, that is to say, vase, cloth, male, female, etc.🔽The cognition of exhaustion and cognition of non-arising are cognition of the mind of another.

original: zag pa med pa'i shes pa ni chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa rnam pa gnyis su dbye'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes pa ni chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa rnam pa gnyis su dbye'o //
translated: The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, by their nature, cognition of the mind of another.

original: shes pa de gnyis ni gsum du 'gyur te /🔽kun rdzob kyi shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dang / kun rdzob yul ni thams cad do //
analyzed: shes pa de gnyis ni gsum du 'gyur te / kun rdzob kyi shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dang / kun rdzob yul ni thams cad do //
translated: These two cognitions are, in fact, cognition of the mind of another.🔽The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, by their nature, cognition of the mind of another.🔽The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, by their nature, cognition of the mind of another.🔽The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, by their nature, cognition of the mind of another.

original: kun rdzob shes pa'i dmigs pa ni ji ltar srid par 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad yin no //🔽chos shes pa'i spyod yul ni /🔽'dod sdug bsngal la sogs /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa'i dmigs pa ni ji ltar srid par 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad yin no // chos shes pa'i spyod yul ni / 'dod sdug bsngal la sogs /
translated: The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, by their nature, cognition of the mind of another.🔽The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, by their nature, cognition of the mind of another.🔽The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, by their nature, cognition of the mind of another.🔽The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, by their nature, cognition of the mind of another.🔽The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, by their nature, cognition of the mind of another.

original: chos shes pa'i dmigs pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dang de kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang lam rnams yin no //
analyzed: chos shes pa'i dmigs pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dang de kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa dang lam rnams yin no //
translated: The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, by their nature, cognition of the mind of another.🔽The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, by their nature, cognition of the mind of another.🔽The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, by their nature, cognition of the mind of another.🔽The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, by their nature, cognition of the mind of another.🔽The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, by their nature, cognition of the mind of another.🔽The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, by their nature, cognition of the mind of another.🔽The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, by their nature, cognition of the mind of another.🔽The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are, by their nature, cognition of the mind

original: rjes su shes pa'i spyod yul gong ma'i sdug bsngal sogs /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i spyod yul gong ma'i sdug bsngal sogs /
translated: The object field of subsequent knowledge is the suffering of the higher realms and so on.

original: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dang de kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam rnams yin no //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal dang de kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam rnams yin no //
translated: Subsequent patience is the truths of suffering, origin, cessation and path that are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing in the form and formless realms.

original: de dag nyid bden bye brag gis //🔽bzhi ste / chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa de dag nyid bden pa'i bye brag gis /
analyzed: de dag nyid bden bye brag gis // bzhi ste / chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa de dag nyid bden pa'i bye brag gis /
translated: They are four by specific truth.🔽Those very Dharma knowledges and subsequent knowledges are four knowledges: knowledge of suffering, knowledge of origin, knowledge of cessation and knowledge of path, because they focus on specific truths.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam shes pa rnams dang / shes pa bzhir 'gyur te /🔽de dag la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam shes pa rnams dang / shes pa bzhir 'gyur te / de dag la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.

original: de dag rnam bzhi ni /🔽mi skye ba dang zad ye shes //
analyzed: de dag rnam bzhi ni / mi skye ba dang zad ye shes //
translated: They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.

original: chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa rnam pa bzhi bzhi po de dag ni lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin ba ni zad pa'i ye shes dang mi skye ba'i ye shes zhes bya'o //🔽de gnyis dang po skyes pa ni //
analyzed: chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa rnam pa bzhi bzhi po de dag ni lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin ba ni zad pa'i ye shes dang mi skye ba'i ye shes zhes bya'o //🔽de gnyis dang po skyes pa ni //
translated: They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.🔽They are four by specific truth.

original: sdug bsngal rgyu shes zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu shes zhes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the cause of suffering is the knowledge of origination.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes dang po skyes pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa yin te /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes dang po skyes pa ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa yin te /
translated: The first knowledge of extinction and the first knowledge of non-arising are the inferential knowledge of suffering and of origination,

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i phung po la sdug bsngal ba dad kun 'byung ba'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i phung po la sdug bsngal ba dad kun 'byung ba'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one takes as one's cognitive object the aggregates of the summit of existence as suffering and as origination.

original: bzhi las gzhan gyi sems rig pa //
analyzed: bzhi las gzhan gyi sems rig pa //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another is fourfold.

original: rig pas na rig pa ste shes pa'o //
analyzed: rig pas na rig pa ste shes pa'o //
translated: It is called knowledge because it is cognition.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang shes pa bzhi las skye bar blta'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang shes pa bzhi las skye bar blta'o //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another is fourfold: it is the knowledge of the factors, the subsequent knowledge, the knowledge of the path, and the conventional knowledge.

original: de'i nges pa ni 'di yin te /🔽de ni sa dbang gang zag 'das //🔽zhig dang ma skyes mi @240a * //
analyzed: de'i nges pa ni 'di yin te / de ni sa dbang gang zag 'das // zhig dang ma skyes mi @240a * //
translated: Its rule is as follows:

original: rig go // sa 'das pa ni bsam gtan gong ma'i sa pas bsam gtan gong ma'i sa pa mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: rig go // sa 'das pa ni bsam gtan gong ma'i sa pas bsam gtan gong ma'i sa pa mi shes pa'o //
translated: It does not know the mind of a higher stage, nor that which is past or future, nor that which is unobscured and neutral, nor the special mind of others.🔽It does not know the mind of a higher stage, i.e., the mind of the first meditation does not know the mind of the second meditation, and so on.

original: dbang po 'das pa ni dad pas mos pa dang dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis mthong bas thob pa dang dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po 'das pa ni dad pas mos pa dang dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis mthong bas thob pa dang dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba'i lam mi shes pa'o //
translated: The past faculty is not known by the path of one resolute in faith and by the liberated through the Buddhist doctrine.

original: gang zag 'das pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas rnams 'og mas gong ma mi shes pa'o //🔽zhig pa dang ma skyes pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag 'das pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa dang rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas rnams 'og mas gong ma mi shes pa'o // zhig pa dang ma skyes pa ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa mi shes pa ste /
translated: The past person is not known by the path of the once returner, the arhat, the pratyekabuddha and the Buddha.

original: yul da ltar yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul da ltar yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The past and future are not known because they are objects that have ceased or not yet arisen.

original: gzhan yang ci zhe na /🔽chos rjes phyogs blo phan tshun min /
analyzed: gzhan yang ci zhe na / chos rjes phyogs blo phan tshun min /
translated: What else?🔽The cognition of the truth of Dharma does not know the subsequent cognition.

original: chos shes pa'i phyogs kyi sems ni rjes su shes pas mi shes la rjes su shes pa'i phyogs kyang chos shes pas mi shes te /
analyzed: chos shes pa'i phyogs kyi sems ni rjes su shes pas mi shes la rjes su shes pa'i phyogs kyang chos shes pas mi shes te /
translated: The cognition of the truth of Dharma does not know the subsequent cognition and the subsequent cognition does not know the cognition of the truth of Dharma because they are mutually exclusive.

original: de gnyis ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / khams gong ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa'i phyir phan tshun rgyab kyis bltas pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / khams gong ma'i gnyen po la dmigs pa'i phyir phan tshun rgyab kyis bltas pa yin no //
translated: They are mutually exclusive because the cognition of the truth of Dharma focuses on the antidote to the desire realm and the subsequent cognition focuses on the antidote to the higher realms.

original: mthong ba'i lam la gzhan gyi sems shes pa med do //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la gzhan gyi sems shes pa med do //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another does not exist on the path of insight.

original: de'i dmigs pa ni yod de /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni yod de /
translated: But its object does exist.

original: de la pha rol gyi sems shes pas mthong ba'i lam shes par 'dod pas sbyor ba byas na dang po'i /
analyzed: de la pha rol gyi sems shes pas mthong ba'i lam shes par 'dod pas sbyor ba byas na dang po'i /
translated: If one wishes to know the path of insight by means of the knowledge of the mind of another, one must first apply oneself to the preparatory meditation.

original: mthong ba'i skad cig gnyis nyan thos //🔽rigs ste bse ru lta bu gsum //
analyzed: mthong ba'i skad cig gnyis nyan thos // rigs ste bse ru lta bu gsum //
translated: The Sravaka knows two moments of the path of insight.🔽The Pratyekabuddha, three;

original: sangs rgyas sbyor ba med pa kun //🔽nyan thos kyis pha rol gyi sems shes pas ni mthong ba'i lam las /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sbyor ba med pa kun // nyan thos kyis pha rol gyi sems shes pas ni mthong ba'i lam las /
translated: the Buddha, all, without preparatory effort.🔽The Sravaka who knows the mind of another knows two moments of the path of insight:🔽the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to unsatisfactoriness, and the cognition of the factors.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa dang / skad cig ma gnyis shes so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / chos shes pa dang / skad cig ma gnyis shes so //
translated: The object of the cognition of the mind of another is the mental consciousness and the associated factors of another, of the realm of desire.🔽The cognition of the mind of another of the realm of fine-materiality, which is obtained through detachment, has for its object the mental consciousness and the associated factors of the realm of desire, for the realm of fine-materiality is not a homogeneous cause of this cognition.

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs kyang dmigs pa ni sbyor ba gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ji srid du de la sbyor ba rtsom pa de srid du sems bcu drug rjes su 'thob par 'gyur gyi bar ma dor ni mi shes so //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs kyang dmigs pa ni sbyor ba gzhan gyis bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ji srid du de la sbyor ba rtsom pa de srid du sems bcu drug rjes su 'thob par 'gyur gyi bar ma dor ni mi shes so //
translated: The cognition of the mind of another of the realm of desire is obtained through preparatory effort; it is therefore capable of knowing the mental consciousness and the associated factors of the realm of fine-materiality, for the realm of desire is a homogeneous cause of this cognition.🔽The cognition of the mind of another of the realm of immateriality is obtained through detachment; it is therefore capable of knowing the mental consciousness and the associated factors of the realm of immateriality, for the realm of immateriality is a homogeneous cause of this cognition.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyis ni dang po'i gnyis dang brgyad pa kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa dang / skad cig ma gsum shes te sbyor ba chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyis ni dang po'i gnyis dang brgyad pa kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa dang / skad cig ma gsum shes te sbyor ba chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The pratyekabuddha knows three moments: the first two and the eighth moment, i.e., the subsequent cognition of the truth of the origin.

original: kha cig na re dang po dang gnyis pa dang bco lnga pa rnams shes so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re dang po dang gnyis pa dang bco lnga pa rnams shes so zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that he knows the first, the second and the fifteenth moment.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sbyor ba med par mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma thams cad mkhyen to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ni sbyor ba med par mthong ba'i lam gyi skad cig ma thams cad mkhyen to //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas know all the moments of the path of insight without preparatory effort.

original: yang zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na /🔽zad pa'i ye shes bden rnams la //
analyzed: yang zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes gnyis la khyad par ci yod ce na / zad pa'i ye shes bden rnams la //
translated: What is the difference between the knowledge of destruction and the knowledge of non-arising?

original: yongs shes la sogs nges pa'o //🔽yongs shes byar med ces la sogs //
analyzed: yongs shes la sogs nges pa'o // yongs shes byar med ces la sogs //
translated: The knowledge of destruction is the certainty that the truths are completely known, etc.🔽The knowledge of non-arising is the certainty that they are not to be known again, etc.🔽The knowledge of destruction is the certainty that the truths are completely known, etc.

original: mi skye ba yi blor @240b 'dod do //
analyzed: mi skye ba yi blor @240b 'dod do //
translated: The knowledge of non-arising is the certainty that the truths are not to be known again, etc.

original: zad pa'i ye shes gang zhe na /🔽bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so zhes bya ba dang / kun 'byung spangs so //
analyzed: zad pa'i ye shes gang zhe na / bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes so zhes bya ba dang / kun 'byung spangs so //
translated: What is the knowledge of destruction?

original: 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
analyzed: 'gog pa mngon du byas so //
translated: It is the certainty that suffering is completely known by me, that the origin is abandoned by me, that cessation is realized by me, that the path is cultivated by me.🔽What is the knowledge of non-arising?

original: lam bsgoms so zhes bya bar shes pa de'i rgyu las 'byung ba'i shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo dang / rtogs pa dang / snang ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: lam bsgoms so zhes bya bar shes pa de'i rgyu las 'byung ba'i shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo dang / rtogs pa dang / snang ba dang / mngon par rtogs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The knowledge, cognition, understanding, discernment, insight, and clear knowledge that arise from that cause are

original: de ni zad pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni zad pa'i ye shes zhes bya'o //
translated: called the knowledge of elimination.

original: mi skye ba'i ye shes gang zhe na /🔽bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa yang shes par byar med do zhes bya bar shes pa nas /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i ye shes gang zhe na / bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa yang shes par byar med do zhes bya bar shes pa nas /
translated: What is the knowledge of non-arising?

original: bdag gis lam yongs su bsgoms pas yongs su sgom par byar med do zhes bya ba'i bar du shes pa de'i rgyu las byung ba'i zhes bya ba bstan bcos las rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag gis lam yongs su bsgoms pas yongs su sgom par byar med do zhes bya ba'i bar du shes pa de'i rgyu las byung ba'i zhes bya ba bstan bcos las rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The knowledge that arises from the cause that thinks, “I have completely understood suffering and there is nothing more to understand,” up to the knowledge that thinks, “I have completely cultivated the path and there is nothing more to cultivate.”🔽This is explained in detail in the treatise.

original: ji ltar na zag pa med pa'i shes pas de ltar shes she na /🔽kha che ba rnams na re bstan bcos las 'di skad du /
analyzed: ji ltar na zag pa med pa'i shes pas de ltar shes she na / kha che ba rnams na re bstan bcos las 'di skad du /
translated: How does uncontaminated knowledge know in that way?

original: langs pa'i rjes la thob pas de ltar shes te /
analyzed: langs pa'i rjes la thob pas de ltar shes te /
translated: The Kashmiri Vaibhasikas say: It knows in that way through subsequent attainment after rising from that concentration.

original: de'i phyir de'i bye brag gis de gnyis ni khyad par du bstan to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i bye brag gis de gnyis ni khyad par du bstan to zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, these two knowledges are distinguished by their specific characteristics.

original: de ltar na de dag ni shes pa bcur 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni shes pa bcur 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, there are ten knowledges:

original: 'di lta ste chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shas pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shas pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang /
translated: knowledge of the doctrine, subsequent knowledge, conventional knowledge, knowledge of others' minds, knowledge of suffering, knowledge of origin, knowledge of cessation, knowledge of the path,

original: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'o //🔽de la kun rdzob shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la /
analyzed: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'o // de la kun rdzob shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la /
translated: knowledge of elimination, and knowledge of nonarising.

original: gcig gi cha yin no //
analyzed: gcig gi cha yin no //
translated: Conventional knowledge is one knowledge and one part of another.

original: chos shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la bdun gyi phyogs yin te /
analyzed: chos shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la bdun gyi phyogs yin te /
translated: Knowledge of the doctrine is one knowledge and a part of seven.

original: rjes su shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //🔽sdug bsngal shes pa ni shes ba gcig yin la /
analyzed: rjes su shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o // sdug bsngal shes pa ni shes ba gcig yin la /
translated: Subsequent knowledge is also like that.

original: bzhi'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: bzhi'i phyogs yin te /
translated: Knowledge of suffering is one knowledge and a part of four.

original: kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung dang / 'gog pa shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Knowledge of origin and knowledge of cessation are also like that.🔽Knowledge of the path is one knowledge and a part of three.

original: lam shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la lnga'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: lam shes pa ni shes pa gcig yin la lnga'i phyogs yin no //
translated: Knowledge of the path is one knowledge and a part of five.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni gcig yin la bzhi'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni gcig yin la bzhi'i phyogs yin no //
translated: Knowledge of another's mind is one knowledge and a part of four.

original: zad pa shes pa ni gcig yin la drug gi cha yin te /
analyzed: zad pa shes pa ni gcig yin la drug gi cha yin te /
translated: Knowledge of elimination is one knowledge and a part of six.

original: mi skye ba shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Knowledge of nonarising is also like that.

original: ci'i phyir de dag gsum yod la bcur rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag gsum yod la bcur rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are they established as three but ten in number?🔽Ten are established from nature, antidotes,🔽aspects, objects, application,

original: rang bzhin dang ni gnyen po dang // rnam pa rnams dang spyod yul dang // rab sbyor bya ba byas nyid dang // rgyu rgyas pa las bcu yin te //🔽rgyu bdun gyis bcur @241a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang ni gnyen po dang // rnam pa rnams dang spyod yul dang // rab sbyor bya ba byas nyid dang // rgyu rgyas pa las bcu yin te // rgyu bdun gyis bcur @241a * //
translated: function, and extensive cause.

original: rnam par gzhag go zhes grag ste /🔽rang bzhin las kun rdzob kyi shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag go zhes grag ste / rang bzhin las kun rdzob kyi shes pa yin gyi /
translated: It is well known that they are established as ten by seven causes.

original: don dam pa shes pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽gnyen po las ni chos dang rjes su shes pa dag yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa shes pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro // gnyen po las ni chos dang rjes su shes pa dag yin te /
translated: From nature, conventional knowledge is conventional knowledge, not ultimate knowledge.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / khams gong ma'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / khams gong ma'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From antidote, Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge are antidotes to the desire realm and higher realms, respectively.🔽From aspect, knowledge of suffering and origin are the same, because they have the same four aspects.

original: rnam pa las ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dag yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa las ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa dag yin te /
translated: From the point of view of aspect, they are the cognition of suffering and the cognition of origin,

original: dmigs pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their object is not differentiated.

original: rnam pa dang dmigs pa las ni 'gog pa dang lam shes pa dag yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang dmigs pa las ni 'gog pa dang lam shes pa dag yin te /
translated: From the point of view of aspect and object, they are the cognition of cessation and the cognition of the path,

original: rnam pa dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their aspects and objects are differentiated.

original: rab tu sbyor ba las ni pha rol gyi sems shes pa yin te ;
analyzed: rab tu sbyor ba las ni pha rol gyi sems shes pa yin te ;
translated: From the point of view of application, they are the cognition of another's thoughts,

original: des ni pha rol gyi sems las byung ba yang mi shes pa ma yin mdo  kyi /
analyzed: des ni pha rol gyi sems las byung ba yang mi shes pa ma yin mdo  kyi /
translated: because it is not the case that it does not cognize the thought and thought concomitants of another.

original: sems shes par bya ba rab tu brtson pa la mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir pha rol gyi sems shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems shes par bya ba rab tu brtson pa la mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir pha rol gyi sems shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: But it is called the cognition of another's thoughts because it is accomplished in the one who is intent on cognizing another's thoughts.

original: bya ba byas pa las ni zad pa shes pa yin te /
analyzed: bya ba byas pa las ni zad pa shes pa yin te /
translated: From the point of view of the performance of its function, it is the cognition of exhaustion,

original: bya ba byas pa'i rgyud la dang po kho nar skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba byas pa'i rgyud la dang po kho nar skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises first in the stream in which the function has been performed.

original: rgyu rgyas pa las ni mi skye ba'i ye shes yin te /
analyzed: rgyu rgyas pa las ni mi skye ba'i ye shes yin te /
translated: From the point of view of the development of the cause, it is the cognition of non-arising,

original: zag pa med pa thams cad kyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa thams cad kyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has all the uncontaminated dharmas as its cause.

original: thams cad kyi gnyen po thams cad yin pa'i phyir chos shes pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen por bshad mod kyi /
analyzed: thams cad kyi gnyen po thams cad yin pa'i phyir chos shes pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen por bshad mod kyi /
translated: It is said that Dharma knowledge is the antidote of the desire realm because it is the antidote of all.🔽Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge

original: gzhan yang / bsgom pa'i lam la 'gog pa dang // lam la chos shes gang yin te //
analyzed: gzhan yang / bsgom pa'i lam la 'gog pa dang // lam la chos shes gang yin te //
translated: of the truths of cessation and path

original: khams gsum gyi ni gnyen po yin //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi ni gnyen po yin //
translated: are antidotes of the three realms.

original: 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa ni khams gsum char gyi gnyen po yin no //🔽'dod pa'i khams kyi rjes ma yin //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa ni khams gsum char gyi gnyen po yin no // 'dod pa'i khams kyi rjes ma yin //
translated: Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge of the truths of cessation and path subsumed by the path of meditation are antidotes of the three realms.🔽Subsequent knowledge is not an antidote of desire.

original: thams cad du yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po ni rjes su shes pa med do //
analyzed: thams cad du yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po ni rjes su shes pa med do //
translated: Subsequent knowledge is not an antidote of the desire realm.

original: shes pa bcu po de dag las //
analyzed: shes pa bcu po de dag las //
translated: From among those ten knowledges,

original: chos shes pa dang rjes su shes //
analyzed: chos shes pa dang rjes su shes //
translated: Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge

original: rnam pa bcu drug / de dag mdun nas bshad par bya'o //🔽kun rdzob kyi de bzhin gzhan du yang /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug / de dag mdun nas bshad par bya'o // kun rdzob kyi de bzhin gzhan du yang /
translated: have sixteen aspects.

original: kun rdzob shes pa ni rnam pa bcu drug kyang yin la /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa ni rnam pa bcu drug kyang yin la /
translated: Conventional knowledge has sixteen aspects.🔽Conventional knowledge has sixteen aspects.

original: chos shes pa thams cad kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gzhan dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: chos shes pa thams cad kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir rnam pa gzhan dag kyang yin no //
translated: It also has other aspects because it holds the specific and general characteristics of all phenomena.🔽Each of the four truths has four aspects.

original: bden pa'i rang rang gi ni rnam pa bzhi sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam shes pa rnams ni rang rang gi rnam par 'jug pa yin pas /
analyzed: bden pa'i rang rang gi ni rnam pa bzhi sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam shes pa rnams ni rang rang gi rnam par 'jug pa yin pas /
translated: The four aspects of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation and path are the aspects of the four truths.

original: re re zhing yang rnam pa bzhi bzhi yin no //
analyzed: re re zhing yang rnam pa bzhi bzhi yin no //
translated: Each of the four truths has four aspects.

original: @241b de bzhin gzhan gyi sems shes pa //
analyzed: @241b de bzhin gzhan gyi sems shes pa //
translated: So too, knowledge of others' minds.

original: dri med gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa med pa yang de bzhin du rang gi bden pa rnam pa bzhi yin pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: dri med gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa med pa yang de bzhin du rang gi bden pa rnam pa bzhi yin pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhi yin te /
translated: Uncontaminated knowledge of others' minds is also fourfold because it has the four aspects of its own truth.

original: lam shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽dri ma dang bcas ni /🔽shes bya'i rang gi mtshan nyid rnams /
analyzed: lam shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro // dri ma dang bcas ni / shes bya'i rang gi mtshan nyid rnams /
translated: It is the path.🔽Contaminated knowledge of others' minds

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa dang bcas pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: has the aspects of the specific characteristics of objects of knowledge.🔽Contaminated knowledge of others' minds has the aspects of the specific characteristics of its objects of knowledge.

original: shes par bya ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni rnam par gcod do //🔽gnyi ga yang /
analyzed: shes par bya ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni rnam par gcod do // gnyi ga yang /
translated: The specific characteristics of the mind and mental factors that are to be known are distinguished.

original: rdzas re re zhig spyod yul lo //
analyzed: rdzas re re zhig spyod yul lo //
translated: Both are the object-field of a single real entity.

original: gang gi tshe sems 'dzin pa de'i tshe sems las byung ba mi 'dzin pa gang gi tshe tshor ba 'dzin pa de'i tshe 'du shes mi 'dzin ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems 'dzin pa de'i tshe sems las byung ba mi 'dzin pa gang gi tshe tshor ba 'dzin pa de'i tshe 'du shes mi 'dzin ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: When the mind is grasped, the mental factors are not grasped. When sensation is grasped, ideation is not grasped, and so on.

original: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bka' stsal pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di skad du 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems la yang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems su yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bka' stsal pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: In this way, how can the Fortunate One be said to have declared: “He knows well, as it really is, that the mind which is with attachment is a mind with attachment”?

original: de gnyis cig car du 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis cig car du 'dzin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that he grasps them simultaneously.

original: gos dang dri ma gnyis cig car du mi 'dzin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gos dang dri ma gnyis cig car du mi 'dzin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is not that he grasps the cloth and the stain simultaneously.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa bshad zin to //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another has been discussed.

original: lhag ma'i rnam pa bcu bzhi ste /
analyzed: lhag ma'i rnam pa bcu bzhi ste /
translated: The other fourteen aspects are the aspects of the truths.

original: stong dang bdag med ma gtogs so //
analyzed: stong dang bdag med ma gtogs so //
translated: except for emptiness and selflessness.

original: lhag ma zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes de gnyis ni stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag ma gtogs pa rnam pa bcu bzhi yin no //🔽don dam pa yin yang bdag ni skye ba zad do //
analyzed: lhag ma zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes de gnyis ni stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag ma gtogs pa rnam pa bcu bzhi yin no // don dam pa yin yang bdag ni skye ba zad do //
translated: The two knowledges of elimination and nonarising are the fourteen aspects, except for the aspects of emptiness and selflessness.

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes 'di'i stobs kyis rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes 'di'i stobs kyis rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although they are ultimate, they are called the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising because one conventionally designates them as the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising through the power of the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: ci zag pa med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa gzhan yang yod dam 'on te med ce na /
analyzed: ci zag pa med pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa gzhan yang yod dam 'on te med ce na /
translated: Do the uncontaminated knowledges have other aspects that are not included in these sixteen?

original: re zhig kha che ba rnams na re /🔽dri med bcu drug las gzhan rnams /
analyzed: re zhig kha che ba rnams na re / dri med bcu drug las gzhan rnams /
translated: The Kashmiri Vaibhasikas say:🔽There are none other than the sixteen stainless aspects.

original: med / zag pa med pa'i rnam pa bcu drug la ma gtogs pa ni med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: med / zag pa med pa'i rnam pa bcu drug la ma gtogs pa ni med do zhes zer ro //
translated: There are none other than the sixteen uncontaminated aspects.🔽The nonKashmiri Vaibhasikas say:

original: gzhan yod ces bstan bcos las gzhan nyi 'og pa rnams na re ni yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan yod ces bstan bcos las gzhan nyi 'og pa rnams na re ni yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: There are others.🔽How do they know?

original: ji ltar rtogs she na bstan bcos las te /
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs she na bstan bcos las te /
translated: From the treatise.

original: bstan bcos las 'di skad du mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i sems kyi 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos dag shes sam zhe na shes te /
analyzed: bstan bcos las 'di skad du mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i sems kyi 'dod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos dag shes sam zhe na shes te /
translated: Do you know the phenomena associated with the desire realm that are not concomitant with the mind?

original: rigs pas bskyed pa'i shes rab kyis mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal dang stong pa dang bdag med pa dang / rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang rab @242a * //🔽tu skye ba dang rkyen dang de ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: rigs pas bskyed pa'i shes rab kyis mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal dang stong pa dang bdag med pa dang / rgyu dang kun 'byung ba dang rab @242a * // tu skye ba dang rkyen dang de ni gnas yod do //
translated: You know that they are impermanent, suffering, empty, selfless, a cause, an origin, a source, and a condition.🔽They exist, they arise, they are produced, they are manifest.

original: de ni gzhi yod do zhes bya bar shes so zhes 'byung ngo //🔽ci rnam pa bcu drug po de dag ming gi sgo nas yin nam /
analyzed: de ni gzhi yod do zhes bya bar shes so zhes 'byung ngo // ci rnam pa bcu drug po de dag ming gi sgo nas yin nam /
translated: They exist, they are a basis.

original: 'on te rdzas kyi sgo nas yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rdzas kyi sgo nas yin zhe na /
translated: Are the sixteen aspects enumerated from the point of view of name or substance?

original: kha cig na re ni ming gi sgo nas bcu drug yin no //
analyzed: kha cig na re ni ming gi sgo nas bcu drug yin no //
translated: Some say: They are sixteen from the point of view of name.

original: rdzas kyi sgo nas ni sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ni bzhi yin la /🔽kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam rnams la ni /
analyzed: rdzas kyi sgo nas ni sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ni bzhi yin la / kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam rnams la ni /
translated: From the point of view of substance, there are four aspects of suffering,🔽and there are seven aspects of origin, cessation and path,

original: rdzas re re yin pa'i phyir bdun yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rdzas re re yin pa'i phyir bdun yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: because each has one substance.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: rdzas kyi sgo nas rnam pa bcu drug / ces brjod do //
analyzed: rdzas kyi sgo nas rnam pa bcu drug / ces brjod do //
translated: The sixteen aspects are from the point of view of substance.

original: de la rkyen la rag lus pas mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de la rkyen la rag lus pas mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Impermanent, because it depends on conditions.

original: gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal lo //🔽bdag gir lta ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal lo // bdag gir lta ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir stong pa'o //
translated: Suffering, because it is the nature of harm.🔽Empty, because it is the antidote to the view of mine.

original: bdag du lta ba'i gnyen po yin pas bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag du lta ba'i gnyen po yin pas bdag med pa'o //
translated: Selfless, because it is the antidote to the view of self.

original: sa bon gyi tshul gyis na rgyu'o //🔽'byung ba'i tshul gyis na kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi tshul gyis na rgyu'o // 'byung ba'i tshul gyis na kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: Cause, because it is the mode of seed.🔽Origin, because it is the mode of arising.

original: rgyun chags pa'i tshul gyis na rab tu skye ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun chags pa'i tshul gyis na rab tu skye ba'o //
translated: Production, because it is the mode of continuity.

original: mngon par grub pa'i don gyis na rkyen te /
analyzed: mngon par grub pa'i don gyis na rkyen te /
translated: Condition, because it is the mode of manifestation.

original: dper na 'jim pa'i gong bu dang 'khor lo dang the gu dang chu rnams 'dus pa las bum pa mngon par grub par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na 'jim pa'i gong bu dang 'khor lo dang the gu dang chu rnams 'dus pa las bum pa mngon par grub par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a pot is manifested from the assemblage of a lump of clay, a stick, a string, and water.

original: phung po 'jig pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: phung po 'jig pa'i phyir 'gog pa'o //
translated: Cessation, because it is the destruction of the aggregates.

original: me gsum zhi bar byed pa'i phyir zhi ba'o //
analyzed: me gsum zhi bar byed pa'i phyir zhi ba'o //
translated: Peace, because it is the pacification of the three fires.

original: gnod pa med pa'i phyir gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i phyir gya nom pa'o //
translated: Sublime, because it is free from harm.

original: skyon thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: skyon thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is the means of escape because it is free from all faults.

original: 'gro ba'i don gyi na lam mo //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don gyi na lam mo //
translated: It is the path because it is the means of going to the goal.

original: rigs dang ldan pa'i phyir rigs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs dang ldan pa'i phyir rigs pa'o //
translated: It is the principle because it is endowed with the lineage.

original: yang dag par grub pa'i don gyis ni bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par grub pa'i don gyis ni bsgrub pa'o //
translated: It is the accomplishment because it is the means of achieving the goal.

original: shin tu yang dag par 'da' bar byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu yang dag par 'da' bar byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the definite release because it is the means of attaining the definite transcendence.

original: rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa zhes bya ba'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of aspect?🔽What is the aspect of wisdom?

original: shes rab rnam pa yang ci shes rab 'ba' zhig gis rnam pa gcod par byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa yang ci shes rab 'ba' zhig gis rnam pa gcod par byed dam zhe na /
translated: Is the aspect of wisdom determined by wisdom alone?

original: smras pa ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma yin no //
translated: No, it is not.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: de dang ni /🔽dmigs bcas bcas pas rnam pa gcod //
analyzed: de dang ni / dmigs bcas bcas pas rnam pa gcod //
translated: It is determined by that🔽and by all things that are objects of apprehension.

original: shes rab dang gzhan dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi rnam pa gcod par byed do //🔽yod do cog gi rnam pa gcod //
analyzed: shes rab dang gzhan dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad kyi rnam pa gcod par byed do // yod do cog gi rnam pa gcod //
translated: The aspect of wisdom is determined by wisdom and by all things that are objects of apprehension.

original: gang cung zad yod pa de thams cad kyi rnam pa gcod do //
analyzed: gang cung zad yod pa de thams cad kyi rnam pa gcod do //
translated: It is determined by all that exists.🔽The aspect of wisdom is determined by all that exists.

original: de ltar bshad na shes rab ni rnam pa yang yin rnam par gcod par byed pa yin /
analyzed: de ltar bshad na shes rab ni rnam pa yang yin rnam par gcod par byed pa yin /
translated: Thus wisdom is both an aspect and that which cuts off.

original: gcad par bya ba'i rnam pa gang yang yin /
analyzed: gcad par bya ba'i rnam pa gang yang yin /
translated: It is also the aspect that is to be cut off.

original: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i gzhan ni rnam pa gcod par byed pa dang / gcad par bya ba'i rnam pa yin /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i gzhan ni rnam pa gcod par byed pa dang / gcad par bya ba'i rnam pa yin /
translated: Other cognitions that possess a focal object are that which cuts off and the aspect that is to be cut off.

original: dmigs pa @242b med pa ni bcad par bya ba'i rnam pa 'ba' zhig yin par grub po //
analyzed: dmigs pa @242b med pa ni bcad par bya ba'i rnam pa 'ba' zhig yin par grub po //
translated: Cognitions that lack a focal object are only the aspect that is to be cut off.

original: gzhan yang shes pa bcu po de dag gi dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes pa bcu po de dag gi dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag bstan par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the specific virtuous and so on of those ten cognitions should be explained.

original: dang po rnam gsum gzhan rnams dge //
analyzed: dang po rnam gsum gzhan rnams dge //
translated: The first is of three types. The others are virtuous.

original: kun rdzob kyi shes pa ni tshigs su bcad pa'i dang bor 'don pa'i phyir dang po ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi shes pa ni tshigs su bcad pa'i dang bor 'don pa'i phyir dang po ste /
translated: Conventional cognition is the first because it is mentioned first in the verse.

original: de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang rnam pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: de yang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang rnam pa gsum yin no //
translated: It is of three types: virtuous, nonvirtuous and neutral.

original: gzhan ye shes dgu ni dge ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ye shes dgu ni dge ba kho na yin no //
translated: The other nine cognitions are virtuous alone.

original: dang po sa rnams thams cad dang // 'dod pa'i khams dag nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar dag na yod do //
analyzed: dang po sa rnams thams cad dang // 'dod pa'i khams dag nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar dag na yod do //
translated: 1. The cognition of the factors is in all the stages, from the realm of desire up to the summit of cyclic existence.

original: drug na chos shes bya chos shes pa ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dag na yod do //
analyzed: drug na chos shes bya chos shes pa ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dag na yod do //
translated: The cognition of the factors is in six stages: the four meditations, the intermediate meditation, and the special preliminary concentration.

original: dgu na / rjes shes bya ba /
analyzed: dgu na / rjes shes bya ba /

original: rjes su shes pa ni sa drug pa de dag nyid dang gzugs med pa gsum dag na yod do //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa ni sa drug pa de dag nyid dang gzugs med pa gsum dag na yod do //
translated: The subsequent cognition is in six stages: the same as above, plus the three formless meditative attainments.

original: de bzhin drug sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa rnams kyang bye brag med par ni sa dgu po de dag nyid na yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin drug sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa dang lam dang zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa rnams kyang bye brag med par ni sa dgu po de dag nyid na yod do //
translated: 3. The cognition of the truth of suffering, the cognition of the truth of the origin of suffering, the cognition of the truth of the cessation of suffering, the cognition of the path, the cognition of exhaustion, and the cognition of non-arising are in the nine stages, without distinction.

original: dbye na ni chos shes pas bsdus pa rnams ni drug na yod do //
analyzed: dbye na ni chos shes pas bsdus pa rnams ni drug na yod do //
translated: If one distinguishes them, those included in the cognition of the factors are in six stages.

original: rjes su shes pas bsdus pa rnams ni dgu na yod do //
analyzed: rjes su shes pas bsdus pa rnams ni dgu na yod do //
translated: Those included in the subsequent cognition are in nine stages.

original: gzhan yid shes pa bsam gtan na //
analyzed: gzhan yid shes pa bsam gtan na //
translated: 4. The cognition of another's thoughts is in the meditations.

analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni bsam gtan bzhi po kho na na yod kyi gzhan dag na ni med do // de ni 'dod dang gzugs lus la //

analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa de ni 'dod ba dang gzugs kyi khams dag du mngon du byed do // chos shes bya ba 'dod lus la //
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts exists in the realm of desire and in the realm of fine-materiality.🔽The cognition of another's thoughts exists in the realm of desire and in the realm of fine-materiality.

analyzed: chos shes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi lus kho na la brten nas mngon du byed kyi gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag du ni mngon du mi byed do //
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts exists in the realm of desire and in the realm of fine-materiality.

analyzed: gzhan ni khams gsum pa yi lus // gzhan yang gang dag cig yin zhe na /
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts exists in the realm of desire and in the realm of fine-materiality.🔽The cognition of another's thoughts exists in the realm of desire and in the realm of fine-materiality.

analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang chos shes pa ma gtogs pa rnams so // sa dang lus bshad zin to //
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts exists in the realm of desire and in the realm of fine-materiality.🔽The cognition of another's thoughts exists in the realm of desire and in the realm of fine-materiality.

analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bsdu ba brjod par bya ste / de smras pa /
translated: The cognition of another's thoughts exists in the realm of desire and in the realm of fine-materiality.🔽The cognition of another's thoughts exists in the realm of desire and in the realm of fine-materiality.

analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag gcig ni //

analyzed: 'gog blo // blo dang shes rab dang shes pa zhes bya ba de ni rnam grangs yin no // 'gog pa shes pa ni /
translated: The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are the cognition of the mind of another.🔽The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are the cognition of the mind of another, because they are the cognition of the mind of another in the path of insight into the truths.
