analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no // gzhan gyi sems blo ni /
translated: The cognition of exhaustion and the cognition of non-arising are the application of mindfulness to factors.🔽The cognition of the mind of another is the three applications of mindfulness.

original: gsum ste / gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni tshor ba dang sems dang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang gsum yin @243a * //
analyzed: gsum ste / gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni tshor ba dang sems dang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang gsum yin @243a * //
translated: The cognition of the mind of another is the three applications of mindfulness to sensation, to the mind, to factors.

original: no ; / lhag ma rnams bzhi yin no //
analyzed: no ; / lhag ma rnams bzhi yin no //
translated: The other cognitions are the four applications of mindfulness.

original: 'gog pa shes pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa dag las gzhan pa rnams ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char yin no //🔽shes pa gang gis dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa dag las gzhan pa rnams ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char yin no // shes pa gang gis dmigs pa ni /
translated: The other cognitions, i.e., the cognition of the doctrine, subsequent cognition, cognition of the path, cognition of exhaustion, cognition of non-arising, are the four applications of mindfulness.🔽What is the object-field of the cognitions?

original: shes pa du dag cig yin zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa du dag cig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the object-field of the cognitions?

original: chos blo'i spyod yul dgu yin no //
analyzed: chos blo'i spyod yul dgu yin no //
translated: The cognition of the doctrine has nine cognitions for its object-field.

original: chos shes pa'i dmigs pa ni rjes su shes pa ma gtogs pa shes pa dgu yin no //
analyzed: chos shes pa'i dmigs pa ni rjes su shes pa ma gtogs pa shes pa dgu yin no //
translated: The cognition of the doctrine has nine cognitions for its object-field, with the exception of the subsequent cognition.

original: lam rjes blo yi dgu yin no //
analyzed: lam rjes blo yi dgu yin no //
translated: The cognition of the path has nine cognitions for its object-field.

original: lam shes pa'i dmigs pa yang kun rdzob shes pa ma gtogs pa shes pa dgu yin la /
analyzed: lam shes pa'i dmigs pa yang kun rdzob shes pa ma gtogs pa shes pa dgu yin la /
translated: The object of knowledge of the path is the nine knowledges, excluding knowledge of the conventional.

original: rjes su shes pa'i dmigs pa yang chos shes pa ma gtogs pa dgu yin no //🔽sdug bsngal dang ni rgyu blo gnyis //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i dmigs pa yang chos shes pa ma gtogs pa dgu yin no // sdug bsngal dang ni rgyu blo gnyis //
translated: The object of subsequent knowledge is the nine knowledges, excluding knowledge of the truths.🔽Two knowledges of suffering and cause

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa gnyis kyis dmigs pa ni kun rdzob dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang gnyis yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung shes pa gnyis kyis dmigs pa ni kun rdzob dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang gnyis yin no //
translated: have two conventional and others’ minds as objects.

original: bzhi'i bcu ste /
analyzed: bzhi'i bcu ste /
translated: Four have ten.

original: kun rdzob shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni shes pa bcu char yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni shes pa bcu char yin no //
translated: Conventional knowledge, knowledge of others’ minds, knowledge of elimination, and knowledge of nonarising have all ten knowledges as their object.

original: gcig gi med /
analyzed: gcig gi med /
translated: One has none.

original: 'gog pa shes pa ste gcig gis dmigs pa ni shes pa med do //
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa ste gcig gis dmigs pa ni shes pa med do //
translated: Knowledge of cessation has no knowledge as its object.

original: chos bcu dag ni sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: chos bcu dag ni sbyar bar bya //
translated: Ten dharmas are applied.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: khams gsum pa dang dri med chos //
analyzed: khams gsum pa dang dri med chos //
translated: Dharmas of the three realms and the stainless,

original: ma byas rnam gnyis rnam gnyis so //
analyzed: ma byas rnam gnyis rnam gnyis so //
translated: not made, two, two.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dag dang / zag pa med pa rnams las mtshungs par ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin par dbye ba'i sgo nas rnam pa brgyad du bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dag dang / zag pa med pa rnams las mtshungs par ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin par dbye ba'i sgo nas rnam pa brgyad du bya'o //
translated: They are the conditioned factors of the realm of desire, the realm of fine-materiality, and the realm of immateriality, and the unconditioned factors.

original: 'dus ma byas la dge ba dang lung du ma bstan par dbye ba'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis su byas te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas la dge ba dang lung du ma bstan par dbye ba'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis su byas te /
translated: The unconditioned factors are divided into two categories: wholesome and non-defined.

original: de ltar na chos bcu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chos bcu yin no //
translated: Thus there are ten factors.

original: chos bcu po de dag ji ltar sbyar bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: chos bcu po de dag ji ltar sbyar bar bya zhe na /
translated: How are the ten factors to be combined?

original: shes pa gang gis dmigs pa ni chos du zhig yin zhes sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: shes pa gang gis dmigs pa ni chos du zhig yin zhes sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The question should be formulated as follows: By how many cognitions is each of the factors as object?

original: de la kun rdzob shes pa'i dmigs pa ni chos bcu po thams cad yin no //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob shes pa'i dmigs pa ni chos bcu po thams cad yin no //
translated: The conventional cognition has all the ten factors as its object.

original: chos shes pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa dang bzhi dang 'dus ma byas dge ba dang lnga yin no //
analyzed: chos shes pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa dang bzhi dang 'dus ma byas dge ba dang lnga yin no //
translated: The cognition of the factors has as its object four factors of the realm of desire and the wholesome unconditioned factors, i.e., five factors.

original: rjes su shes pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa drug dang 'dus ma byas dge ba dang bdun yin no //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa drug dang 'dus ma byas dge ba dang bdun yin no //
translated: Subsequent knowledge has seven: the six uncontaminated knowledges of the form and formless realms and virtuous unconditioned states.

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung shes pa gnyis kyi ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dag dang drug yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung shes pa gnyis kyi ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dag dang drug yin no //
translated: The two knowledges of the truth of origin have six: those of the desire, form and formless realms.

original: 'gog pa shes pa'i ni 'dus ma byas dge ba gcig kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa shes pa'i ni 'dus ma byas dge ba gcig kho na yin no //
translated: The knowledge of cessation has one: virtuous unconditioned states alone.

original: @243b lam shes pa'i ni zag pa med pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: @243b lam shes pa'i ni zag pa med pa gnyis yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the path has two: uncontaminated states.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa mtshungs par ldan pa gsum yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa mtshungs par ldan pa gsum yin no //
translated: Knowledge of others' minds has three: concomitant states of the desire, form and formless realms.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa gnyis kyi dmigs pa ni 'dus ma byas lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs pa chos dgu yin no //🔽chos shes pa gcig gis chos thams cad shes pa yod dam zhe na med do //
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa gnyis kyi dmigs pa ni 'dus ma byas lung du ma bstan pa ma gtogs pa chos dgu yin no // chos shes pa gcig gis chos thams cad shes pa yod dam zhe na med do //
translated: The focal object of both the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising is nine phenomena, excluding unconditioned unvirtuous states.🔽Do all phenomena exist as the object of a single knowledge of phenomena?

original: 'on kyang kun rdzob gcig ste rang chogs las /
analyzed: 'on kyang kun rdzob gcig ste rang chogs las /
translated: No, but there is one conventional knowledge.

original: gzhan ni bdag med nyid du rig / kun rdzob shes pa ni rang gi tshogs las gzhan pa'i chos thams cad bdag med par shes so //
analyzed: gzhan ni bdag med nyid du rig / kun rdzob shes pa ni rang gi tshogs las gzhan pa'i chos thams cad bdag med par shes so //
translated: The conventional cognition knows that all dharmas, other than its own stream, are without a self.

original: rang gi ngo bo dang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni de'i rang dang tshogs yin la /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo dang de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni de'i rang dang tshogs yin la /
translated: The cognition of the self-nature and the dharmas that arise with it are its own stream.

original: yul dang yul can tha dad pa dang / dmigs pa de gcig pa dang shin tu nye ba'i phyir de dag la ni mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: yul dang yul can tha dad pa dang / dmigs pa de gcig pa dang shin tu nye ba'i phyir de dag la ni mi 'dzin to //
translated: It does not grasp them because the object and subject are different, because the object is the same, and because it is very close.

original: de yang 'dod pa na spyod pa ni mnyam pa dang bsams pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa na spyod pa ni mnyam pa dang bsams pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, the conventional cognition in the realm of desire is born from the cause of equal status and from the cause of the act of attention.

original: gzugs na spyod pa ni mnyam pa las byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa ni mnyam pa las byung ba yin gyi /
translated: The conventional cognition in the realm of form is born from the cause of equal status,

original: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: but not from the cause of cultivation.

original: de ni sa rnam par chad pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sa rnam par chad pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the latter has as its object the realm of form that is divided into stages.

original: de ni rdzogs so /
analyzed: de ni rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the conventional cognition.

original: // / da ni /
analyzed: // / da ni /
translated: Now,

original: gang zhig shes pa du dang ldan //
analyzed: gang zhig shes pa du dang ldan //
translated: how many cognitions does one possess?

original: zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: This must be explained.

original: re zhig so so'i skye bo ni kun rdzob shes pa gcig kho na dang ldan no //
analyzed: re zhig so so'i skye bo ni kun rdzob shes pa gcig kho na dang ldan no //
translated: Ordinary beings possess only one conventional knowledge.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang yang ldan no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang yang ldan no //
translated: If they are free from attachment, they also possess knowledge of others' minds.

original: 'phags pa ni /🔽zag med skad cig dang po la //
analyzed: 'phags pa ni / zag med skad cig dang po la //
translated: Aryas🔽possess one knowledge in the first moment of uncontaminated

original: chags can shes pa gcig dang ldan //
analyzed: chags can shes pa gcig dang ldan //
translated: knowledge.

original: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhig yin na /
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba zhig yin na /
translated: If they are not free from attachment to the desire realm,

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dag la kun rdzob shes pa gcig kho na dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dag la kun rdzob shes pa gcig kho na dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: they possess only one conventional knowledge in the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: gnyis pa la gsum /
analyzed: gnyis pa la gsum /
translated: In the second, three.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la ni kun rdzob shes pa dang chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang gsum dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la ni kun rdzob shes pa dang chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang gsum dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering, they possess three: conventional knowledge, Dharma knowledge and knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: gong ma yi /🔽bzhi la re re 'phel dang ldan //
analyzed: gong ma yi / bzhi la re re 'phel dang ldan //
translated: In the fourth, one increases.🔽In the four moments above that, one knowledge increases.

original: de yan chad skad cig ma bzhi la ni de la shes pa re re 'phel bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de yan chad skad cig ma bzhi la ni de la shes pa re re 'phel bar shes par bya ste /
translated: In the four moments above that, one knowledge should be understood to increase.

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa la ni rjes su shes pa 'phel la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa la ni rjes su shes pa 'phel la /
translated: Subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering increases subsequent knowledge.

original: kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa rnams 'phel bas /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa rnams 'phel bas /
translated: Knowledge of the truth of origin, cessation and path increase.

original: de ltar na lam la chos shes pa la shes pa bdun dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na lam la chos shes pa la shes pa bdun dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, knowledge of the truth of path is possessed of seven knowledges.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ni thams cad du lhag par gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang ldan par rig @244a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ni thams cad du lhag par gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang ldan par rig @244a * //
translated: If one is free from attachment, one should understand that one possesses the additional knowledge of others minds in all cases.

original: par bya'o // yang gnas skabs gang dag tu shes pa du dag cig gi thob pa skye zhe na /
analyzed: par bya'o // yang gnas skabs gang dag tu shes pa du dag cig gi thob pa skye zhe na /
translated: In what states and how many knowledges are obtained?

original: mthong la bzod pa ye shes rnams //
analyzed: mthong la bzod pa ye shes rnams //
translated: Patience and knowledge in seeing

original: ji ltar skyes pa'i ma 'ongs 'thob //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes pa'i ma 'ongs 'thob //
translated: obtain future states of their type.

original: mthong ba'i lam la bzod pa 'am shes pa gang dang gang skyes pa de'i rigs can ma 'ongs pa de'i rnam pa bzhi kho na'i thob pa skye'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la bzod pa 'am shes pa gang dang gang skyes pa de'i rigs can ma 'ongs pa de'i rnam pa bzhi kho na'i thob pa skye'o //
translated: On the path of seeing, the obtainment of future states of the same type as any patience or knowledge that arises is generated.

original: ci'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la shes pa ris mthun pa'i rnam pa kho na'i thob pa skye zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la shes pa ris mthun pa'i rnam pa kho na'i thob pa skye zhe na /
translated: Why is the obtainment of future states of the same type as knowledge that is homogeneous to the path of seeing generated?

original: rigs rnams ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs rnams ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have not obtained the lineage of the three.

original: de nyid la ni kun rdzob kyang /
analyzed: de nyid la ni kun rdzob kyang /
translated: Conventional knowledge is also obtained

original: rjes gsum dag la /
analyzed: rjes gsum dag la /
translated: in the three subsequent cognitions.

original: mthong ba'i lam de nyid la kun rdzob shes pa yang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa gsum dag la thob pa skye'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam de nyid la kun rdzob shes pa yang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung dang 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa gsum dag la thob pa skye'o //
translated: Conventional knowledge is also obtained in the three subsequent cognitions of the truths of suffering, origin, and cessation on the path of seeing.

original: bden pa zad par ma rtogs pa'i phyir chos shes pa dag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bden pa zad par ma rtogs pa'i phyir chos shes pa dag la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not obtained in the three Dharma cognitions because the four truths are not fully comprehended.

original: de'i phyir / mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes zhes bya //
analyzed: de'i phyir / mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes zhes bya //
translated: Therefore it is called subsequent to realization.

original: de nyid phyir de ni bden pa re re mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes la thob pa skye ba'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes las thob pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid phyir de ni bden pa re re mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes la thob pa skye ba'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes las thob pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called knowledge obtained subsequent to realization because it is obtained subsequent to the realization of each truth.

original: ci'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa la thob pa mi skye zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa la thob pa mi skye zhe na /
translated: Why is it not obtained in subsequent cognition of the truth of the path?

original: lam gyi bde ba ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis mngon par rtogs pa ma yin pa dang / zad par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam gyi bde ba ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis mngon par rtogs pa ma yin pa dang / zad par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the truth of the path is not realized by the mundane path and it is not fully comprehended.

original: sdug bsngal ril gyis yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa la mngon du bya bar mi nus kyi lam ni zad par bsgom par mi nus par mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' med pa'i phyir de la mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes las thob pa'i thob pa mi skye'o //🔽ji mngon par rtogs pa'i las thob pa kun rdzob shes pa de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ril gyis yongs su shes par bya ba dang / kun 'byung spang bar bya ba dang / 'gog pa la mngon du bya bar mi nus kyi lam ni zad par bsgom par mi nus par mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' med pa'i phyir de la mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes las thob pa'i thob pa mi skye'o // ji mngon par rtogs pa'i las thob pa kun rdzob shes pa de /
translated: Because the end of clear knowledge is not the obtainment of the subsequent clear knowledge of the path.

original: res 'ga' zhig na mngon du byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: res 'ga' zhig na mngon du byed dam zhe na /
translated: Is the conventional knowledge that is the result of clear knowledge sometimes manifested?

original: nam yang mi byed de /
analyzed: nam yang mi byed de /
translated: It is never manifested.

original: gcig tu / de ni mi skye'i chos can yin //
analyzed: gcig tu / de ni mi skye'i chos can yin //
translated: It is always nonarisen.

original: ji ltar na de'i thob pa skyes pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de'i thob pa skyes pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can its obtainment arise?

original: ma thob pa las thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma thob pa las thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is obtained from nonobtainment.

original: sa du ba'i shes pa de'i thob pa skye zhe na /
analyzed: sa du ba'i shes pa de'i thob pa skye zhe na /
translated: Does the obtainment of the knowledge of the truth of the path arise?

original: rang dang 'og sa /
analyzed: rang dang 'og sa /
translated: It arises from its own level and lower levels.

original: mthong ba'i lam sa gang pa'i yin //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam sa gang pa'i yin //
translated: The path of seeing is the level of the first absorption.

original: sa de ba dang sa 'og ma pa'i kun rdzob shes pa'i thob pa skye ste gal te mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa zhig yin na ni /
analyzed: sa de ba dang sa 'og ma pa'i kun rdzob shes pa'i thob pa skye ste gal te mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa zhig yin na ni /
translated: The obtainment of conventional knowledge of that level and lower level arises.

original: mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa dang / 'dod pa na spyong pa dang / sa gnyis pa'i thob pa skye la /
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa dang / 'dod pa na spyong pa dang / sa gnyis pa'i thob pa skye la /
translated: If it is the level of unrestricted anagamya, then the obtainment of the unrestricted level, the desire realm level and the second level arises.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mthong ba'i lam yin na ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mthong ba'i lam yin na ni /
translated: Similarly, if it is the path of seeing of the fourth absorption,

original: sa bdun pa'i kun rdzob shes pa'i thob pa skye ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sa bdun pa'i kun rdzob shes pa'i thob pa skye ba'i bar du'o //
translated: then the obtainment of conventional knowledge of the seventh level arises.

original: yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni du dag cig yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni du dag cig yin zhe na /
translated: Again, how many are foundations of mindfulness?

original: 'gog @244b pa'i mtha'/
analyzed: 'gog @244b pa'i mtha'/
translated: The limit of cessation.

original: 'gog pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yang yin pa de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa tha ma ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i mngon par rtogs pa'i kun rdzob shes pa yang yin pa de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa tha ma ste /
translated: Conventional knowledge of the clear realization of cessation is the final foundation of mindfulness,

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: because it is the foundation of mindfulness of phenomena.

original: gcig yongs su brtags pas lhag ma ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: gcig yongs su brtags pas lhag ma ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Since one is investigated, it is established that the remainder are the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes las thob pa kun rdzob shes pa de ni /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes las thob pa kun rdzob shes pa de ni /
translated: Conventional knowledge obtained subsequent to the realization of the truths

original: rang bden rnam pa /
analyzed: rang bden rnam pa /
translated: has the aspect of its own truth.

original: bden pa gang zhig mngon par rtogs nas thob pa de ni bden pa de nyid kyi rnam pa yin la /
analyzed: bden pa gang zhig mngon par rtogs nas thob pa de ni bden pa de nyid kyi rnam pa yin la /
translated: Conventional knowledge obtained subsequent to the realization of the truths has the aspect of the truth that is realized.

original: de'i rnam pa'o zhes smos pas de'i dmigs pa yang bden pa de nyid yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa'o zhes smos pas de'i dmigs pa yang bden pa de nyid yin no zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is said to have the aspect of that, it is explained that it also has that truth as its object.

original: de ni mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i phyir ro //🔽stsal bdag nyid ;
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i lam thob pa'i phyir ro // stsal bdag nyid ;
translated: Because it is obtained on the path of seeing.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: gzhan dag gi shes pa rnam pa bcu bo de dag ni stobs zhes mi bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of others is not called power.

original: de ni sangs rgyas nyag gcig gi stobs yin no //🔽ci'i phyir / de stobs gang phyir thogs pa med //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas nyag gcig gi stobs yin no // ci'i phyir / de stobs gang phyir thogs pa med //
translated: Only the Buddha has power.🔽Why? Because his knowledge is unobstructed with regard to all objects of knowledge.

original: gang gi phyi de'i mkhyen pa ni shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med pas /🔽de bas na stobs zhes bya ba gzhan dag gi shes pa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyi de'i mkhyen pa ni shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med pas / de bas na stobs zhes bya ba gzhan dag gi shes pa ni thogs pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: The knowledge of others is obstructed.

original: la lar 'dod kyang mi 'jug pa'i phyir de dag gi stobs zhes bya ba ming 'thob par 'os pa ma yin no //
analyzed: la lar 'dod kyang mi 'jug pa'i phyir de dag gi stobs zhes bya ba ming 'thob par 'os pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of others is not worthy of the name power, because it is obstructed and does not engage even though it wishes to.

original: 'dir dpe ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus rab tu byung bar 'dod pa'i ma phyi btang ba dang / bya zhig khras gtses pa'i skye ba la sogs pa'i mtha' ma mkhyen pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir dpe ni gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bus rab tu byung bar 'dod pa'i ma phyi btang ba dang / bya zhig khras gtses pa'i skye ba la sogs pa'i mtha' ma mkhyen pa yin no //
translated: Here, the example is the elder Śāriputra’s failure to know the end of the previous lives of the one who wanted to go forth, and the bird that was tormented by a hawk.

original: re zhig de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams kyi mkhyen pa thogs pa med pa'i phyir thugs kyi stobs ni shes bya bzhin du mtha' yas pa yin no //🔽sku yi sred med bu yi stobs //
analyzed: re zhig de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams kyi mkhyen pa thogs pa med pa'i phyir thugs kyi stobs ni shes bya bzhin du mtha' yas pa yin no // sku yi sred med bu yi stobs //
translated: Thus, the power of the mind of the Buddhas is infinite, like the object of their knowledge, because their knowledge is unobstructed.🔽The power of the body of the Buddha is equal to the power of Nārāyaṇa.

original: sku'i stobs ni srid med bu'i stobs tsam mo zhes brjod do //🔽gzhan dag tshigs na /🔽gzhan dag na re ni tshigs dang tshigs na sred med bu'i stobs tsam yod do zhes zer te /
analyzed: sku'i stobs ni srid med bu'i stobs tsam mo zhes brjod do // gzhan dag tshigs na / gzhan dag na re ni tshigs dang tshigs na sred med bu'i stobs tsam yod do zhes zer te /
translated: The power of the body of the Buddha is equal to the power of Nārāyaṇa.🔽Others say that the power of each of his bones is equal to the power of Nārāyaṇa.

original: btsun pa de ni stobs kyang @248a * //
analyzed: btsun pa de ni stobs kyang @248a * //
translated: Others say that the power of each of his bones is equal to the power of Nārāyaṇa.🔽But this is not correct,

original: thugs kyi stobs bzhin du mtha' yas pa yin no //
analyzed: thugs kyi stobs bzhin du mtha' yas pa yin no //
translated: for the power of the body of the Buddha is infinite, like the power of his mind.

original: de lta ma yin na mkhyen pa'i stobs mtha' yas pa bzod par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mkhyen pa'i stobs mtha' yas pa bzod par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, the power of his knowledge would not be infinite.

original: sangs rgyas dang 'khor los sgyur ba rnams kyi tshigs ni sprul gcus pa lta bu dang / lu gu rgyud dang / gzer bus btab pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang 'khor los sgyur ba rnams kyi tshigs ni sprul gcus pa lta bu dang / lu gu rgyud dang / gzer bus btab pa yin no //
translated: The bones of the Buddha and of a Cakravartin King are articulated like a garland, and are fastened by golden cords.

original: sred med kyi bu'i stobs kyi tshad kyang ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: sred med kyi bu'i stobs kyi tshad kyang ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of the power of Nārāyaṇa?

original: glang chen sten stobs /🔽bcus glag bdun gyi stobs yin no //
analyzed: glang chen sten stobs / bcus glag bdun gyi stobs yin no //
translated: The strength of seven elephants of the class of the supreme ones is the strength of one elephant of the class of the supreme of the supreme ones.

analyzed: glang po che tha mal pa bcu'i stobs gang yin pa de ni spos kyi glang po che gcig gi stobs yin no // de bzhin du tshan po che chen po dang / rab gnon dang / yan lag mchog dang / stobs mchog dang / sred med bu rnams gong nas gong du bcu 'gyur du bskyed de brjod par bya'o //
translated: The strength of ten elephants of the class of the supreme of the supreme ones is the strength of one elephant of the class of the supreme of the supreme of the supreme ones.🔽In this way, the strength of ten elephants of the class of the supreme of the supreme of the supreme ones is the strength of one Narayana elephant.🔽In this way, the strength of ten Narayana elephants is the strength of one and a half Narayana elephants.

original: de gnyis su bsgyur ba sred med bu'i stobs yin no zhes kyang zer te ji tsam du mang ba de tsam du rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis su bsgyur ba sred med bu'i stobs yin no zhes kyang zer te ji tsam du mang ba de tsam du rigs pa yin no //
translated: This is the point of reference for the strength of the Buddha.

original: de ni reg bya'i skye mched do //
analyzed: de ni reg bya'i skye mched do //
translated: This is the point of reference for the

original: sku'i stobs gang yin pa de ni thams cad kyi reg bya'i skye mched kyi rang bzhin 'byung ba chen po'i khyad par nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sku'i stobs gang yin pa de ni thams cad kyi reg bya'i skye mched kyi rang bzhin 'byung ba chen po'i khyad par nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The power of the body is the special nature of the great elements, the tangible of the sphere of touch.

original: gzhan dag na re rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bdun las don gzhan du gyur pa zhig yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rgyur byas pa'i gzugs bdun las don gzhan du gyur pa zhig yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: According to others, it is a certain derivative form different from the seven types of derivative form.

original: stobs rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: stobs rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The powers have been discussed.

original: mi 'jigs pa ni rnam bzhi ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa ni rnam bzhi ste /
translated: The fearlessnesses are four in number,

original: mdo las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin no //🔽mi 'jigs pa bzhi po de dag kyang /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin no // mi 'jigs pa bzhi po de dag kyang /
translated: as the Sutra shows.🔽The first and the tenth are the power of knowledge of what is possible and impossible.

original: ci ltar dang po bcu pa dang / gnyis pa bdun pa'i stobs yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar dang po bcu pa dang / gnyis pa bdun pa'i stobs yin no //
translated: The second and the seventh are the power of knowledge of the retribution of actions.🔽The third and the eighth are the power of knowledge of the absorptions, liberations, concentrations, and attainments.🔽The fourth and the ninth are the power of knowledge of the degree of the moral faculties of beings.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa stobs ji lta bar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la zhes bya ba'i mi 'jigs pa de yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa stobs ji lta bar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa la zhes bya ba'i mi 'jigs pa de yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The fifth is the fearlessness in acknowledging that all the obstacles have been destroyed.🔽The sixth is the fearlessness in declaring that all the paths leading to deliverance have been taught.

original: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ji lta bar zag pa zad par gyur pa la zhes bya ba'i mi 'jigs pa de yang de dang 'dra'o //🔽las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs ji lta bar /🔽ngas gang dag nyan thos rnams la bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos su gsungs pa la zhes bya ba'i mi 'jigs ba de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ji lta bar zag pa zad par gyur pa la zhes bya ba'i mi 'jigs pa de yang de dang 'dra'o // las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs ji lta bar / ngas gang dag nyan thos rnams la bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos su gsungs pa la zhes bya ba'i mi 'jigs ba de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The fearlessness of the masters of knowledge that consists of the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities is like the power of the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities.🔽The fearlessness of the masters of knowledge that consists of the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering is like the power of the knowledge of the path that leads to the cessation of suffering.🔽The fearlessness of the masters of knowledge that consists of the knowledge of the obstacles to the path is like the power of the knowledge of the obstacles.

original: kun du 'gor ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs ji lta bar ngas gang nyan thos rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba'i lam du gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i mi 'jigs pa yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun du 'gor ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs ji lta bar ngas gang nyan thos rnams kyi nges par 'byung ba'i lam du gsungs pa zhes bya ba'i mi 'jigs pa yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The fearlessness of the masters of knowledge that consists of the knowledge of the path that leads to definitive liberation is like the power of the knowledge of the path that leads to definitive liberation.

original: @248b ji ltar na mkhyen pa nyid mi 'jigs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: @248b ji ltar na mkhyen pa nyid mi 'jigs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How can knowledge itself be fearlessness?

original: mi skrag pa ni mi 'jigs pa yin la /🔽de dag gi ni mi skrag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi skrag pa ni mi 'jigs pa yin la / de dag gi ni mi skrag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Fearlessness is the absence of fear.🔽The masters of knowledge are not afraid in the assemblies.

original: shes par byas pa ni mi 'jigs pa yin par rigs kyi shes pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes par byas pa ni mi 'jigs pa yin par rigs kyi shes pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Fearlessness is the knowledge of the absence of fear.

original: 'khor gyi bye brag las dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'khor gyi bye brag las dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: The three close placements of mindfulness are distinguished according to the retinue.

original: mdo las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin no //🔽de yang / dran dang shes rab bdag nyid gsum //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin no // de yang / dran dang shes rab bdag nyid gsum //
translated: They are as they occur in the sutra.🔽They are the three that have mindfulness and wisdom as their nature.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum po de dag gis ni dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi rang bzhin te /🔽gang gi tshe nyan thos gus par nyan pa'am mi nyan pa'am gnyi ga la kun tu dgyes pa'am /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum po de dag gis ni dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi rang bzhin te / gang gi tshe nyan thos gus par nyan pa'am mi nyan pa'am gnyi ga la kun tu dgyes pa'am /
translated: These three close placements of mindfulness have the nature of mindfulness and introspection.

original: kun nas mnar sems su yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems su yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When the disciples listen respectfully, do not listen respectfully, or both, they are not pleased or displeased.

original: ci'i phyir de dag la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag la sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called the buddhas unshared qualities?

original: sngon gyi gnas bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang na nyan thos rnams gang gi yin pa de la gus par nyan pa'am gus par mi nyan pa'am /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir ro // yang na nyan thos rnams gang gi yin pa de la gus par nyan pa'am gus par mi nyan pa'am /
translated: Because they abandon the traces of former abodes.

original: gnyi ga la ni shin tu yang yid bde ba la sogs pa'i go skabs su 'gyur gyi gzhan dag la ni de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: gnyi ga la ni shin tu yang yid bde ba la sogs pa'i go skabs su 'gyur gyi gzhan dag la ni de lta ma yin na /
translated: Or else, the disciples are those who listen respectfully, do not listen respectfully, or both, and they are the opportunity for complete satisfaction and so on, but not for others.

original: de la de mi skye ba ya mtshan du rnam par gzhag gi /
analyzed: de la de mi skye ba ya mtshan du rnam par gzhag gi /
translated: It is amazing that it does not arise in that which is not a cause.🔽

original: gzhan dag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is a wonder that it does not arise in them, but not a wonder that it does not arise in others.

original: de ni thugs rje chen po la sogs pa brjod par bya ste /🔽de smras pa /🔽thugs rje chen po kun rdzob blo /
analyzed: de ni thugs rje chen po la sogs pa brjod par bya ste / de smras pa / thugs rje chen po kun rdzob blo /
translated: The great compassion, etc., will now be described.🔽The great compassion is a conventional knowledge.

original: thugs rje chen po ni kun rdzob shes pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni kun rdzob shes pa'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: The great compassion is by nature a conventional knowledge.

original: gzhan du na sems can thams cad la dmigs pa yang mi 'grub pa /
analyzed: gzhan du na sems can thams cad la dmigs pa yang mi 'grub pa /
translated: Otherwise, it would not be established as having all sentient beings as its object,

original: snying rje bzhin du sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa yang ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snying rje bzhin du sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa yang ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: and it would not have the aspect of the three kinds of suffering, as does compassion.

original: 'di ci'i phyir thugs rje chen po zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ci'i phyir thugs rje chen po zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called great compassion?🔽It is great because of its accumulation,

original: tshogs dang rnam pa spyod yul dang // mnyam pa'i phyir dang ches che'i phyir //
analyzed: tshogs dang rnam pa spyod yul dang // mnyam pa'i phyir dang ches che'i phyir //
translated: its aspect, its object, its equality, and its greatness.

original: tshogs kyi ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen pos yang dag par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs kyi ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen pos yang dag par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is great because of its accumulation, since it is achieved through a great accumulation of merit and knowledge.

original: rnam pas ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pas ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is great because of its aspect, since it has the aspect of the three kinds of suffering.

original: dmigs pas ni khams gsum pa'i sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pas ni khams gsum pa'i sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Compassion is great by its domain, since it has for its object the beings of the three realms of existence.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyis ni sems can thams cad la 'dra bar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyis ni sems can thams cad la 'dra bar 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is great by its equality, since it is applied equally to all beings.

original: ches che ba nyid kyis ni de las ches che ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ches che ba nyid kyis ni de las ches che ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is great by its greatness, since there is no greater one than it.

original: snying rje dang thugs rje chen po gnyis tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: snying rje dang thugs rje chen po gnyis tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between compassion and great compassion?

original: tha dad bya ba rnam pa brgyad //
analyzed: tha dad bya ba rnam pa brgyad //
translated: There are eight differences:

original: rang bzhin las ni zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin las ni zhe mi sdang ba dang / gti mi mug pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: 1. By its intrinsic nature: compassion is by nature absence of hatred; great compassion is by nature absence of delusion.

original: rnam pa las ni sdug bsngal gcig dang gsum gyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽dmigs pa las ni khams @249a * //
analyzed: rnam pa las ni sdug bsngal gcig dang gsum gyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro // dmigs pa las ni khams @249a * //
translated: 2. By its aspects: compassion has for its object the suffering of beings; great compassion has for its object the suffering of beings and the causes of the suffering of beings.

original: gcig dang khams gsum pa'i sems can la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig dang khams gsum pa'i sems can la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: 3. By its domain: compassion has for its object the beings of one realm; great compassion has for its object the beings of the three realms.

original: sa las ni bsam gtan bzhi dang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa las ni bsam gtan bzhi dang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: 4. By its stage: compassion is of the stage of the four meditations; great compassion is of the stage of the fourth meditation.🔽5.

original: rgyud las ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi rgyud las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud las ni nyan thos la sogs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi rgyud las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Sūtra on the Posture for Beginning Meditation says,🔽The Buddha said to Śāriputra, “Here, Śāriputra, a bodhisattva great being who practices the perfection of wisdom attends to the perfection of wisdom with the attention of no attention.🔽He does not attend to form, and he does not attend to the perfection of wisdom apart from form.

original: thob pa las ni 'dod pa'i khams dang srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa las ni 'dod pa'i khams dang srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not attend to feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness, and he does not attend to the perfection of wisdom apart from feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.🔽He does not attend to the perfection of giving, and he does not attend to the perfection of wisdom apart from the perfection of giving.🔽He does not attend to the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, or concentration, and he does not attend to the perfection of wisdom apart from the perfection of morality, patience, perseverance, or concentration.🔽He does not attend to the perfection of wisdom, and he does not attend to the perfection of wisdom apart from the perfection of wisdom.

original: yongs su mi skyob pa dang yongs su skyob pa yin pa'i phyir ba dang / mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs pa las thugs rje mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su mi skyob pa dang yongs su skyob pa yin pa'i phyir ba dang / mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs pa las thugs rje mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not attend to the perfection of skillful means, and he does not attend to the perfection of wisdom apart from the perfection of skillful means.🔽He does not attend to the perfection of aspiration, and he does not attend to the perfection of wisdom apart from the perfection of aspiration.🔽He does not attend to the perfection of strength, and he does not attend to the perfection of wisdom apart from the perfection of strength.

original: ci sangs rgyas thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mnyam pa nyid yin nam zhe na /🔽tshogs dang chos sku 'gro ba'i don //
analyzed: ci sangs rgyas thams cad rnam pa thams cad du mnyam pa nyid yin nam zhe na / tshogs dang chos sku 'gro ba'i don //
translated: He does not attend to the perfection of knowledge, and he does not attend to the perfection of wisdom apart from the perfection of knowledge.🔽He does not attend to the perfection of wisdom, and he does not attend to the perfection of wisdom apart from the perfection of wisdom.🔽He does not attend to the perfection of wisdom, and he does not attend to the perfection of wisdom apart from the perfection of wisdom.🔽He does not attend to the perfection of wisdom, and he does not attend to the perfection of wisdom apart from the perfection of wisdom.🔽He does not attend to the perfection of wisdom, and he does not attend to the perfection of wisdom apart from the perfection of wisdom.🔽He does not attend to the perfection of wisdom, and he does not attend to the perfection of wisdom apart from the perfection of wisdom.🔽He does not attend to the perfection of wisdom, and he does not attend to the perfection of wisdom apart from the perfection of wisdom.

original: spyod pas sangs rgyas thams cad dag /🔽mnyam pa nyid de sku tshe dang / rigs dang tshad kyis ma yin no //
analyzed: spyod pas sangs rgyas thams cad dag /🔽mnyam pa nyid de sku tshe dang / rigs dang tshad kyis ma yin no //
translated: He does not attend to the perfection of wisdom, and he does not attend

original: sangs rgyas thams cad ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad kyis yang dag par 'grub pa dang / chos kyi sku yongs su 'grub pa dang / 'jig rten gyi don spyod pa dang / rgyu gsum gyis mnyam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad kyis yang dag par 'grub pa dang / chos kyi sku yongs su 'grub pa dang / 'jig rten gyi don spyod pa dang / rgyu gsum gyis mnyam pa nyid yin no //
translated: All the Buddhas are the same by reason of their perfect purity, by reason of their perfect knowledge, by reason of their perfect abandonment, by reason of their mastery of action and of knowledge, by reason of their perfect embodiment, by reason of their perfect mastery, and by reason of their perfect deliverance.

original: sku tshe dang cho rigs dang tshad du byas pa ni bye brag yod de /
analyzed: sku tshe dang cho rigs dang tshad du byas pa ni bye brag yod de /
translated: They are not the same with regard to their life-span, their family, their caste, their stature, etc.

original: yun ring po dang thung dur 'tsho ba dang / rgyal rigs dang / bram ze'i rigs tha dad pa dang // 'od srungs dang sh'akya la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa dang / dus ji lta ba zhin du sku'i bod tshod che chung tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring po dang thung dur 'tsho ba dang / rgyal rigs dang / bram ze'i rigs tha dad pa dang // 'od srungs dang sh'akya la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa dang / dus ji lta ba zhin du sku'i bod tshod che chung tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have long or short lives; they belong to the warrior or priestly castes; they belong to the Gautama or Kāśyapa families, etc.; their bodies are great or small; their activities are well known or not well known; they are gentle or severe; they manifest themselves as having wisdom or effort as their principal element, etc.

original: 'di lta ste phun sum tshogs pa gsum po //
analyzed: 'di lta ste phun sum tshogs pa gsum po //
translated: The three perfections are:

original: rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan pa phun sum tshogs pa de dag kho na yid la byed pa'i mkhas pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la /
analyzed: rgyu phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa dang / phan pa phun sum tshogs pa de dag kho na yid la byed pa'i mkhas pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la /
translated: The wise who keep in mind the perfect cause, the perfect result, and the perfect benefit are the Buddhas, the Transcendent Conquerors.

original: dga' ba dang bkur sti chen po bskyed par nus so //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bkur sti chen po bskyed par nus so //
translated: The wise who keep in mind just these perfections of cause, effect, and benefit are able to generate great joy and respect for the Lord Buddhas.

original: de la rgyu phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la rgyu phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of cause is fourfold:

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la goms pa dang / yun ring po nas goms pa dang / bar chad med par goms pa dang / gus par byas te goms pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs la goms pa dang / yun ring po nas goms pa dang / bar chad med par goms pa dang / gus par byas te goms pa'o //
translated: familiarity with the stores of merit and intuition, familiarity over a long time, familiarity without interruption, and familiarity with devotion.

original: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of effect is also fourfold:

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mthu phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzugs kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang / spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / mthu phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzugs kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of intuition, the perfection of abandonment, the perfection of might, and the perfection of the body of the Dharma.

original: phan pa phun sum tshogs pa la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: phan pa phun sum tshogs pa la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of benefit is also fourfold:

original: ngan song gsum dang 'khor ba las shin tu nges par grol ba phun sum tshogs pa'am /
analyzed: ngan song gsum dang 'khor ba las shin tu nges par grol ba phun sum tshogs pa'am /
translated: It is perfect in that it is completely liberated from the three lower realms and from cyclic existence.

original: theg pa gsum dang bde 'gro la 'god par byed pas phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum dang bde 'gro la 'god par byed pas phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is perfect in that it establishes beings in the three vehicles and in happy rebirths.

original: de la ye shes phun sum tshogs @249b pa la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la ye shes phun sum tshogs @249b pa la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of knowledge is fourfold:

original: ma bstan par mkhyen pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang / thams cad du mkhyen pa dang / ma 'bad par mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: ma bstan par mkhyen pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa dang / thams cad du mkhyen pa dang / ma 'bad par mkhyen pa'o //
translated: knowledge without teaching, knowledge of everything, knowledge of everything in all ways, and knowledge without effort.

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of abandonment is fourfold:

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa dang / bag chags dang bcas te spangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa'o //
translated: abandonment of all the afflictions, abandonment forever, abandonment together with the traces, and abandonment of all the obscurations to meditative stabilization and to the attainments.

original: mthu phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mthu phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The perfection of power is fourfold:

original: phyi'i yul sprul pa dang / yongs su bsgyur ba yin gyis rlob pa'i mnga' phun sum tshogs pa dang / sku tshe gtong bar byin gyis brlab pa'i mnga' phun sum tshogs pa dang / sgrib pa dang / nam mkha' dang shin tu ring ba la yang myur du gshegs pa dang /
analyzed: phyi'i yul sprul pa dang / yongs su bsgyur ba yin gyis rlob pa'i mnga' phun sum tshogs pa dang / sku tshe gtong bar byin gyis brlab pa'i mnga' phun sum tshogs pa dang / sgrib pa dang / nam mkha' dang shin tu ring ba la yang myur du gshegs pa dang /
translated: The power of emanation and transformation of external objects, the power of blessing, the power of blessing the duration of life, the power of going quickly even to the far distant and the power of entering the small into the great.

original: chung ngu chen por 'jug par mdzad pa'i mnga' phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag nyid kyi ya mtshan gyi chos rnam pa du ma phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: chung ngu chen por 'jug par mdzad pa'i mnga' phun sum tshogs pa dang / bdag nyid kyi ya mtshan gyi chos rnam pa du ma phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The power of the many marvelous qualities of the self.

original: gzugs kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The power of the perfect form body is also fourfold.

original: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa dang / dpe byad phun sum tshogs pa dang / stobs phun sum tshogs dang / sku rdo rje ltar sra ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa dang / dpe byad phun sum tshogs pa dang / stobs phun sum tshogs dang / sku rdo rje ltar sra ba nyid phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The power of the perfect major marks, the power of the perfect minor marks, the power of the perfect strength and the power of the perfect vajra-like body.

original: de dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi che ba'i bdag nyid mdor bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi che ba'i bdag nyid mdor bsdus pa yin no //
translated: These are the brief characteristics of the greatness of the Bhagavan Buddhas.

original: de ni dbye na rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni dbye na rab tu dbye ba mtha' yas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is classified, it becomes infinite.🔽

original: de yang gal te bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis sku tshe bskal pa grangs med pa du mar byin gyis brlabs na ni mtha' dag brjod pa dang mkhyen par spyod do //
analyzed: de yang gal te bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis sku tshe bskal pa grangs med pa du mar byin gyis brlabs na ni mtha' dag brjod pa dang mkhyen par spyod do //
translated: If the Blessed One were to extend his life for many countless eons, he would not be able to tell all the distinctions of the Buddha qualities.

original: de ltar na re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni ye shes dang mthu dang phan pa'i yon tan mtha' yas shing rmad du byung ba rin po che chen po'i 'byung gnas yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni ye shes dang mthu dang phan pa'i yon tan mtha' yas shing rmad du byung ba rin po che chen po'i 'byung gnas yin no //
translated: Thus, the Tathagatas are the source of the jewel of the infinite, marvelous qualities of knowledge, power, and benefit.

original: 'on kyang byis pa rang gi yon tan dbul bas mos pa bcom pa rnams ni yon tan gyi 'byor pa de lta bu thob kyang sangs rgyas dang de'i chos la gus par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang byis pa rang gi yon tan dbul bas mos pa bcom pa rnams ni yon tan gyi 'byor pa de lta bu thob kyang sangs rgyas dang de'i chos la gus par mi byed kyi /
translated: But the childish, their aspiration destroyed by their poverty of good qualities, do not respect the Buddha and his Dharma, even though they have obtained such an abundance of good qualities.

original: mkhas pa rnams ni rkang yan chad nas /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni rkang yan chad nas /
translated: But the wise, from the soles of their feet on up,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de dang de'i chos la yid ches par 'gyur te /
