translated: There are four correct unhindered knowledges:🔽correct unhindered knowledge of the teaching,🔽correct unhindered knowledge of the meaning,🔽correct unhindered knowledge of the expression,

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: correct unhindered knowledge of eloquence.

original: de dag kyang nyon mongs pa med pa ji lta ba de bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang nyon mongs pa med pa ji lta ba de bzhin no //
translated: They are like the absence of conflict.

original: de dag gi de bzhin zhes bya ba yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: de dag gi de bzhin zhes bya ba yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the nature of these four?

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can rnams kyi yin pa dang / mi'i lus la brten pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can rnams kyi yin pa dang / mi'i lus la brten pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: They belong to those who are unshakable; they are supported by the body of a human.

original: de dag gi dmigs pa dang sa'i bye brag ni tha dad par brjod do //🔽ming tshig don la thogs med shes //
analyzed: de dag gi dmigs pa dang sa'i bye brag ni tha dad par brjod do // ming tshig don la thogs med shes //
translated: But their object and stage are distinguished.

original: gsum po dag dang rim bzhin no //
analyzed: gsum po dag dang rim bzhin no //
translated: The first is the knowledge of the name, the second is the knowledge of the phrase, the third is the knowledge of the syllable, and the fourth is the knowledge of the expression.🔽The first is the knowledge of the name, the second is the knowledge of the phrase, the third is the knowledge of the syllable, and the fourth is the knowledge of the expression.

original: ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams dang don dang tshig la thogs pa med par shes pa ni rim pa bzhin du chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa yin no //
analyzed: ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams dang don dang tshig la thogs pa med par shes pa ni rim pa bzhin du chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa yin no //
translated: The cognition of the object and the word without obstruction is, respectively, the correct un derstanding of the object and the correct understanding of the word.

original: bzhi pa rig pa thogs med bar //
analyzed: bzhi pa rig pa thogs med bar //
translated: The fourth is the unobstructed cognition

original: brjod dang lam la dbang nyid la //🔽thogs pa med par shes pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /🔽spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ni rig pa dang / thags thogs med par brjod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin @251a * //
analyzed: brjod dang lam la dbang nyid la // thogs pa med par shes pa zhes bya bar sbyar te / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ni rig pa dang / thags thogs med par brjod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin @251a * //
translated: of expression and of the path.🔽The correct understanding of eloquence is the unobstructed cognition of expression and the unobstructed cognition of the path.

original: la dbang ba dang / rab tu gsal bar bya ba la thogs pa med par shes pa'o //🔽de yi dmigs pa dag dang lam //
analyzed: la dbang ba dang / rab tu gsal bar bya ba la thogs pa med par shes pa'o // de yi dmigs pa dag dang lam //
translated: The correct understanding of eloquence is the cognition of the unobstructed expression of the teaching, the cognition of the unobstructed expression of the path, and the cognition of the unobstructed expression of eloquence.

original: de'i dmigs pa dag dang lam yin no //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa dag dang lam yin no //
translated: The object of the latter is purity and the path.🔽The object of the latter, the correct understanding of eloquence, is purity and the path.

original: shes pa dgu ste /
analyzed: shes pa dgu ste /
translated: It is nine cognitions.

original: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ni 'gog pa shes pa ma gtogs pa dgu'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa ni 'gog pa shes pa ma gtogs pa dgu'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The correct understanding of eloquence is by nature the nine cognitions, excluding the cognition of cessation.

original: sa thams cad dang / de ni ngag dang lam gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig la dmigs pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyis thams cad pa yin no //
analyzed: sa thams cad dang / de ni ngag dang lam gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig la dmigs pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyis thams cad pa yin no //
translated: It is on all levels, from the level of the realm of desire up to the summit of existence, because it has for its cognitive object either speech or the path.

original: yang dag don rig bcu 'am drug / don so so yang dag par rig pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag don rig bcu 'am drug / don so so yang dag par rig pa ni /
translated: The cognition of the object consists of ten or six cognitions.

original: gal te don chos thams cad yin na ni shes pa bcu yin no //
analyzed: gal te don chos thams cad yin na ni shes pa bcu yin no //
translated: If the object is all factors, it consists of ten cognitions.

original: gal te don mya ngan las 'das pa yin na ni chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa rnams te /
analyzed: gal te don mya ngan las 'das pa yin na ni chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa rnams te /
translated: If the object is nirvāṇa, it consists of six cognitions: cognition of the factors, subsequent cognition, cognition of cessation, cognition of exhaustion, cognition of non-arising, conventional cognition.

original: shes pa drug yin no //
analyzed: shes pa drug yin no //
translated: The cognition of the object consists of six cognitions.

original: de ni thams cad /
analyzed: de ni thams cad /
translated: It is on all levels.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa ni sa thams cad pa'o //
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa ni sa thams cad pa'o //
translated: The cognition of the object is on all levels.

original: gzhan kun rdzob /
analyzed: gzhan kun rdzob /
translated: The others are conventional cognition.

original: gzhan chos dang nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa gnyis ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa dang / ngag la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: gzhan chos dang nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa gnyis ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa dang / ngag la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The other two, the analytical knowledges of phenomena and of etymology, have conventional knowledge as their nature, because they focus on collections of names, etc. and on speech.

original: chos rig 'dod dang bsam gtan na //
analyzed: chos rig 'dod dang bsam gtan na //
translated: The knowledge of phenomena is in the desire realm and the absorptions.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa ni sa lnga po 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan bzhis bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa ni sa lnga po 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan bzhis bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The analytical knowledge of phenomena is included in five levels: the desire realm and the four absorptions.

original: de'i gong na ming gi tshogs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gong na ming gi tshogs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not included in higher levels because there are no collections of names there.

original: ngag ni 'dod dang dang po na //
analyzed: ngag ni 'dod dang dang po na //
translated: Speech is in the desire realm and the first absorption.

original: ngag dang nges pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni don gcig go //
analyzed: ngag dang nges pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni don gcig go //
translated: Speech and etymology are synonyms.

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa yin te /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa yin te /
translated: The analytical knowledge of etymology is in the desire realm and the level of the first absorption.

original: de'i gong na rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gong na rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not in higher levels because there is no investigation there.

original: btags pa las ni so so yang dag par rig pa dag ni 'di skad du ston te /
analyzed: btags pa las ni so so yang dag par rig pa dag ni 'di skad du ston te /
translated: The Abhidharmasamuccaya states that the analytical knowledges are taught as follows.

original: tshig dang yi ge dang de nyid kyi don dang / de nyid kyi gcig dang gnyis dang / mang po dang / pho mo la sogs pa'i tshig bla dags de dag la thogs pa med par bya ba'i phyir thogs pa med par shes pa ni chos la sogs pa so so yang dag par rig pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge dang de nyid kyi don dang / de nyid kyi gcig dang gnyis dang / mang po dang / pho mo la sogs pa'i tshig bla dags de dag la thogs pa med par bya ba'i phyir thogs pa med par shes pa ni chos la sogs pa so so yang dag par rig pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: The knowledge that is unobstructed with regard to those words, letters, meanings, and the terms for those things, such as one, two, many, male, and female, is the analytical knowledge of phenomena, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gi rim pa ni de ltar grub bo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag gi rim pa ni de ltar grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the order of these analytical knowledges is established in that way.

original: tshig nges pa ni nges pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: tshig nges pa ni nges pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The definition of a word is its meaning.

original: dper na gzugs su rung bas na gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs su rung bas na gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: For example, “form” is so called because it is capable of materiality.

original: gzhan dag na re lan dang lan la spobs pas na spobs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re lan dang lan la spobs pas na spobs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Eloquence is so called because it is the ability to respond to questions and counterarguments.

original: so so yang dag @251b par reg pa de dag gi sngar sbyor ba ni rim bzhin du rtsis dang / sangs rgyas kyi bka' dang / sgra rig pa dang / gtan tshigs rig pa dag yin te /
analyzed: so so yang dag @251b par reg pa de dag gi sngar sbyor ba ni rim bzhin du rtsis dang / sangs rgyas kyi bka' dang / sgra rig pa dang / gtan tshigs rig pa dag yin te /
translated: The preparations for those analytical knowledges are, respectively, mathematics, the Buddha’s word, grammar, and logic.

original: de dag la mkhas par ma byas par de dag bskyed par mi nus so zhes grag go //
analyzed: de dag la mkhas par ma byas par de dag bskyed par mi nus so zhes grag go //
translated: It is well known that one cannot produce them without having mastered them.

original: de dag thams cad kyi sbyor ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' kho na yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi sbyor ba ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' kho na yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: It is said that the application of all of them is the word of the Buddha.

original: gang gis so so yang dag par rig pa gcig thob pa des gdon mi za bar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi char yang 'thob ste /
analyzed: gang gis so so yang dag par rig pa gcig thob pa des gdon mi za bar so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi char yang 'thob ste /
translated: When one obtains one perfect knowledge, one necessarily obtains all four.

original: ma tshang bar ni de thob med //
analyzed: ma tshang bar ni de thob med //
translated: One does not obtain them without obtaining all.

original: so so yang dag rig pa de dag ma tshang bar thob pa can ni med do //
analyzed: so so yang dag rig pa de dag ma tshang bar thob pa can ni med do //
translated: One does not obtain the perfect knowledges without obtaining all of them.

original: de ltar na nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan bstan pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: de ltar na nyon mongs pa med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan bstan pa gang yin pa /
translated: Thus the qualities of the absence of conflict and so on have been explained.

original: drug po de dag rab mtha' yis //
analyzed: drug po de dag rab mtha' yis //
translated: The sixth is the highest.

original: de dag ni rab gyi  mtha' ba'i bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis 'thob bo //
analyzed: de dag ni rab gyi  mtha' ba'i bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis 'thob bo //
translated: They are obtained by the power of the fourth absorption of the summit of existence.🔽That is of six types.

original: de ni rnam drug / rab kyi mtha' pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa de yang /
analyzed: de ni rnam drug / rab kyi mtha' pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa de yang /
translated: The fourth absorption of the summit of existence is of six types.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa dang smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa gsum dang / rab kyi mtha' pa de nyid dang / drug gi bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa dang smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa gsum dang / rab kyi mtha' pa de nyid dang / drug gi bdag nyid yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers and the knowledge of non-arising.

original: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of the conventional is the knowledge of the conventional.

original: de'i stobs kyis thob pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis thob pa yin gyi /
translated: The knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the path.🔽The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers and the knowledge of non-arising.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the conventional is the knowledge of the conventional.

original: rab kyi mtha' zhes bya ba de ci zhe na /
analyzed: rab kyi mtha' zhes bya ba de ci zhe na /
translated: The knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the path.🔽The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers and the knowledge of non-arising.🔽The knowledge of the conventional is the knowledge of the conventional.

original: bsam gtan mtha'/ bsam gtan bzhi pa yin no //🔽de ni sa kun rjes mthun zhing //
analyzed: bsam gtan mtha'/ bsam gtan bzhi pa yin no // de ni sa kun rjes mthun zhing //
translated: The knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the path.🔽The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers and the knowledge of non-arising.

original: 'phel ba'i mtha' mar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'phel ba'i mtha' mar phyin pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the conventional is the knowledge of the conventional.🔽The knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the path.🔽The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers and the knowledge of non-arising.🔽The knowledge of the conventional is the knowledge of the conventional.

original: ji ltar na sa thams cad dang rjes su mthun pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sa thams cad dang rjes su mthun pa yin zhe na /
translated: The knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the path.🔽The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers and the knowledge of non-arising.

original: 'dod pa las spyod pa'i sems las bsam gtan dang po yin la /🔽de las ni gnyis pa ste /🔽de bzhin du rim gyis 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa las spyod pa'i sems las bsam gtan dang po yin la / de las ni gnyis pa ste / de bzhin du rim gyis 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the conventional is the knowledge of the conventional.🔽The knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the path.🔽The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers and the knowledge of non-arising.🔽The knowledge of the conventional is the knowledge of the conventional.🔽The knowledge of the path is the knowledge of the path.

original: mi mthun pa ni yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can gyi bar du yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa ni yang 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can gyi bar du yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the destruction of the cankers is the knowledge of the destruction of the cankers and the knowledge of non-arising.🔽The knowledge of the conventional is the knowledge of the conventional.

original: yang rjes su mthun pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar yin te /
analyzed: yang rjes su mthun pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar yin te /
translated: The fourth is the summit of cyclic existence, the fourth meditation.

original: de ltar nas thams cad rjes su mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar nas thams cad rjes su mthun pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the fourth meditation is the limit of the summit.

original: ji ltar na 'phel ba'i mthar phyin pa yin zhe na /🔽de ltar bsgoms pa chung ngu las 'bring /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'phel ba'i mthar phyin pa yin zhe na / de ltar bsgoms pa chung ngu las 'bring /
translated: How does one reach the limit of growth?🔽One enters meditative attainment of the intermediate meditation from the small meditation,

original: 'bring las chen por snyoms par 'jug cing 'phel ba'i mchog tu byung ba ni /
analyzed: 'bring las chen por snyoms par 'jug cing 'phel ba'i mchog tu byung ba ni /
translated: and of the great meditation from the medium meditation.

original: 'phel ba'i mthar phyin ba ste /
analyzed: 'phel ba'i mthar phyin ba ste /
translated: The arising of the supreme meditation is the limit of growth.

original: bsam gtan de lta bu ni rab kyi mtha' yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan de lta bu ni rab kyi mtha' yin no //
translated: This meditation is the limit of the supreme.

original: 'di ni mtha'i tha mar rab tu phyin pa tsam yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ni mtha'i tha mar rab tu phyin pa tsam yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is the limit of the summit, for it is the limit of growth.

original: 'dir mtha' zhes bya ba ni 'phel ba'am rnam pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir mtha' zhes bya ba ni 'phel ba'am rnam pa yin te /
translated: Here, the summit is growth or a type,

original: mu bzhi zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mu bzhi zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: like the four alternatives.

original: yon tan drug po de dag kyang /🔽sangs rgyas las gzhan sbyor las skye //
analyzed: yon tan drug po de dag kyang / sangs rgyas las gzhan sbyor las skye //
translated: These six qualities

original: sangs rgyas las gzhan @252a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas las gzhan @252a * //
translated: arise from preparatory effort in those other than a Buddha.

original: pa'i ni sbyor ba las byung ba yin gyi 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i ni sbyor ba las byung ba yin gyi 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In those other than a Buddha, these six qualities arise from preparatory effort, but not from the obtainment of freedom from attachment.

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni sbyor ba las byung ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni sbyor ba las byung ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: The Buddha has no qualities arisen from preparatory practice.

original: de ni chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad kyi dbang phyug yin pa'i phyir /
translated: He is the master of all dharmas.

original: yon tan mngon du bya ba thams cad ni bzhed pa tsam la rag lus pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan mngon du bya ba thams cad ni bzhed pa tsam la rag lus pa yin no //
translated: All the realizations of qualities depend on his mere wish.

original: de dag ni re zhig nyan thos dang thun mong ba'i yon tan yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni re zhig nyan thos dang thun mong ba'i yon tan yin no //
translated: These are the qualities common to the Buddha and sravakas.

original: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ni so so'i skye bo dag dang thun mong yin te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la sogs pa ni so so'i skye bo dag dang thun mong yin te /
translated: The superknowledges and so on are common to ordinary beings.🔽What are the superknowledges?

original: mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba de yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: The six superknowledges are:🔽superknowledge of the base of supernatural power,🔽the divine eye, the divine ear,🔽the recollection of former lives,

original: mngon shes rnam drug rdzu 'phrul dang // rna ba yid dang sngon tshe dang // shi 'pho skye dang zad shes pa //🔽mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: mngon shes rnam drug rdzu 'phrul dang // rna ba yid dang sngon tshe dang // shi 'pho skye dang zad shes pa //🔽mngon du bya'o //
translated: the knowledge of death and rebirth, and the knowledge of the extinction of contaminants.🔽The superknowledge of the base of supernatural power is the knowledge of the base of supernatural power.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba dang / sems kyi rnam grangs dang / tshe snga ma dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi yul shes pa dang / lha'i rna ba dang / sems kyi rnam grangs dang / tshe snga ma dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: 1. the superknowledge of the cognition of the object of supernormal creations; 2. the superknowledge of the divine ear; 3. the superknowledge of the cognition of the mental activities of others; 4. the superknowledge of the cognition of former abodes; 5. the superknowledge of the cognition of death and rebirth; 6. the superknowledge of the cognition of the destruction of the impurities.

original: de ltar mngon par shes pa drug po de dag las lnga ni so so'i skye bo dang thun mong yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mngon par shes pa drug po de dag las lnga ni so so'i skye bo dang thun mong yin no //
translated: Among these six superknowledges, five are common to the ordinary man.

original: de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni /
translated: All of them

original: grol lam blo //
analyzed: grol lam blo //
translated: are the path of liberation.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhin du rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi /🔽shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhin du rnam par grol ba'i lam gyi / shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Like the fruits of the religious life, they are by nature the cognition of the path of liberation.

original: bzhi ni kun rdzob shes pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi ni kun rdzob shes pa ste /
translated: Four are conventional cognition.

original: sems kyi rnam grangs dang / zag pa zad par shes pa'i mngon par shes pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs dang / zag pa zad par shes pa'i mngon par shes pa ma gtogs so //
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of the mental activities of others and the superknowledge of the cognition of the destruction of the impurities are, respectively, cognition of the mind of another and cognition of exhaustion of the impurities.

original: sems shes pa ni lnga yin no //
analyzed: sems shes pa ni lnga yin no //
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of the mental activities of others is five cognitions.

original: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa'i mngon par shes pa ni chos dang / rjes su shes pa dang / lam dang / kun rdzob dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang lnga yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa'i mngon par shes pa ni chos dang / rjes su shes pa dang / lam dang / kun rdzob dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa dang lnga yin no //
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of exhaustion is made up of the same five cognitions as the power of the cognition of exhaustion.

original: zad pa'i mngon shes stobs bzhin no //
analyzed: zad pa'i mngon shes stobs bzhin no //
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of exhaustion is like the power.

original: 'di ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ji skad du shes pa drug gam /
analyzed: 'di ni zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ji skad du shes pa drug gam /
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of exhaustion is made up of the same five cognitions as the power of the cognition of exhaustion.

original: bcu yin pa zhes bshad pa de bzhin du rig par bya la /
analyzed: bcu yin pa zhes bshad pa de bzhin du rig par bya la /
translated: The superknowledge of the cognition of exhaustion is like the power.🔽The superknowledge of the cognition of exhaustion is made up of the same five cognitions as the power of the cognition of exhaustion.

original: de bzhin dus thams cad pa yin par yang shes par bya'o //

analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pas kyang mi dran no //
translated: The superknowledge of the recollection of past lives does not recollect past lives in higher realms.

analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa'i mngon par shes pas @252b kyang mthong ste /

translated: Therefore the minds of formless realm beings are not apprehended by the two superknowledges of the diversity of minds and the recollection of past lives because they are higher realms.

analyzed: de dag ji ltar 'thob ce na / ma 'dres pa rnams kyi sbyor bas //

analyzed: mngon par shes pa tshe rabs gzhan na goms pa zhig yin na ni 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob bo //

original: bye brag can na ni sbyor bas 'thob po //
analyzed: bye brag can na ni sbyor bas 'thob po //

analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs mngon par shes pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba la dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir tshor ba dang sems dang chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang gsum gyi rang bzhin yin no // dang po rna ba rdzu 'phrul mig / mngon par shes pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The superknowledge of the categories of mind is by nature the three foundations of mindfulness of sensation, mind, and factors, because it has mind and mental factors for its cognitive object.🔽The first three are the foundation of mindfulness of the body.

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: lha'i rna ba dang mig gi mngon par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni sgra dang gzugs kyi skye mched yin no //

original: de dag gi nang nas /

analyzed: @253b yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su bstan pa ni gzhan du bya bar mi nus te /
translated: But it is impossible for another to teach the truth just as it is.

original: mi 'khrul pa'i phyir na de ni gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: mi 'khrul pa'i phyir na de ni gtso bo yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is nonerroneous, it is the best.

original: de gnyis kyis ni gtod pa tsam du byed la /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis ni gtod pa tsam du byed la /

original: rdzu 'phrul zhes bya brdzu 'phrul de ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul zhes bya brdzu 'phrul de ci yin zhe na /

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i lugs kyis ni /

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ting nge 'dzin 'dis 'grub bar 'gyur bas ni zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: it is concentration, because one accomplishes the miracle through this concentration.

original: des ci zhig 'grub ce na /
analyzed: des ci zhig 'grub ce na /
translated: What is accomplished through it?

original: de las ni /
analyzed: de las ni /
translated: From it,🔽there is creation, going, and transformation.

original: sprul pa dang 'gro ba dang / de las 'gro ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sprul pa dang 'gro ba dang / de las 'gro ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Going is of three types:

original: lus mgyogs pa can dang mos pa can dang yid myur ba'o //🔽ston pa la /🔽yid myur 'gro ba /
analyzed: lus mgyogs pa can dang mos pa can dang yid myur ba'o // ston pa la / yid myur 'gro ba /

original: yid bzhin du myur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yid bzhin du myur ba'i phyir te /

original: gzhan dag gi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi ni ma yin te /

analyzed: yul shin tu thag ring por yang thugs bskyed pa tsam gyis byon pa'i phyir ro //

translated: This is why the Bhagavat said, “The domain of the Buddhas is inconceivable.

original: gzhan dag la /
analyzed: gzhan dag la /

original: mgyogs pa can dang mos can yang /
analyzed: mgyogs pa can dang mos can yang /

analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi lus mgyogs pa can gyis 'gro ba ni /
translated: The swift is the Śrāvaka and the Pratyekabuddha, because their body moves quickly,

original: bya ba bzhin du rim gyis lus mgyogs par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba bzhin du rim gyis lus mgyogs par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mos pa can ni thag ring po la nye bar mos nas 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The faithful is the Bodhisattva, because he goes by the faith of being near to the distant.

original: sprul pa rnam pa gnyis te 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'o //🔽de la re zhig /'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa ni /
analyzed: sprul pa rnam pa gnyis te 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa'o // de la re zhig /'dod par gtogs pa'i sprul pa ni /
translated: Emanation is of two kinds: of the realm of desire and of the realm of form.

original: phyi'i skye mched bzhi /
analyzed: phyi'i skye mched bzhi /
translated: Emanation of the realm of desire is of four external sense-spheres.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa ni sgra'i skye mched ma gtogs pa gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i skye mched kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa ni sgra'i skye mched ma gtogs pa gzugs dang dri dang ro dang reg bya'i skye mched kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The emanation of the realm of desire is of the nature of the sense-sphere of visible form, odor, taste and tangible.

original: de yang rnam gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam gnyis te /
translated: It is of two kinds:

original: de yang bdag dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: de yang bdag dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel ba'o //
translated: It is related to one's own body and to the body of another.

original: gzugs gtogs gnyis /🔽gzugs su gtogs pa'i sprul pa ni /
analyzed: gzugs gtogs gnyis / gzugs su gtogs pa'i sprul pa ni /
translated: Two in the realm of form.

original: de ni dri dang ro med pa'i phyir gzugs dang reg bya'i skye mched gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de ni dri dang ro med pa'i phyir gzugs dang reg bya'i skye mched gnyis yin no //
translated: The emanation of the realm of form is of the nature of the sense-sphere of visible form and the sense-sphere of tangibility.

original: de yang de bzhin du rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin du rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: It is also of two kinds, as above.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams dag gi sprul pa de rnam pa bzhi yin pa ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams dag gi sprul pa de rnam pa bzhi yin pa ltar /
translated: Just as the emanation of the realm of desire is of four kinds,

original: gzugs kyi khams dag gi yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dag gi yang de bzhin te /
translated: so also is that of the realm of form.

original: de ltar na mdor bsdu na @254a * //
analyzed: de ltar na mdor bsdu na @254a * //
translated: Thus, in brief,

original: sprul pa ni rnam pa brgyad yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa ni rnam pa brgyad yin no //
translated: there are eight kinds of emanation.

original: ji ltar na gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa 'dod ba'i khams na spyod pa sprul par byed pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa 'dod ba'i khams na spyod pa sprul par byed pa na /
translated: How is it that when one born in the realm of form emanates an emanation that experiences the realm of desire,

original: dri dang ro dang ldan par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dri dang ro dang ldan par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: it does not possess odor and taste?

original: gos dang rgyan bzhin du mi ldan no //
analyzed: gos dang rgyan bzhin du mi ldan no //
translated: They are not associated with the body as clothing or ornaments.

original: kha cig na re skye mched gnyis sprul par byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re skye mched gnyis sprul par byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: Two sense spheres are emanated.

original: yang ci mngon par shes pa kho nas sprul pa sprul par byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci mngon par shes pa kho nas sprul pa sprul par byed dam zhe na /
translated: Is it only through the higher perceptions that emanations are emanated?

original: smras pa / ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: ji ltar zhe na /🔽mngon par shes pa'i 'bras bu /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / mngon par shes pa'i 'bras bu /
translated: How is it?🔽The result of the higher perceptions

original: sprul sems dag gis /
analyzed: sprul sems dag gis /
translated: is the emanation mind.

original: de dag rnams ni bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: de dag rnams ni bcu bzhi'o //
translated: They are fourteen.

original: sprul pa'i sems bcu bzhi po de dag ni /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems bcu bzhi po de dag ni /
translated: Those fourteen emanation minds🔽are the result of two dhyanas,

original: bsam gtan 'bras gnyis nas lnga'i bar //
analyzed: bsam gtan 'bras gnyis nas lnga'i bar //
translated: up to the fifth.

original: rim bzhin bsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i sprul pa'i sems dang gnyis yin no //
analyzed: rim bzhin bsam gtan dang po'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa'i sprul pa'i sems dang gnyis yin no //
translated: The result of the first absorption is two: the emanation mind of the desire realm and the first absorption.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i ni gsum yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i ni gsum yin no //
translated: The result of the second absorption is three.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi'i sa dag la yang bzhi dang lngar sbyor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gsum pa dang bzhi'i sa dag la yang bzhi dang lngar sbyor ro //
translated: Similarly, the result of the third and fourth absorptions is four and five respectively.

original: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu sprul pa'i sems ni ;
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi 'bras bu sprul pa'i sems ni ;
translated: The emanation mind that is the result of the absorptions🔽is the result of the absorptions alone.

original: rang gis pa dang sa 'og ma pa'i yin par rig par bya'o //🔽rim bzhin gong ma las skye min //
analyzed: rang gis pa dang sa 'og ma pa'i yin par rig par bya'o // rim bzhin gong ma las skye min //
translated: It should be understood that the emanation mind of a lower level is the homogeneous cause of the emanation mind of its own level and a higher level.

original: bsam gtan 'og ma'i 'bras bu sa gong ma pa'i sprul pa'i sems ni med do //
analyzed: bsam gtan 'og ma'i 'bras bu sa gong ma pa'i sprul pa'i sems ni med do //
translated: The emanation mind of a lower level is not the homogeneous cause of the emanation mind of a higher level.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa las 'gro ba'i sgo nas khyad par du 'phags so //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sprul pa dang / bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa las 'gro ba'i sgo nas khyad par du 'phags so //
translated: The emanation mind of the second absorption and so on is superior to the emanation mind of the desire realm and the first absorption in terms of its movement.

original: de rnyed bsam gtan bzhin /
analyzed: de rnyed bsam gtan bzhin /
translated: Obtaining it is like the absorptions.

original: sprul pa'i sems de dag gi rnyed pa ni bsam gtan bzhin no //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems de dag gi rnyed pa ni bsam gtan bzhin no //
translated: Obtaining the emanation mind is like the absorptions.

original: yang ci sprul pa'i sems kho na las ldang bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci sprul pa'i sems kho na las ldang bar 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Does one arise from the emanation mind alone?

original: de ni med de /
analyzed: de ni med de /
translated: No, one does not.

original: gang gi phyir de ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni /
translated: Because it arises

original: dag dang bdag las /
analyzed: dag dang bdag las /
translated: from pure and emanating minds.

original: skye ste sprul pa'i sems ni bsam gtan dag pa'am /
analyzed: skye ste sprul pa'i sems ni bsam gtan dag pa'am /
translated: The emanation mind arises from pure and emanating minds.

original: sprul pa'i sems ni mjug thogs shig las skye'i gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems ni mjug thogs shig las skye'i gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: The emanation mind arises from the mind immediately preceding it alone, it does not arise from other minds.

original: de las gnyis /
analyzed: de las gnyis /
translated: Two arise from it.

original: sprul pa'i sems la skyang bsam gtan dag pa dang sprul pa'i sems skye ste /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems la skyang bsam gtan dag pa dang sprul pa'i sems skye ste /
translated: The pure meditative attainment and the emanating mind can arise from the emanating mind.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not arise from other minds.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu la gnas pa yang /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu la gnas pa yang /
translated: One who is abiding in the result of meditative attainment

original: ting nge 'dzin la ma zhugs par de las ldang ba ni med do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la ma zhugs par de las ldang ba ni med do //
translated: does not arise from meditative attainment without entering meditative attainment.

original: sprul pa thams cad kyang /
analyzed: sprul pa thams cad kyang /
translated: All emanations

original: rang gis pas sprul bar byed /
analyzed: rang gis pas sprul bar byed /
translated: are emanated by the same level.

original: sa gzhan pa'i sprul pa'i sems kyis gzhan pa'i sprul pa ni sprul bar mi byed do //
analyzed: sa gzhan pa'i sprul pa'i sems kyis gzhan pa'i sprul pa ni sprul bar mi byed do //
translated: An emanating mind of one level does not emanate an emanation of another level.

original: smrar 'jug pas ni 'og mas kyang //
analyzed: smrar 'jug pas ni 'og mas kyang //
translated: Those of lower level are caused to speak by those of higher level.

original: kyang gi sgras ni sa pas kyang smrar 'jug go zhes bya ba'i @254b tha tshig go //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni sa pas kyang smrar 'jug go zhes bya ba'i @254b tha tshig go //
translated: The word also in the verse indicates that those of the same level also cause emanations of lower level to speak.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i sprul pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang po'i sprul pa ni /
translated: Emanations of the desire realm and the first absorption

original: rang gi sa pa'i sems nyid kyis smrar 'jug go //
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i sems nyid kyis smrar 'jug go //
translated: are caused to speak by the mind of their own level.

original: de'i gong na rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa'i phyir sa gong ma pa rnams ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pas smrar 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i gong na rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar byed pa'i phyir sa gong ma pa rnams ni bsam gtan dang po'i sa pas smrar 'jug go //
translated: Those of higher levels are caused to speak by the mind of the first absorption, because the mind of higher levels motivates manifest verbal action.

original: sprul pa mang po rnams smar 'jug go //🔽ston min sprul ba bo nyid bcas //
analyzed: sprul pa mang po rnams smar 'jug go // ston min sprul ba bo nyid bcas //
translated: The many emanations speak when the principal one speaks.🔽The emanation of another Buddha speaks when the principal one speaks.

original: sangs rgyas las gzhan pa'i sprul pa ni sprul pa bo dang bcas te smras pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas las gzhan pa'i sprul pa ni sprul pa bo dang bcas te smras pa /
translated: The emanation of another Buddha speaks when the principal one speaks.

original: gang gi tshe sprul pa mang po yin pa de'i tshe gang cig car du smra'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sprul pa mang po yin pa de'i tshe gang cig car du smra'o //
translated: When there are many emanations, they all speak at the same time.

original: tshigs su bcad pa las kyang /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las kyang /
translated: A verse in the Prajñāptiśāstra says:

original: gcig gis smra bar byed pa na /
analyzed: gcig gis smra bar byed pa na /
translated: When one speaks,

original: sprul ba thams cad smra bar byed //
analyzed: sprul ba thams cad smra bar byed //
translated: all the emanations speak.🔽When one is silent,

original: gcig mi smra bar gyur pa dang / thams cad smra bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gcig mi smra bar gyur pa dang / thams cad smra bar mi 'gyur ro // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: all are silent.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa ni snga phyi ji ltar bzhed bar smra'o //🔽gang gi tshe smrar 'jug pa'i sems yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa ni snga phyi ji ltar bzhed bar smra'o // gang gi tshe smrar 'jug pa'i sems yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: The emanations of the Blessed Buddhas speak when the principal one speaks or when he does not speak, as he wishes.🔽When the principal one speaks, the emanations speak.

original: sprul pa'i sems med na ji ltar na de smrar 'jug ce na /🔽byin gyis brlabs nas gzhan 'jug phyir ;
analyzed: sprul pa'i sems med na ji ltar na de smrar 'jug ce na / byin gyis brlabs nas gzhan 'jug phyir ;
translated: But if the mind of emanation does not exist at the same time as the mind that causes the emanation to speak, how can the emanation speak?🔽Because the principal one empowers the emanation so that it speaks when he is silent.

original: sprul pa gnas par 'dod pas byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: sprul pa gnas par 'dod pas byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: The principal one empowers the emanation so that it remains for a certain time and speaks when he is silent.

original: rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed kun nas slong bar /
translated: and the motivating instigator of indicative form.🔽

original: byed pa'i sems gzhan gyi ngag 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: byed pa'i sems gzhan gyi ngag 'jug par byed do //
translated: The speech of another person is caused to speak by a thought that instigates the informative action.

original: ja gson po 'ba' zhig la byin rlabs rjes su 'jug gam 'on te shi ba la yang yod ce na /
analyzed: ja gson po 'ba' zhig la byin rlabs rjes su 'jug gam 'on te shi ba la yang yod ce na /
translated: Does the consecration of the body exist only in the case of a living being or also in the case of a dead person?

original: shi ba la yang byin rlabs yod //
analyzed: shi ba la yang byin rlabs yod //
translated: The consecration of the dead exists.

original: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis de'i rus pa'i rus gong gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis de'i rus pa'i rus gong gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bones of the body of the noble Mahākāśyapa have not perished through the consecration of the noble Mahākāśyapa.

original: de yang mi bstan min /
analyzed: de yang mi bstan min /
translated: But it is not a visible form.

original: mi bstan pa'i dngos po la ni byin gyi rlabs med de /
analyzed: mi bstan pa'i dngos po la ni byin gyi rlabs med de /
translated: The consecration does not exist in a nonvisible form.

original: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen pos sha la sogs pa la byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen pos sha la sogs pa la byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bones of the body of the noble Mahākāśyapa are not consecrated by flesh, etc.

original: gzhan min gzhan dag na re de ni shi ba la byin gyi rlabs med kyi /
analyzed: gzhan min gzhan dag na re de ni shi ba la byin gyi rlabs med kyi /
translated: Others say: The consecration of the dead does not exist.

original: rus ba'i rus gong gnas pa ni //
analyzed: rus ba'i rus gong gnas pa ni //
translated: The bones of the body of the noble Mahākāśyapa remain

original: lhas byin gyis brlabs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lhas byin gyis brlabs pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because they are consecrated by the gods.

original: ci sems gcig gis sprul pa gcig kho nar sprul par byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci sems gcig gis sprul pa gcig kho nar sprul par byed dam zhe na /
translated: Does one emanation arise from one thought?

original: dbang po gcig ni du ma ste //
analyzed: dbang po gcig ni du ma ste //
translated: One sense faculty is multiple.

original: byang bar gyur nas bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: byang bar gyur nas bzlog pa'o //
translated: When the mastery of the superknowledge is complete, it is the opposite.

original: dang po kho na'i sprul pa gcig ni sprul pa'i sems du mas sprul bar byed do //
analyzed: dang po kho na'i sprul pa gcig ni sprul pa'i sems du mas sprul bar byed do //
translated: At the beginning, one emanation is created by many minds of emanation.

original: mngon par shes pa byang nas ni sems gcig gis kyang ji srid du sprul par 'dod par sprul pa du ma sprul par byed do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa byang nas ni sems gcig gis kyang ji srid du sprul par 'dod par sprul pa du ma sprul par byed do //
translated: When the mastery of the superknowledge is complete, by a single mind one creates many emanations, as many as one wishes.

original: yang ci sprul pa'i sems thams cad lung dum bstan pa yin nam zhe na /🔽bsgom las skyes @255a * //
analyzed: yang ci sprul pa'i sems thams cad lung dum bstan pa yin nam zhe na / bsgom las skyes @255a * //
translated: Is every mind of emanation a neutral mind?

original: pa lung ma bstan //
analyzed: pa lung ma bstan //
translated: The emanation arisen from meditation is neutral.

original: bsgom pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni nges par lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de ni nges par lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The emanation arisen from meditation is necessarily neutral.

original: skye ba las skyes rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: skye ba las skyes rnam gsum mo //
translated: That arisen from birth is of three types.

original: skye bas thob pa lha dang klu dang sha za la sogs pa'i sems ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skye bas thob pa lha dang klu dang sha za la sogs pa'i sems ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: The mind of emanation of gods, nagas, piśācas, etc., obtained through birth, is good, bad, or neutral.

original: de dag gis byas pa'i sprul pa /
analyzed: de dag gis byas pa'i sprul pa /
translated: The emanation created by them

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa ni /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi lus dang 'brel pa ni /
translated: is related to the body of the creator or to the body of another.

original: sgra med pa'i gzugs kyi skye mched yin pa'i phyir skye mched dgu pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra med pa'i gzugs kyi skye mched yin pa'i phyir skye mched dgu pa yin te /
translated: It is the ninth sense sphere, because it is the sense sphere of visible form that is not derived from the fundamental material elements.

original: dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a sense faculty, because it is not distinct from the sense faculty.

original: dbang po ni sprul par mi byed do //
analyzed: dbang po ni sprul par mi byed do //
translated: The sense faculty does not emanate.

original: ci bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / skye bas thob pa'i rdzu 'phrul rnam gnyis kho nar zad dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci bsgoms pa las byung ba dang / skye bas thob pa'i rdzu 'phrul rnam gnyis kho nar zad dam zhe na /
translated: Are the supernormal creations of those born from the womb and of the spontaneously generated only of two kinds, i.e., derived from meditation and innate?

original: de rnam gnyis /
analyzed: de rnam gnyis /
translated: They are of two kinds.🔽Supernormal creations are of five kinds:

original: sngags sman las las skyes pa dang // rdzu 'phrul rnam pa lnga yin no //
analyzed: sngags sman las las skyes pa dang // rdzu 'phrul rnam pa lnga yin no //
translated: derived from mantra, from medicine, and from action.

original: rdzu 'phrul ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga'o zhes brjod de /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lnga'o zhes brjod de /
translated: In brief, supernormal creations are of five kinds:

original: bsgom pa'i 'bras bu dang skye bas thob pa dang / gsang sngags las skyes pa dang / sman las skyes pa dang / las las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i 'bras bu dang skye bas thob pa dang / gsang sngags las skyes pa dang / sman las skyes pa dang / las las skyes pa ste /
translated: derived from meditation, innate, derived from mantra, derived from medicine, and derived from action.

original: dper na nga las nu dang / srid pa bar ma pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nga las nu dang / srid pa bar ma pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the supernormal creations of Mandhatr, of beings in the intermediate existence, etc.

original: lha'i mig dang rna ba bshad pa gang yin pa de dag ci lha'i kho na yin no //
analyzed: lha'i mig dang rna ba bshad pa gang yin pa de dag ci lha'i kho na yin no //
translated: Are the divine eye and the divine ear that have been explained only divine?

original: 'on te byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i khyim bdag rin po che rnams kyi bzhin du lha'i dang 'dra bas na lha'i zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'khor los sgyur ba'i khyim bdag rin po che rnams kyi bzhin du lha'i dang 'dra bas na lha'i zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Divine eye and ear

original: lha yi mig dang rna ba ste /
analyzed: lha yi mig dang rna ba ste /
translated: are the eyes and ears of the absorptions.

original: gang gi phyir de gnyis /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de gnyis /
translated: Because they are the eyes and ears of the absorptions.

original: bsam gtan sa pa'i gzugs dang / bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa sgra dang snang ba la gtod pa'i sbyor bas bsam gtan gyis pa'i 'byung ba rnams rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang ba /
analyzed: bsam gtan sa pa'i gzugs dang / bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pa sgra dang snang ba la gtod pa'i sbyor bas bsam gtan gyis pa'i 'byung ba rnams rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang ba /
translated: They are form derived from the primary elements of the absorptions, since they are generated by the preparatory application of those who enter meditative attainment on the absorptions and focus on sound and form.

original: gzugs dang sgra dag mthong ba dang thos pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i mig dang rna ba'i nyen kor du mngon par grub ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra dag mthong ba dang thos pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i mig dang rna ba'i nyen kor du mngon par grub ste /
translated: They are eyes and ears that are the cause of seeing form and hearing sound and are established in the vicinity of the eyes and ears.

original: de lta bas na bsam gtan gyis pa yin pa'i phyir mig dang rnam ba de dag ni lha'i kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na bsam gtan gyis pa yin pa'i phyir mig dang rnam ba de dag ni lha'i kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, because they are derived from the absorptions, those eyes and ears are divine alone.

original: de gnyis kyang /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang /
translated: Those two

original: rtag dang brten bcas ma tshang med /
analyzed: rtag dang brten bcas ma tshang med /
translated: are constant, supported, complete,

original: thag ring phral sogs spyod yul //
analyzed: thag ring phral sogs spyod yul //
translated: and their domain is distant, subtle, and so on.

original: lha'i mig dang rna ba ni rtag tu rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir de'i brten pa dang bcas pa med do //
analyzed: lha'i mig dang rna ba ni rtag tu rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir de'i brten pa dang bcas pa med do //
translated: The divine eye and ear are always associated with consciousness, thus they are not supported by a faculty.

original: nor ba med pa'i phyir dbang po ma tshang ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: nor ba med pa'i phyir dbang po ma tshang ba yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not incomplete faculties, because they are not defective.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i sems can bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i sems can bzhin no //
translated: They are like the sentient beings in the form realm.

original: de gnyis kyi yul ni gzugs dang sgra thar ring ba dang phra ba dang / bsgribs pa rnams kyang yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi yul ni gzugs dang sgra thar ring ba dang phra ba dang / bsgribs pa rnams kyang yin no //
translated: Their objects are distant, subtle, and obscured forms and sounds.

original: 'dir @255b smras pa /🔽gang phyir sha yi mig gis gzugs //
analyzed: 'dir @255b smras pa / gang phyir sha yi mig gis gzugs //
translated: Here, some say:

original: thag ring ba dang bsgribs pa dang // phra dang thams cad mi mthong la //
analyzed: thag ring ba dang bsgribs pa dang // phra dang thams cad mi mthong la //
translated: The fleshly eye does not see distant, obscured, and subtle forms.

original: lha yis mthong bar 'dod phyir ro //🔽lha'i mig gis thag ji srid cig mthong zhe na /
analyzed: lha yis mthong bar 'dod phyir ro // lha'i mig gis thag ji srid cig mthong zhe na /
translated: Because it is asserted that the divine eye sees.🔽How far does the divine eye see?

original: gang gi mig ji lta bu yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi mig ji lta bu yin pa ste /
translated: It sees as far as the eye of that realm.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par stong gcig dang / stong gnyis dang / stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang sangs rgyas rnams ni mngon par 'du byed pa med par stong gcig dang / stong gnyis dang / stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams dag mthong ngo //
translated: The Sravakas, Pratyekabuddhas and Buddhas, without preparatory exercise, see one, two and three chiliocosms respectively.

original: mngon par 'du byed pas ni /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pas ni /
translated: With preparatory exercise,

original: dgra bcom bse ru ston pa yis //
analyzed: dgra bcom bse ru ston pa yis //
translated: the Arhats, the rhinoceroses and the Masters

original: stong gnyis gsum dang grangs med mthong //🔽mngon par 'du byas na nyan thos chen pos ni stong gnyis pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag mthong ngo //
analyzed: stong gnyis gsum dang grangs med mthong // mngon par 'du byas na nyan thos chen pos ni stong gnyis pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams dag mthong ngo //
translated: see two, three and innumerable universes.🔽The great Sravakas, with preparatory exercise, see a small chiliocosm.

original: bse ru lta bus ni stong gsum mthong ngo //
analyzed: bse ru lta bus ni stong gsum mthong ngo //
translated: The Pratyekabuddhas see a medium chiliocosm.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ni ji tsam bzhed par 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa dag gzigs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis ni ji tsam bzhed par 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa dag gzigs so //
translated: The Buddhas, Bhagavats, see innumerable universes, as much as they want to see.

original: ci rdzu 'phrul 'ba' zhig skye bas 'thob pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci rdzu 'phrul 'ba' zhig skye bas 'thob pa yin nam /
translated: Is the supernormal knowledge of the divine eye obtained through birth, like the divine eye of beings?

original: 'on te gzhan dag kyang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan dag kyang yin zhe na /
translated: Or is it acquired?

original: gzhan yang skye bas 'thob //
analyzed: gzhan yang skye bas 'thob //
translated: It is also acquired.

original: lha'i rna ba la sogs pa bzhi yang skye bas 'thob pa yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba la sogs pa bzhi yang skye bas 'thob pa yang yod mod kyi /
translated: The four higher perceptions of divine ear, etc. are also obtained from birth.

original: skye bas thob pa'i ni cung zad kyang mngon par shes pa'i ming mi 'thob po //
analyzed: skye bas thob pa'i ni cung zad kyang mngon par shes pa'i ming mi 'thob po //
translated: But that obtained from birth does not obtain the name of higher perception.

original: skye bas thob pa'i lha'i mig gang yin pa /
analyzed: skye bas thob pa'i lha'i mig gang yin pa /
translated: The divine eye obtained from birth

original: des ni / srid pa bar ma mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: des ni / srid pa bar ma mi mthong ngo //
translated: does not see the intermediate existence.

original: srid pa bar ma ni mngon par shes pa'i mig kho nas mthong gi skye bas thob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma ni mngon par shes pa'i mig kho nas mthong gi skye bas thob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The intermediate existence is seen only by the eye of higher perception, not by that obtained from birth.

original: sems shes de ni rnam pa gsum //🔽skye bas thob ces bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: sems shes de ni rnam pa gsum // skye bas thob ces bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The knowledge of others' minds is of three types.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa skye bas thob pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa skye bas thob pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of others' minds obtained from birth

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya'o //
translated: is to be known as of three types: virtuous, nonvirtuous, and neutral.

original: rtog dang rig sngags byas gang spang //
analyzed: rtog dang rig sngags byas gang spang //
translated: That which is abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of cultivation🔽is not obtained from birth.

original: gang dag rtog pa po'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa mtshan ma can rnams dang / rig sngags kyis byas pa gang yin pa de dag kyang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /🔽ji ltar bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dge ba kho na yin pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang dag rtog pa po'i pha rol gyi sems shes pa mtshan ma can rnams dang / rig sngags kyis byas pa gang yin pa de dag kyang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste / ji ltar bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dge ba kho na yin pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another which is produced by a cause of this type, namely, the knowledge of the mind of another acquired through meditation, is of three types.🔽The knowledge of the mind of another which is produced by a cause of this type, namely, the knowledge of the mind of another acquired through meditation, is of three types.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa skye bas thob pa dag gis ni /🔽dmyal ba pas ni dang po shes //🔽ji srid du sdug bsngal gyis mnyen pa de sred du shes so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa skye bas thob pa dag gis ni / dmyal ba pas ni dang po shes // ji srid du sdug bsngal gyis mnyen pa de sred du shes so //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another which is produced by a cause of this type, namely, the knowledge of the mind of another acquired through meditation, is of three types.

original: 'gro ba gzhan dag na gnas pas ni rtag tu shes so //🔽mi las skye bas thob pa med //
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan dag na gnas pas ni rtag tu shes so // mi las skye bas thob pa med //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another which is produced by a cause of this type, namely, the knowledge of the mind of another acquired through meditation, is of three types.🔽The knowledge of the mind of another which is produced by a cause of this type, namely, the knowledge of the mind of another acquired through meditation, is of three types.🔽The knowledge of the mind of another which is produced by a cause of this type, namely, the knowledge of the mind of another acquired through meditation, is of three types.

original: mi rnams la ni rdzu 'phrul @256a * //🔽la sogs pa ji skad du bshad pa rnams skye bas 'thob pa med do //🔽'o na rang bzhin gyis tshe rabs dran pa gang yin pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: mi rnams la ni rdzu 'phrul @256a * //🔽la sogs pa ji skad du bshad pa rnams skye bas 'thob pa med do //🔽'o na rang bzhin gyis tshe rabs dran pa gang yin pa de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another which

original: de dag gi ni las kyi khyad par las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi ni las kyi khyad par las skyes pa yin te /
translated: They arise from the specific karma of sentient beings.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa ni /
translated: Recollection of past lives

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dang / skye bas thob pa dang / las las skyes pa dang / rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu dang / skye bas thob pa dang / las las skyes pa dang / rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: is the result of meditation, obtained from birth, arisen from karma, and of three types.

original: ye shes kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: ye shes kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of knowledge,

original: ye shes kyi rgyu las byung ba'i yon tan rnams ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rgyu las byung ba'i yon tan rnams ni bshad zin to //
translated: the qualities that arise from the cause of knowledge have already been explained.

original: chos mngon pa mdzod kyi 'grel pa mdo dang mthun pa las ye shes bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas bdun pa'o /
analyzed: chos mngon pa mdzod kyi 'grel pa mdo dang mthun pa las ye shes bstan pa zhes bya ba mdzod kyi gnas bdun pa'o /
translated: This completes the seventh chapter of the Abhidharmakośabhāṣya called “The Exposition of Knowledge.”

original: // / da ni rang bzhin gzhan rnams brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / da ni rang bzhin gzhan rnams brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now the other natures will be discussed.

original: dang po nyid du yon tan thams cad kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir bsam gtan rnams las brtsams te /
analyzed: dang po nyid du yon tan thams cad kyi gzhi yin pa'i phyir bsam gtan rnams las brtsams te /
translated: Since concentration is the basis of all qualities, it is discussed first.

original: bsam gtan rnams ni rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni rnam pa gnyis //
translated: Concentration is twofold.

original: bsam gtam rnams ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: bsam gtam rnams ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief, concentration is twofold:

original: skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: the concentration of birth and the concentration of meditative equipoise.

original: de dag kyang bzhi /
analyzed: de dag kyang bzhi /
translated: They are also four.

original: bsam gtan dang po nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar ro //
translated: The first meditation is from the first meditation up to the fourth meditation.

original: de la skye ba'i bsam gtan brjod //
analyzed: de la skye ba'i bsam gtan brjod //
translated: The meditation of birth is mentioned.

original: de 'jig rten pa'i mdzod kyi gnas su ji skad du bshad ce na /
analyzed: de 'jig rten pa'i mdzod kyi gnas su ji skad du bshad ce na /
translated: What is said in the chapter on the worldly treasuries?

original: der so so'i /
analyzed: der so so'i /
translated: There, each one

original: bsam gtan la ni sa gsum pa //
analyzed: bsam gtan la ni sa gsum pa //
translated: has three stages.

original: bzhi pa la ni sa brgyad pa //
analyzed: bzhi pa la ni sa brgyad pa //
translated: The fourth has eight stages.

original: zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i bsam gtan brjod par bya ste /
translated: The meditation of equipoise should be mentioned.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: snyoms 'jug dge ba rtse gcig ste /
analyzed: snyoms 'jug dge ba rtse gcig ste /
translated: Equipoise is virtuous one-pointedness.

original: bye brag med par na dge ba'i sems rtse gcig par ni bsam gtan yin te /
analyzed: bye brag med par na dge ba'i sems rtse gcig par ni bsam gtan yin te /
translated: In general, meditation is a virtuous one-pointed mind,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of concentration.

original: rjes su 'brang bcas phung po lnga //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang bcas phung po lnga //
translated: With its following, it has the nature of five aggregates.

original: 'khor dang bcas pa ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas pa ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that with its retinue, it has the nature of five aggregates.

original: yang dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa'i bsam gtan dang po ni ji lta bu /
analyzed: yang dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa'i bsam gtan dang po ni ji lta bu /
translated: What is the first meditation of virtuous one-pointed mind?

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar ni ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar ni ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the fourth meditation like?

original: re zhig dang po ni /
analyzed: re zhig dang po ni /
translated: First,

original: dpyod dang dga' dang bde dang ldan //
analyzed: dpyod dang dga' dang bde dang ldan //
translated: the first meditation is associated with investigation, joy, and pleasure.

original: dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa'i bsam gtan dang po ni dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa'i bsam gtan dang po ni dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: The first meditation is a virtuous, one-pointed mind that is associated with investigation, joy, and pleasure.

original: dpyod pa zhes smos pas rtog pa yang bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: dpyod pa zhes smos pas rtog pa yang bshad pa yin te /
translated: Since investigation is mentioned, it also explains conception.

original: lhan cig dpyod pa'i phyir du ba dang me bzhin no //
analyzed: lhan cig dpyod pa'i phyir du ba dang me bzhin no //
translated: Because they are investigated together, they are like smoke and fire.

original: rtog pa med par ni dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa'i dpyod pa med do //
analyzed: rtog pa med par ni dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan pa'i dpyod pa med do //
translated: Without conception, there is no investigation associated with joy and pleasure.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa ni /
translated: The third meditation

original: @256b yan lag lnga lnga spangs pa ni //
analyzed: @256b yan lag lnga lnga spangs pa ni //
translated: is free of five limbs.

original: dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The third meditation is a virtuous, one-pointed mind that is free of five limbs.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa ni dpyod pa spangs pa la dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa ni dpyod pa spangs pa la dga' ba dang bde ba dang ldan no //
translated: The second meditation is free of investigation and is associated with joy and pleasure.

original: gsum pa ni dga' ba spangs la dge ba dang ldan no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dga' ba spangs la dge ba dang ldan no //
translated: The third is free of joy and is associated with virtue.

original: bzhi pa ni dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba spangs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni dpyod pa dang dga' ba dang bde ba spangs pa'o //
translated: The fourth is free of investigation, joy, and pleasure.

original: bsam gtan rnams ni ji lta bar /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni ji lta bar /
translated: Just as there are four meditations,

original: de bzhin gzugs med /
analyzed: de bzhin gzugs med /
translated: so there are four formless states.

original: rnam pa gang gis na /🔽de dag ni skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams pa gnyis kyang yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis na / de dag ni skye ba dang snyoms par 'jug pa rnams pa gnyis kyang yin la /
translated: By what mode?🔽They are both the two kinds of birth and the four formless meditative attainments.

original: bzhi yang yin te de dag gi yang skye ba ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: bzhi yang yin te de dag gi yang skye ba ni bshad zin to //
translated: Their birth has already been explained.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i gzugs med pa ni bye brag med par dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i gzugs med pa ni bye brag med par dge ba'i sems rtse gcig pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The formless meditative attainments are, in general, the nature of a virtuous, single-pointed mind.

original: de ltar na rnam pa de dag gis so //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa de dag gis so //
translated: Thus, they are distinguished in these modes.

original: 'khor dang bcas na ni phung po bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas na ni phung po bzhi ste /
translated: If they are considered together with their retinue, they are the four aggregates.

original: rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no form in the formless realm.

original: 'og ma'i sa las dben las skyes //
analyzed: 'og ma'i sa las dben las skyes //
translated: The formless are born from separation from lower levels.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa las dben pa las skyes pa ni nam mkha' yas skye mched yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa las dben pa las skyes pa ni nam mkha' yas skye mched yin no //
translated: The base of infinite space is born from separation from the fourth absorption.

original: de las dben pa las skyes pa ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched yin no //
analyzed: de las dben pa las skyes pa ni rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched yin no //
translated: The base of infinite consciousness is born from separation from that.

original: de las dben pa las skyes pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched yin no //
analyzed: de las dben pa las skyes pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched yin no //
translated: The base of nothingness is born from separation from that.

original: de las dben pa las skyes pa ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched yin no //
analyzed: de las dben pa las skyes pa ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched yin no //
translated: The fourth is the perception-sphere of neither-ideation-nor-non-ideation which is produced by the separation from the third.

original: de ltar na gzugs med pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzugs med pa bzhi yin no //
translated: Thus there are four formless meditative attainments.

original: dben pa zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: dben pa zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is meant by separation?

original: lam gang gis sa 'og ma las yid 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: lam gang gis sa 'og ma las yid 'byung ba ste /
translated: It is the path by which one separates from the lower stage,

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one goes to the state of non-attachment.

original: gzugs med pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: gzugs med pa de dag kyang /
translated: These formless meditative attainments

original: gzugs dang bral ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang bral ba zhes bya ste /
translated: are called “free from form”.

original: nye bar bsdogs pa gsum dang bcas //🔽nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la dmigs pa'i phyir de ni gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: nye bar bsdogs pa gsum dang bcas // nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi nyer bsdogs ni bsam gtan bzhi pa la dmigs pa'i phyir de ni gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba ma yin pas /
translated: They are accompanied by three preparatory stages.🔽The preparatory stage of the perception-sphere of infinite space does not receive the name “free from form” because it has the fourth meditation for its cognitive object.

original: gzugs dang bral pa zhes bya ba'i ming mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang bral pa zhes bya ba'i ming mi 'thob ste /
translated: It is not free from the ideation of form,

original: ma bral zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma bral zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but it is accompanied by the separation from form.

original: kha cig na re gzugs med pa dag na yang gzugs cung zad yod de /
analyzed: kha cig na re gzugs med pa dag na yang gzugs cung zad yod de /
translated: Some say that there is a little form in the formless realms,

original: chung zad ser ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: chung zad ser ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: just as there is a little yellow in a pigeon.

original: phung po bzhi zhes bshad pa gnag yin pa de ni re zhig gzugs med pa dag na gzugs med do zhes bya ba'i bsgrubs pa bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: phung po bzhi zhes bshad pa gnag yin pa de ni re zhig gzugs med pa dag na gzugs med do zhes bya ba'i bsgrubs pa bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: The four aggregates are the object of the designation of sentient being.🔽The four aggregates are the object of the designation of sentient being.🔽If form exists there, why is it called the formless realm?

original: gal te yod na ji ltar na gzugs med pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gal te yod na ji ltar na gzugs med pa zhes brjod do //
translated: If form exists there, why is it called the formless realm?

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: gzugs med ba na gzugs med do //🔽da ni ji ltar na de nas shi 'phos pa rnams kyi @257a * //
analyzed: gzugs med ba na gzugs med do // da ni ji ltar na de nas shi 'phos pa rnams kyi @257a * //
translated: there is no form in the formless realm.

original: gzugs bskal pa mi nyung ba zhig du gzugs rgyun chad pa las yang skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs bskal pa mi nyung ba zhig du gzugs rgyun chad pa las yang skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Now, how can form arise again from a continuum of form that has been interrupted for a long time, since those who die in the formless realm are reborn in the desire realm?

original: gzugs ni sems las skye /
analyzed: gzugs ni sems las skye /
translated: Form arises from mind.

original: gzugs ni de'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyus yongs su bsgos pa'i sems 'du 'phrod rnyed pa las skye'o //
analyzed: gzugs ni de'i rnam par smin pa'i rgyus yongs su bsgos pa'i sems 'du 'phrod rnyed pa las skye'o //
translated: Form arises from the mind that obtains the union of the two, the mind that is fully infused by the cause of its karmic maturation.

original: de ni thal zin to //
analyzed: de ni thal zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.

original: 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: This should be stated.🔽Are the bases of infinite space, etc., called that because they focus on space, etc.?

original: ci nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa de dag nam mkha' la sogs pa nyid la dmigs pas de'i phyir ming de skad ces bya'am zhen ma yin te /
analyzed: ci nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa de dag nam mkha' la sogs pa nyid la dmigs pas de'i phyir ming de skad ces bya'am zhen ma yin te /
translated: No, they are not.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: re zhig gsum ni /🔽de bzhin / spyir phyir nam mkha' mtha' yas dang // rnam shes mtha' yas ci yang med //
analyzed: re zhig gsum ni / de bzhin / spyir phyir nam mkha' mtha' yas dang // rnam shes mtha' yas ci yang med //
translated: The first three are:

original: ces bya nam mkha' mtha' yas so //
analyzed: ces bya nam mkha' mtha' yas so //
translated: The first three are called the base of infinite space,

original: rnam shes mtha' yas so //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas so //
translated: the base of infinite consciousness, and the base of nothingness.🔽The fourth is called the base of neither discrimination nor non-discrimination.🔽The fourth is called the base of neither discrimination nor non-discrimination because it is inferior to the base of infinite consciousness and superior to the peak of cyclic existence.

original: chung  zad kyang med do zhes de ltar yid la byed cing de dag la rab tu sbyor bas de'i phyir de dag gi ming grangs bzhin du de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: chung  zad kyang med do zhes de ltar yid la byed cing de dag la rab tu sbyor bas de'i phyir de dag gi ming grangs bzhin du de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The base of infinite space is called the base of infinite space because it is the base in which one focuses on infinite space.

original: dman phyir 'du shes med 'du shes med pa'ang ma yin pa'o //🔽'du shes dman pa'i phyir 'du shes med /
analyzed: dman phyir 'du shes med 'du shes med pa'ang ma yin pa'o // 'du shes dman pa'i phyir 'du shes med /
translated: The base of infinite consciousness is called the base of infinite consciousness because it is the base in which one focuses on infinite consciousness.🔽The base of nothingness is called the base of nothingness because it is the base in which one focuses on the thought “There is nothing at all.”

original: 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'du shes med min skye mched ces bya ba ste /
translated: The base of neither discrimination nor nondiscrimination is called the base of neither discrimination nor nondiscrimination because discrimination is inferior there.🔽It is called the base of neither discrimination nor nondiscrimination because discrimination is inferior there.

original: 'du shes de ni gsal ba'ang ma yin la med pa kho na'ang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes de ni gsal ba'ang ma yin la med pa kho na'ang ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called the base of neither discrimination nor nondiscrimination because discrimination is neither clear nor nonexistent there.

original: de ltar snyoms 'jug dngos gzhi'i rdzas //
analyzed: de ltar snyoms 'jug dngos gzhi'i rdzas //
translated: The actual basis of meditative attainment
